author: C. Marvin
title: Awesome speaker, no lifespan
body: As far as Bluetooth speakers go, the UE Megaboom KICKS. I've owned two of these and have used them paired together and separately for about 2 years.These are compact enough to fit in the cup holders on my backpack, but they still pump out some serious volume across the spectrum. The bass is enough to not feel flat, but it could be a smidge deeper. The rest of the spectrum shines through.Where these speakers really hit the mark is when they're paired together. They pair in stereo so they have a left and right channel. I had them on opposite sides of a 25ish x 15ish room and it was the next best thing to having actual surround sound. I would place them in my backpack cupholders on opposite sides of one another when I longboarded and it was phenomenal.Here's the bad:They're inconsistent with charging, even when using the official UE charger. Sometimes they simply won't charge despite the charging light indicating it is. Sometimes that light won't even come on and you have to factory reset the device multiple times for it to work. Occasionally that won't even work, and trying days later the speaker miraculously works again. I can't explain it, but I've gone through two of these and they've both experienced this.Pairing both speakers together through the UE app is inconsistent at best. Pairing one speaker will sometimes unpair the other. It seldom worked on the first attempt. If you received a phone call while they both paired, one of the speakers would unpair and you'd have to undergo the pairing process through the app again. This was on an iPhone 7 Plus.This isn't that bad of an issue, but more of a pet peeve. Even if the device is turned completely down, the "device voice" for low battery will be at seemingly max volume as will be the chime that plays when you turn it on.The really bad:I left the speaker unattended while charging (my fault), and when I came back, the mini USB connector had MELTED INTO THE CHARGING PORT. The shielding around the wire and mini USB connector melted into the material around the port. It was so melted together it took a decent amount of effort with a knife to cut it away. I was not home when this occurred, but thankfully it didn't start a major fire and was cool to the touch when I found it. All products used were from the UE Megaboom box. There were no 3rd party components.All-in-all, I might actually purchase two of these again if the price drops. If it wasn't for the potential fire or the charging issues I've had with these, they would EASILY get five stars.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Do not update the firmware!!!
body: I would give this speaker 5 stars. Great sound, awesome functions. I was able to play through my Apple TV and also pair with my I-phone so when a call came in, I'd answer through the speakerphone and the music would seamlessly mute. Then I updated to the recommended latest firmware. Now I can't pair two devices. So I call their customer service. Really nice guy. He advises me to do a factory reset. Now the tap feature to forward songs doesn't work nor the double pair feature. I'm sending this one back to get a new one with the old firmware that works. Also looked online and the problems been around for a year or two. Logitech needs to fix their bugs.

author: Lesly Blasick
title: I am not sure why this happens but just plan ahead so that you are good to go other then that this is worth the ...
body: To start you get everything they say you will get from this thing and more the audio, wireless, ect. The only thing I wish was changed or made different was the way you charge it. Because the way it’s charged is you have to turn it upside down and most of the time you have to keep it on the charger unless you plan on the day or week you are going to use it. The reason you have to is cause at least from my experience the battery does not hold a charge very well so it’s depleted if you let it sit to long powerd off. I am not sure why this happens but just plan ahead so that you are good to go other then that this is worth the price but better when it goes on sell for a lot less.

author: DW
title: "shockproof"?  mine wasn't.
body: I liked the sound quality and volume, given the price point, battery life, and other features.  The device does seem to be quite resistant to water, but the claim that it's shock proof turned out to be untrue in my experience.  I used it while doing yard work, tubing down a river, as an extension of Amazon Alexa, and one fateful night, while in a hot tub.  Having it submerge in water that night, as with the river trip as mentioned, was no problem at all.  The issue turned out to be that a drop from a height of 3 feet (top edge of hot tub where it fell from is almost exactly 36 inches off the ground) to the concrete patio below was enough to make the device turn off and never turn on again.I looked up the shockproof claim and it's 1 meter (3.28 feet).  I also looked up the warranty and it's 2 years.  Being that mine was purchased mid-2017, I decided to see what Logitech (bought UE in 2008) support would do for me.  I read a good number of complaints online about online support (chat, email) and some suggestions to call phone support instead, so I started there.  I was on the phone with technical support for about 15-20 minutes before the rep said she had received approval to replace the device.  Another 10-15 minutes or so (33.5 minutes total) to wrap up shipping and notation.  I'm supposedly being sent a replacement device and am told I'll get an email in the next 24 hours with UPS shipping information.  If I don't update this review, it should be assumed that I received and am satisfied with the replacement.

author: Michael Carl Veedock
title: Bass blown after 1 month
body: I bought this because it was advertised to be the best choice for a solid bluetooth speaker.  The Bass is completely blown on mine, after one month.  I want to return this but I'm a week over my "return date".  If I turn the bass down all the way, its the only method I have of enjoying the music (of course the lack of any bass makes it less enjoyable).  I really am hoping to exchange this as I feel I received a lemon on this one.

author: Matthew Lurie
title: DO NOT BUY, STOPS WORKING AFTER 9 MONTHS
body: after only 9 months, the product has completely stopped working. it wont turn on regardless of having a full charge. and it has had zero use other than normal speaker wear-and-tear. i never took it near the water or anything. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT, SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO ELSEWHERE.

author: MaggieNYC
title: Does not work every time. Unreliable.
body: The speakers sound great (when they work). I bought mine to use for Christmas and loved the sound when I tested it to make sure they worked. I stored it in a case I bought specifically for the speaker. Next time I tried to use it the Bluetooth didn’t work and it made a crackling sound when I played music.I called Logitech and they said it was under warranty but the asked me to trouble shoot it myself. They kept asking me to do this then that. I just got tired of the emails back and forth. It’s was only three months since I bought it and only used it once to test it. It never worked as it should again. A total waste of time and money. Finally returned it to Amazon and got a partial refund. Would not recommend to anyone. Sounds great, but unreliable.

author: Mark W.
title: BEST SPEAKER EVER!!!
body: This speaker is WELL worth the money, it is soooo loud and works really well in long distances. The battery last me all day on a 14 hour shift, and it charges quicker then ANY battery I've ever chargedI Love THIS SPEAKER

author: Kyle
title: Buy new!
body: 1. Originally bought used from “sole providers”. It was half price so why not... well because it was too good to be true. The audio quality was crap. Not sure if the speaker was busted or a cheap replacement but crap all the same. Tried everything to improve the quality; no luck. So back it went. I’ve used a Megaboom and this was not the same experience. Return was fast but don’t waste your time unless you’re lucky and have time to waste.2. Bought new through amazon. Pretty much 2x as much but definitely worth $120. Exactly what I expected. All 5 stars.

author: L. Parry
title: Failed within a week
body: Bottom line:  couldn’t find the mega or the boom. It sounded ok at mid volume or so. Too much compression as you turn it up. I found I was using the EQ too much to try to make it sound better. It stopped pairing and charging within a week. Sent it back and went with my first instinct: Bose Revolve Plus. Couldn’t be happier. I wrote a review there too.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Solid sound with awesome features
body: Recently purchased this bad boy and my choice was between this and the Bose unit ($300). I listened to both devices and I believe you get the most bang for your buck with the Megaboom. The sound is solid. There is a slight break up in clarity if you max it out. I use the phone app to adjust the equalizer to "neutral" and that helps out clean up the sound. The unit is built to withstand shock and water. Something that was key to my purchase. I have yet to take it to the beach but am not worried about the sand since it is waterproof. The phone app is really cool and is easy to use. Integration with Alexa is convenient, easy and cool. If you're debating between this and the Megablast, I'd go with the Megaboom as I've heard the increase in volume isn't worth the loss of features that the Megaboom offers.

author: Louis R.
title: This is the junk after couple of months doesn't work ...
body: This is the junk after couple of months doesn't work or take a charge. Ongoing issues Lookout YouTube reviews and this is a big problem with these devices.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The sound via Bluetooth is Terrible after just over a year
body: I loved this when I bought it just over a year ago, but guess what? It's already malfunctioning. That's right. Unfortunately, for whatever reason the bluetooth doesn't work any more. Most of the time I can connect my laptop to this device via bluetooth, but sometimes I cannot. I've never been able to connect it to my iPod Touch via bluetooth, though. And recently the sound is terrible when I connect via bluetooth. The only way I can get decent sound now is to plug it in with a cable (not provided). That pretty much sucks because one of the big draws and reasons I got this is because it's BLUETOOTH.I need to look at the warranty and see if I can trade it in, maybe it's just a fluke. I hope so, because I was into this portable BLUETOOTH speaker when it was working properly.Ho hum.

author: J. Voigt
title: Like a Portable Big Speaker, Very Recommended!!
body: I absolutely enjoy using this speaker of any bluetooth really anything i've had over the years.  I used to have a boombox when i was younger, then various systems, bookshelf speakers when i was overseas and in dorms to keep things small.  But honestly, i just like how small and simple and good performing this speaker is.* I've never had connection problems with either an iphone or samsung note, nor the tablets or laptop - with or without the app (i will say the oldest one could not support the newer bluetooth format, but it was like a second generation tablet long before thwy were even a thing).* Long Battery Life I felt, but it throws a fit and will not play until a minimum charge is put on to reconnect and play while charging - that is a small bit annoying.*Simple buttons.  Volume buttons works great and don't accidentally get pushed really ever.It's tough and doesn't seem to mar or scratch easily.  I mean it really seems to take a use well.* The charge cable port will irritate you - and requires a slim headed cable.  They include this irridescent bright yellow cable i didn't care for that does fit though.  And it's an absolutely non-subtle unlike the speaker which didn't make any sense.  So that is a bit annoying,  ut you can shave the sides of any cable with a knife and make it work.* Battery life lasts a long time for the amount of volume i felt.

author: MP
title: App does not work properly with iPhones
body: The quality of the sound is quite good.  However, the volume falls to or close to "zero" with each new song. When I first received it, I thought that there was something about the software that I did. not understand.  I called customer service and they couldn't help me, so they suggested that I return it for a replacement.  I did this, and they replaced it, but the same thing happened.  I have gone online to try to understand the problem, and I have noted that many, many people have reported the same software problem for the iPhone.  The app has said -- every time I have opened it for the past several months -- that it is being upgraded, but nothing has changed.  I should have returned it again, but I got distracted  by life!  I cannot recommend this for anyone who has an iPhone.

author: Shayne S.
title: You will not regret buying this!
body: I LOVE this speaker! I’ve had a Bose soundlink since the first model came out and decided to try this out due to longer battery life, water resistant material, and durability (I’m outdoors a lot) and couldent be happier that I did. It’s not as loud as the JBL or crystal clear as the Bose but will last longer and withstand the elements.  The 360 clarity on this is amazing and fills a room with high quality sound. I can listen to both podcasts and music without having to adjust the levels and overall it’s very versatile. If you listen to it on full volume the battery is shorter then stated but that’s to be expected. I can bring this outside or on camping trips without worry of damage and has added volumes to many a night. Love this product and will be purchasing their smaller version as well.

author: Vulture
title: Funny story.
body: Purchased this to replace a failed bluetooth speaker from another company. Funny story...I set it up in under a minute, downloading the app to my phone. Loaded up Pandora and stepped into the shower. I had the volume set to max and it just wasn't very loud. Well, next song came on and I guess it had to equalize or something because it came out SO LOUD the bathroom was almost shaking. Dog ran into the bedroom and hid under the bed. The sound didn't distort at all and had great bass, clear mids and highs. Now after a couple days of use, the battery lasts a long time and I just love the way this thing sounds. Can't wait to take it out on the canoe and backpacking.

author: CKamerin
title: Long Battery life not as loud as one might hope.
body: Compared to other comparably sized speakers I would say that this is of a higher quality build, externally, and the battery life is decent but not very close to advertised. I was able to play full volume for about 5 hours before it died. Since it isn't as loud as I had hoped, I had to play full volume to get loud enough music for the group of 7 we had around the pool.I have not tested the waterproof capabilities of the device yet (as I see no reason to throw it in the pool just to see) but I would say that it is a decent speaker. Sound quality is good. It has impressive bass considering its size. The connectivity is solid and I had no problem staying connected even with some distance from the speaker.For those looking for a durable speaker I imagine this will fit the bill. If you play at lower volumes I could see it lasting a long time however will could you throw a party with this speaker? Probably not. Maybe with 10-20 of them.. Then again I'm used to large PA speakers at parties/events and may be more deaf than your average listener!

author: Garth
title: Great speaker
body: I was skeptical at first as I had not owned a UE speaker prior, but wow, I'm a believer.  Luckily, I was able to compare this to others (JBL, etc...) at a Best Buy first and the sound quality and dB levels were sellers.  Great sound, super bluetooth range, battery life is at least 8+hrs for me (haven't needed longer than that).  The sound quality is fantastic, even at high volumes.  The tested JBL Charge and Extreme seemed to get static and lose base at high volumes.  Haven't tried linking them but the app is also nice to upgrade the firmware.  Not available on other options.

author: Psublime
title: Amazing
body: It sounds great alone, but pair it with another Megaboom and put them into stereo mode, and you have a next level bluetooth system. Not only does will your setup sound amazing, but you can take it ANYWHERE, like kayaking down the river, or to work at your construction job. The battery life is insane for a bluetooth speaker, as I get 20 hours + with moderate volume. Just don't turn the volume on the speaker all the way up or it will drain so fast your head will spin. I traded in one of my home systems for a pair of these and it was the best decision ever. Having a party in your campground after hiking miles into the wilderness is quite something.

author: Jacob Kemp
title: Just do it!
body: This is an amazing speaker! Other reviewers are correct in that it doesn't have huge bass, but it doesn't need it. Is so much clearer in the mids and highs and literally fills the entire house or outdoor area with such clean beats its almost unbelievable. And honestly it has plenty of bass, its just not that overwhelming, I promise you won't be disappointed! Battery life is literally forever, someone claimed 55 hrs at 33 percent volume, and the bluetooth range is rated at 100 feet, but i tested it outdoors, which is usually way worse, and it was probably 150 feet, again unbelievable. It's great/ even better at high volume and the 360 degree sound is no bullshit either. The sound is so enjoyable i ditched my $500 soundbar and just use this this little monster for all my listening pleasures. Just buy it, you'll love it!

author: Me
title: Recommended, but watch the price.
body: I just got this yesterday and charged it up. It was very easy to unpack, charge and connect to my iPhone.  Worked flawlessly.  The sound is quite amazing for the sound of the device.  I would recommend it.The only knock I have on this purchase is that it was $250 one day and $299 the next. WTF Amazon?  Prices shouldn't jump like that between the time you put something in your cart until the time you check out.  I really wanted something like this, so I got it anyway, but I think $299 is a little overpriced.

author: Lance K.
title: UE MegaBoom vs JBL Charge 3
body: Good sound, clear, and nice & loud.  Similar in size to the JBL Charge 3, and sound is almost up to par with the JBL...but in my opinion the JBL has a much more all around sound.  Even with adjustments made to the UE equalizer, the JBL still produced a fuller sound.  Don't get me wrong, if I happened to lose this one, I would buy another one in a heartbeat.  The JBL Charge 3 is a better sounding speaker, but the exposed woofers on the ends make it a bit fragile for an outdoor speaker.  The UE MegaBoom on the other hand, looks and feels solid.

author: Peter Lafreniere
title: Do not buy from this company.
body: My speaker stopped working within a week and would only stay powered up when plugged in. My major qualm is with the seller of this item. After following their detailed return instructions and paying to send the item back to them they failed to process my return. I attempted contacting them on four separate occasions and received complete radio silence. I then turned to amazon to help me out with an A to Z claim. They turned me down with the explanation that my claim did not fall under the criteria of the A to Z coverage. I ended up having to file a claim with my credit card company. I am currently out the shipping cost of the speaker back to Liquid Deals and the points credit on my amazon account that I used to pay for a portion of this purchase.

author: Jill M.
title: One Star
body: Product stopped working after 4 months...no warranty support and no response from UE mega Boom support.  Junk.

author: Maximize
title: I bought 2 of them for $600 before
body: I had two 600 dollar lava red megabooms bought brand new from best buy and one had a 20 percent missing battery but it was fine to me i traded them after a year to upgrade to the new megaboom 3s and they are absolutely not as good compared to the originals and so I waisted my 600 dollars on speakers that sounded like the bass threw up from the same company i looked for awhile and seen this sparkdeal megaboom on Amazon and looked at all the bad reviews and bought 2 from what I just received today using them for 12 hours i know these are megabooms and are new speakers never used but the reason its missing that gold star is it had a little white dirt on my speakers torn packaging and a vary vary vary small amount of loose threads are cut on one piece of  The woven fabric ( it looked like a piece of dust )  the aux waterproof door flap was actually lifted open i just had to close it and the batteries need to be charged for 7 hours to complete the new speaker charge otherwise it can act like a older battery but now that you know please believe me it’s worth the money even if the batteries go bad they are supposed to be able to be replaced if needed nothing is wrong with them i got a good deal because of  Amazon and sparkdeals and im extremely happy i have my old megabooms back i hope  you enjoy your megabooms guys

author: Natalie
title: ... some reason my speaker came covered in scratches and dirty and dusty
body: For some reason my speaker came covered in scratches and dirty and dusty. I guess somebody else returned it after using it because it was definitely used in a little upset I spent $200 on this speaker for a brand new one and got a used one what a hassle

author: LEENER126300
title: Very good sound. One glitch though
body: Super good sound. I us  it for my out door yoga class and the sound carries for a quarter mile. The only problem is that if I pause my iPod for more than five minutes, the speaker turns off and I have to turn it back on. Not a good thing if I'm teaching in a studio and I want to use the music to wake the students out of relaxation. I say this because when you turn the speaker on it makes a drum roll sound. Not relaxing at all!

author: Daniel M
title: Durable and sounds BIG
body: Long battery life, adjustable EQ with UE app for different sound settings which is great for different venues or environments.Update September 5, 2018: this speaker is tough and durable and still sounds great.  Tbh, I really only use on my bike rides.  I use 3 Velcro straps to secure to top tube and let me tell you I don’t take it easy on the thing.  It has accompanied me over thousands of miles, over all types of road conditions, and in ALL types of weather.  Granted I use a case.  It is indispensable and very valuable as I spend hours on a bike.  The app works great too.  I blue toothed 2 UE Megaboom and 1 UE Boom using app.  Talk about a wall of sound on the trail!  5 stars!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Speaker! Great bass, treble and great experience overall.
body: The speakers are great. Tested them against several other speakers and they performed exceptionally well. The speakers are fairly loud. I also bought the UE Boom 2 and they are also great. The UE Megaboom off course is much louder and also packs a harder punch. I was almost blown away by how good it sounded and how easy it was to set up(if you can even call it that). The bass was excellent, treble was good too. There is just a small distortion at the max volume but nothing that is too important. Overall, a great buy and one I would recommend especially if it is on sale. UE MEGABOOM Charcoal Black Wireless Mobile Bluetooth Speaker (Waterproof and Shockproof)UE MEGABOOM Charcoal Black Wireless Mobile Bluetooth Speaker (Waterproof and Shockproof)

author: David C. Ayer
title: Disappointing
body: I bought the Ultimate Ears Megaboom based on good overall reviews and price.  I didn't care that it was an older model as the updated version had no additional features I cared about.  The Megaboom sounds okay for what it is.  I didn't expect to be amazed, so I wasn't disappointed with sound quality.  What was disappointing was the unit's inability to hold a charge.  Unless it was plugged into a charger, it wouldn't stay on for more than a few seconds.  Not terribly useful.  I've returned the unit and am now looking for a replacement.I found the control and connection locations to be inconvenient.  The Android app was completely useless.  It wouldn't even turn the unit on.

author: AmaMom
title: Nothing but awesome!
body: This is the coolest bluetooth speaker.  I got this for my Son for christmas.  It fits nicely in a kayak cupholder and has really long battery life.  Don't forget to download the app.  I even pranked my son.  Because you can have more than one device hooked up, I kept changing my son's station from 2 rooms away.  I am super excited to get another one so I can use them in stereo mode.  This has an awesome bass sound too.  The packaging is pretty slick with a funky color charger and everything.  It was the hit of Christmas.

author: glasdriver
title: Great sound!!  Tried several different brands and this one is BY FAR the best!
body: Great sound!!  Tried several different brands and this one is BY FAR the best, with great bass, treble and vocals. Found that the location for best sound is to place this about 8" from a wall or other hard surface, with the controls (+/-) facing towards you (not the wall); the wall helps beam the sound and provides extra channel separation.Very easy to use; thinking of picking up a second one now (they link and can be configured for stereo).

author: Michael M.
title: Best Bluetooth speaker hands down.
body: This is by far the best Bluetooth speaker I have ever heard for its size.  No competition at all from anyone else.  This thing is extremely durable.  The thing that made me buy one was my best friend had one and it sounded amazing and I asked him about it and he poured a bottle of water on his and then threw it across a field.  It never skipped a beat and still is working to this day a year later.  So I went and ordered this one and it was one of the best investments ever.  I was working in the garage yesterday and my friends came over and they thought I had a sound system in the garage!  This thing is serious

author: jason sani
title: Not impressed
body: I rarely write critical reviews but this thing is sub-par at best. For the money, you should get better quality. First one sound muffled... got a return and continues to sound "blown" when turned up above 50%. I want to love it... the convenience factor is there. I bought this because my friend had the smaller version which sounds good for the size and value.

author: Keith H.
title: Great speaker.
body: Doesn't have critical buttons play\pause next\previous track, instead has a very un-intuitive "tap gesture" system where the system doesn't always detect your taps, or only one of two taps, and it's just very frustrating. Still it's very loud, good sound. Could have been a lot better if they had just put more buttons in it.

author: E. Pinder
title: Lives up to its namesake!
body: The sound is pretty incredible for the size. 360° rich sound. Highs are crisp and doesn't distort at max volume. The app equalizer helps pronounce the mids. The bass sounds great sometimes and a bit muffled at others. I previously purchased a jbl flip 2...and while I enjoy the portability /size and sound, this UE mega boom brings it and then some!

author: Marek Bauer
title: Great speaker
body: This thing is a little quieter than the regular boom but the thing is that this puts out higher quality. My roommate and i compared the two, the regular boom sounds blown out of proportion and you can for sure hear the difference. This has lower lows and a little lower highs but overall this is worth the extra money in my opinion if you can find it for about $150 to $180

author: Marc Moyer
title: Very good sound quality
body: I love this thing, initially had a Boom 2 that wasn't working well, when I returned that, I got this, and overall the volume isn't much louder, but the bass and fullness are amazing for something the size of a 1 liter bottle.Battery life is not great on full volume, it's better at around 65%Waterproofing works well as it fell into the pool without no issue.Would def reccomend

author: Javier C.
title: UE MEGABOOM
body: 1. Producto genuino2. Empaque impecable, excelente diseño y materiales. Sirve para guardar el cargador, el cable y el Speaker incluso después de abierto pues es como un estuche.3. La calidad del cable y cargador son excelentes.4. En cuanto al Speaker, el sonido es A1 aunque la diferencia entre el Boom y el MegaBoom no es tan marcada como esperaba. Este tiene tal vez un poco mas de bajo. Los materiales del speaker están perfectos, hasta ahora con un mes de uso la batería va muy bien, se carga en aproximadamente 3 a 4 horas completamente y dura unas 15 horas con un volumen moderado a bajo y unas 6 horas con volumen alto. Se puede escuchar música mientras se está cargando la batería. Trataré de subir fotos otro día. EL vendedor fue rápido y me llegó el producto esperado, cubre ampliamente mis expectativas.

author: Luke Walsh
title: grinders and pretty much any other air tools
body: Let's talk about what this speaker has endured this week. I work on aircraft and do a bunch of TIG/MIG welding and plasma cutting. The speaker is loud enough to be heard in the workshop over rivet guns, grinders and pretty much any other air tools. It has been hit with sparks and bits and pieces of flying lava with no damage, which is saying something because the cutting surface is over 10,000 degrees. Sure its not cutting the speaker, but its being pelted with several hundred to a few thousand degree pieces. Today it went out on a hobie cat for 8 hours of punishing waves and still has 25% battery after running at max volume all day. The speaker has been wet all day, even took a few good breaking waves going out the inlet in 8 foot seas. Despite being half submerged in water, its still running and was sounding great.It is a solidly engineered speaker, and well worth the money for anyone who has room in a backpack or other storage areas. 10/10 will buy again.

author: MigsNSX
title: Buy these speakers !
body: I’m not sure which I like more… The waterproof and sturdy construction or the incredible sound that is broadcast from these speakers.I highly recommend you buy at least two.I have six of these speakers around my hot tub and the stereo separation is equal to a speaker at four times the cost

author: Roy
title: Best speaker I've owned
body: This is the best portable speaker I have owned, and I've owned beats pills, jbl charge 2, jbl flip 2, and Bose sound link, none of them compare to the rich, room filling 360 sound of the UE. The sound truly surrounds you and it feels like the speaker is much larger than it is. Whatever little speaker they put in this thing must be very high quality, and not to mention the battery life is impeccable, have been using about a week straight off and on and it's still on full battery. I would reccomend this speaker to anyone who wants a higher quality speaker that will last them a long time.

author: SilverSuperman
title: Best Bluetooth Speaker on the Market, hands down.
body: I knew from reviews the quality of the speaker and the sound we're going to be great but I did hold reservations... I mean, it's a Bluetooth speaker. :-PHowever, it has far exceeded all expectations. I've used this speaker for a few BBQ parties and also just playing outside and my wife tends to come out and turn it down cause it's "too loud" (which of course warms my heart. Lol.)Love this speaker. I'd absolutely buy it again and recommend it to anyone looking for a great Bluetooth speaker.

author: RustyBolts
title: Ultimate Cycling Speaker
body: Megabooms are the ultimate cycling speaker! The overall mix of loud volume, tight upper bass at high volume, lack of distortion (dynamic compression) at high volume, battery life, and waterproof case makes this a clear winner.Party Up Mode: With the app you can pair 2 (up to 50) of these and play off a single phone! I've had 4 hooked up at once at a camp site and its a crowd pleaser. People will stop and ask you what speaker it is.. not because its loud, or even that the sound quality is mind-blowing.. Mostly because of the sound stage you get from having stereo sound (L and R speaker in different locations) in an unexpected location (not a house). Don't underestimate the additional sound quality you get from having the drums and bass in the left speaker and vocals and lead guitar in the right. Especially at a camp site or backyard BBQ. Especially when one speaker is on your bike and the other is on your wife's bike and you pass someone by going around them (one on each side) and they get a brief couple seconds of stereo sound, and are completely confused how you're playing 2 speakers at once. A good sound stage delivers you an experience where you can visually place each instrument, and this feature allows you to do this just about anywhere. That alone makes this product incredible that you can do so just about anywhere. You can also do a party mode where you let as many people as possible create a public playlist through the app.. Cool stuff. Also, bluetooth range is amazing (when you have line of sight).Ok, think multiple speakers is a gimmick and you won't buy 2? Fine. Its still an solid speaker if you only own 1. The bass is not the deepest out there (JBL Charge 2+ better bass, but not waterproof and doesn't get very loud). If you want an outdoor speaker that has pretty good bass, high volume, waterproof, and low distortion at high volume there's not anything else out there that checks all the boxes. Its case is robust so it makes for the perfect outdoor/cycling speaker. Oh, and the battery life exceeded my expectations by several hours.. or should I say days. I hoped I could get through an entire day of RAGBRAI (7 day bike ride across Iowa) at 3/4 to full volume. It lasted 3 days at 6-7 hours per day (not always at full volume, but at least half, usually 3/4). I think the battery is only like 2600mAh, but the speaker uses 2 x 2" drivers and 2 x 4" passive radiators, which is why you get the awesome battery life with only a 2600 mAh battery. Not to get too techy, but passive radiators use air pressure trickery from drivers and allows massive bass without actually powering the "bass speakers", so to speak. Look up "passive radiators".. cool tech. Ok, I'm in the weeds here.Mounting is a little awkward on a road bike since its bigger than most. I just stretched out my metal water bottle cage and added a velcro strap. Stays in place well enough for road biking at 20-30 mph. The internet mostly recommended the Topeak cage to mount a Megaboom to a bike, but I found it to be even more awkward and too tight, resulting in unnecessary rubbing and scuffing of my Booms. Emphasis on ROAD BIKE, not mountain bike. Your results may vary jumping off rocks from 5'. Tap Control doesn't work very well.. Tap top of speaker twice for skip, once for play pause, and pulling out your phone is a pain. Your life will immediately improve if you buy a media button for cycling (Satechi Bluetooth Button <--- what I bought).In a nutshell, if you're looking for a cycling speaker that also sounds good when you get to the campsite, this is it! After buying 2 for cycling only it was so good I removed my large 250W Yamaha receiver and Micca speakers from my garage (took up too much space) and I'm happy with 2 Megabooms. I also moved my back porch stereo (Audioengine A5+) to the basement because Megabooms sound great. I'm not saying that Megabooms sound as good as a full Yamaha setup or Audioengines, but they are good enough and the portability, versatility, and soundstage makes up for it.PROS:- Louder than anything out there- Battery Life is 3-4 days at least. I haven't charged mine in 2 weeks, including a weekend cycling trip.- Sound (perfect mix of tight upper bass, mids, highs not too bright)- Waterproof/durability (you can dunk in water for 30 min!)- Good app (turn speakers on/off with app, speaker firmware updates, stereo volume balance control)- Sound stage with 2 speakersCONS:- Price (Its a chunk of change to buy 2, but if you cycle as much as me, just use the gas money saved)- Tap Control (you're supposed to be able to tap on top of speaker twice to skip songs, once to pause/play.. Just doens't work well)

author: Amazon Customer
title: BEST SPEAKER OUT THERE
body: Hand s down the best portable speaker. This thing is loud! The curved design really throws the sound around. I took this to mexico and the water proof feature was important to me. It's great, leave it in the sand, didn't have to worry about waves hitting it, I even floated it in the pool!

author: JOHN EGAN
title: This unit us amazing. The packaging is also incredible
body: MEGABOOM is an understatement about this units performance. It kicks some serious butt. First time I heard it was in my churches sanctuary playing Sinatra's Come a Fly with me. I still can't believe to quality of the sound at high volume. This unit us amazing. The packaging is also incredible. It took me awhile to find the very hearty charging cable but it was there.I'd like to test out the waterproof feature and see how the speaker sounds under water for 30 minutes.You like loud? Buy it! You like portable? Buy it! You like something unique? But it!

author: Michael Colletta
title: AH MAZ ING
body: I've gone through countless portable speakers. I've heard or owned the Pills, JBL, Sony, Bose...This is the one. My friend had the smaller one and I immediately commented on the sound quality. I went ahead and bought the Mega, this thing is SUPER loud but the sound quality is perfectly balanced. I can hear this way over the waves at the beach, on a pontoon boat, fills the house, great for pool. Bluetooth never drops and reaches from inside the house to out by the pool. The battery will easily rock all day. I am a photographer and I let my hair and make up team use it at their station, they didn't have it very loud but it went for 3 DAYS on the same charge. Unbelievable. I have Logitech (owns UE) 5 speaker set up for my computer that is from 2002 and it still knocks. Solid company. Solid product. You can even daisy chain them! BUY NOW.

author: Dennis C
title: Best loud speaker for the money.
body: If you are looking for a solid sounding speaker, that is loud then this is it. Great quality, solid feel and easy setup. Had this for 1 day and is very loud. I would have to say comparing to my B&O the fidelity of the sound is not quite there, but again this is a loud and grab and go type of speaker. Have not tried this outside yet but I think it will carry the sound very well. Will update later!

author: Devil's Advocate
title: Battery only barely outlasted the warranty
body: Battery lasted a little over a year. I went to replace it, spent $30 on a kit to replace it, opened it up and the unit was put together so poorly that simply removing the battery charging board bent the internal pins because the plastic housing wasn’t fixed to the board. Once bent they are too fragile to be fixed.

author: Shane Rodgers
title: Bro.  Get it.
body: Seriously.  This thing is so sick.  You will own the pool.  Messed around with it at the beach, bring it in the shower, strapped it outside my pack for a hike, leave it sitting on the hottub ledge without worry!  It still looks brand new.  The bass is nice for such a little baby speaker.  If you max out the volume there's some distortion.  I thought I'd put it to the test and I was afraid I might have blown it.  Turned it off and back on and it's good as new.  Whew!  I always get compliments on the sound!

author: Ekallas
title: Amazing speaker!
body: For starters, I had the UE Boom and it was an amazing speaker. But it came time to upgrade and i figured Id give UE Megaboom a shot. Im happy i did because this speaker is amazing! Its very loud and clear. Love the shock resistant and water proof feature of it although I dont test it out too much.My friends always compare it to the Bose soundlink and try to figure out which is better. Let me put it this way, if you are active and plan to bring your speaker places, then get the Megaboom. If you plan to keep your speaker in the kitchen or something then get the bose.

author: Nicholas
title: Does not charge.
body: The speaker that I thought was a fully functioning speaker with no issues and avoiding purchasing a refurbished one to guarantee having a error free speaker clearly did not workout. The sound quality of the speaker is fine but the important part is being able to charge the speaker. Spending a larger amount of money on a supposed quality speaker should be worth the investment but if the thing comes already malfunctioning then that is just poor business because the speaker did not seem to come in anything but a cardboard box that said what it was and the Amazon packaging so I can only assume that it was a poorly refurbished speaker that was falsely advertised. H

author: Daniel Chou Wu
title: Ultimately the best all around speaker you can get for your money
body: Ultimately the best all around speaker you can get for your money. Amazingly balanced sound, excellent bluetooth technology, rugged, and waterproof design. Tap the top once to play or pause, double tap to play the next song, or check the battery level by pressing the + and - signs which also function as a volume up and down function. Connect and pair this with 7 other Booms (or Megabooms) and make it a party. Get this or the UE Boom and never look back.

author: JLS
title: two years of limited use and the batter exploded
body: I purchased this speaker two years ago and LOVED it (for the sound quality), despite the limited use it got. This week I had guests in town and went to use the speaker when I noticed on the back side of it that the battery is bulging out of the speaker. My visiting friend, who is an engineer, told me that the battery is bad. Unfortunately I cannot find a way to return it on Amazon. I probably should have returned it when I discovered it won't sync with the other speaker, like it is supposed to. So disappointed...too bad this item isn't as cheap in cost as it is in quality. :-(

author: Carlton
title: and has great sound quality at those volumes
body: This product was meant for medium to loud music, and has great sound quality at those volumes.At low volumes, my 2 issues are 1) the bass seems too overpowering to a point where everything sounds muffled, and 2)the volume increments seem really big: the sound will be too soft, but then if i click the volume button up once, it becomes noticeably too loud.

author: Faten
title: Better than Beat pill XL
body: I love it! I used to own a Beats Pill XL speaker but sent it back due to the recall, after looking for a long time I decide to try UE Megaboom and OMG I loooooove it! better sound than the Beat pill XL and cheaper! so happy I picked this one great, clear sound!

author: Aaron
title: Stopped charging
body: Poor quality. Bought 2. In less than a year both will no longer charge (both had never been in any extreme conditions, just sat on a table). HERE'S THE KICKER. Had one replacement sent per the warranty and it wouldn't charge right out of the box (probably refurbished speaker with same issue). Did all the trouble shooting and nothing worked. Dissapointing...

author: Pete Dowell
title: Great Product
body: I have to say that I love this speaker. I know its probably not the best but it is great for what I need it for. I do loads of outside projects and this speaker is loud enough that I can hear it while using powered equipment and I take this speaker out on my boat and it has never been an issue when it gets wet. I have not complaints other than I wish the speaker was a different shape. A square housing would make it easier to sit the speaker where I want it without me worrying if its going to roll or tip over.

author: Mary Ellen Wade
title: WOW WOW WOW..!!!
body: WOW WOW WOW..!!!  I am SO GLAD my son talked me into ordering this bluetooth speaker for my MacBook Pro.  What incredible sound.  I was blown away when I heard my son's speaker during a recent visit.  Even though it's pricey, it is WORTH EVERY PENNY..!!!  Highly recommend.

author: James A. Waters
title: ... several cheap $50 speakers that have all suffered from poor battery life or poor sound quality
body: I have purchased several cheap $50 speakers that have all suffered from poor battery life or poor sound quality.THIS THING IS WORTH THE MONEY!  I honestly did not want to buy something this expensive but I had a little extra cash to throw around and purchased it anyway.The battery lasts so freaking long it is amazing.  I ran it for an entire day at the beach and it still had power when I got back home.The sound quality is pretty awesome too.  It is loud and very clear.I highly recommend buying this product.  Totally worth the extra money.The one down side is the plastic case that everything comes in has flimsy hinges.  I am currently looking for a solid carrying case to buy for this and the charge cable.(By the way, the charge cable is hidden in the plastic case.  I had to look kind of hard to figure out it was in a hidden compartment.).

author: ijnhy65
title: UE Megaboom
body: I bought two. They sound really amazing by themselves, but together the sound is really impressive.  Battery on one looks a little iffy, but I will update in a few months on the batteries.  if they hold up I may buy two more.

author: rae davis
title: The speaker was really great while it lasted
body: The speaker was really great while it lasted.  I used it intermittently for a year and five months and then it would take the whole day to charge before I could use.  Shortly after that, one of the speakers must have blown and there is virtually no output... just a tinny sound.  Disappointed especially that it will join the rest of the E-Waste in the world.

author: Grumpyoldman32
title: wow what a sound
body: I have 2 of these speakers now and the app lets you join them, a small price to pay since UE took away Alexa on its software. but the sound is great.try putting a towel under the speaker and hear the bass fill up more.

author: Stephen W Joos
title: Died right after 1 year
body: Coming back to post this review.  Pretty much exactly at 1 year the speaker developed the dreaded unable to charge problem that others have reported.  It was a great speaker while it lasted. If you buy one, budget for an annual replacement or hope yours breaks during the warranty period.

author: S. Duncan
title: Good value...exceptional outdoor/ activity speaker option
body: This thing is really impressive for what it is.  I'm an audio snob, so was skeptical about what it could do and true value of other reviews.  It's a well built piece, the setup is a snap, and the sound is shockingly good for causal situations (especially if you place it near a wall (rear side) for the sound to reflect off of).  It was money well spent.

author: Patrick Lakilak
title: Despite all the reviews...
body: After reading all the reviews and saw that some people gotten defects and that the speaker wouldnt work, watching comparisons to jbl etc. I lucked out and got a great speaker only complaint I have is that there is a slight scuff/scratch on the rubber part towards the +/- buttons. But other than that the sound quality is definitely good im not a pro musician or speaker pro but I intend to use this speaker on hikes and going to the beach and lounging. And from first impression its great I also took peoples advice and NOT upgrade the firmware when pairing with phone or device with the app. All in all for the use of going outside on hikes and what not it definitely was worth the black friday/weekend purchase!!! Wouldve gotten the 5 stars but the scuff pulled me back from giving that.

author: No Bologna
title: Great sound for such a small package
body: Great sound for such a small package. I was skeptical but my wife was certain this is what she wanted. I shouldn't have questioned, she was right. It fills up a room with balanced sound and even some pretty decent bass. I can recommend to anyone. This would hold it's own against a BOSE unit of twice the price.

author: Rob Helm
title: AFTER 6 MONTH APPROX 2 HOUR BATTERY LIFE MAXIMUM
body: The battery is not as advertised. 21hours? Maybe on standby, w/o buletooth on... I have had this thing for 6 months now and the battery BARELY lasts more then 2 hours now. That is PATHETIC. super disappointed.

author: Josh
title: I take this thing everywhere
body: Don't bother with other bluetooth speakers... including the megablast or whatever else UE is putting out as of NOW. THIS IS THE BEST ONE. I love that multiple UE's can be pared together (up to 150 or so?) for a wider sound within any size home. I have 2 Mega's & love the waterproof feature & the ease of the application. BOSE, Harman-Kardon, Sony... none have the ease, sound, or features the original Megaboom has! its been 3 years & i have NO regrets with this purchase.

author: Swiss
title: Look no further
body: Outstanding portable Bluetooth speaker. Absolutely love this speaker.  Use mostly while paddle boarding. Also fits beautifully in a bicycle water bottle cage. Sound quality is amazing and battery life is outstanding.  Very happy with my purchase.

author: Lateralus462
title: Fantastic Speaker
body: Best Bluetooth speaker I have owned by far. This thing performs above my expectations both indoors and outdoors. I use the speaker several days a week (few hours at a time) and it rarely needs charged. Might charge it 2-3 times a month at most. There are a couple things about the speaker that are kind of quirky. 1st is that for some reason it will drop the Bluetooth connection from my iPhone when I change a song. Only happens once in a while, but still annoying when it happens as I have to re-connect the Bluetooth connection. I'm not a tech guru though, so it's possible it could be operator error. 2nd is that this speaker isn't the best for shower use. The bass is overwhelming at times when using the speaker in the bathroom or shower. Overall, I'm pleased with the purchase and expect to get plenty of hours of enjoyment with the MegaBoom.

author: Rob D.
title: Big sound from a small speaker!!
body: I'm a pro sound engineer so I have very discriminating ears and I love the sound this little speaker puts out! I have friends with Sonos systems and the smaller Bose speakers and I totally think this sounds way better. The battery lasts for hours on a single charge, even at higher volume levels. The quality of the speaker feels great too. Very well made. Had no problem hooking it up to iPhones, iPods, iPad and even a MacBook Air. Great for parties, especially outdoors. It's a tad pricey but I think it's worth it. I wish they'd give you a deal on a pair. I'd eventually like to get another one to use for filling out the sound in larger rooms. This actually has great bass response for being so small as well! Highly recommend.

author: LMCK
title: I generally hate portable speakers let alone Bluetooth
body: I'm an audio snob. I generally hate portable speakers let alone Bluetooth. But this little guy has great bass and the highs aren't tin-y or distractingly high as most small speakers you'll find. The charge lasts forever and it charges quickly. Pairs easily and never losses a pair. Nice and loud. I highly recommend this product.

author: MJ Maher
title: Great sound/fantastic quality
body: Bought 1, then another and then 2 more. Best Bluetooth speaker around.  My kids linked them for a graduation party (I think there were 8 total) and sound quality, battery life and ease of use made our yard a rocking place.  And by pointing inward, the music was not obnoxious at the neighbors, but still loud enough for sixty 17 & 18 yr olds to vibe to!

author: Spankey
title: Just brilliant, absolutely brilliant.
body: Just brilliant, absolutely brilliant. Connecting via bluetooth is seamless. Fantastic sound to boot. I'm getting a second one so I can pair them, way better than the Bose portable speaker we used to use in the office.Update 9/16/16I recommend not using the always on/connected feature as it drains the battery pretty fast. It's a great feature though. I turned the always on feature off and the battery lasts for ages even with heavy use.  Still very happy with it such a great product!

author: Robert Jeff
title: Great speakers
body: Very nice speakers. great sound and always happy with UE boom speakers. I have bought just about every one they have. and given out as gifts.

author: Guy Klucevsek
title: Top-notch blue tooth speaker
body: This is a terrific Bluetooth speaker.  I am using it exclusively in the kitchen.Sound is excellent, with plenty of bass and crystal clear treble.  Works well with all kinds of music:  I have played Emmy Lou Harris, Glenn Gould, vocal jazz, old time jazz, Bela Fleck.  Bluetooth paired right out of the box.  Great product!

author: Dave Cruise
title: Great, but does not seem to re-charge with 220 volts
body: Fantastic item. However, there are two concerns. At first, it was difficult for the devices to recognize the bluetooth speaker. The way I solved this problem was to look at the internet where someone pointed out that it was necessary to hold down the power key and press the minus volume sign (-), holding for 8 seconds. Also, it seems as if the speaker does not use 220 volts  though the instructions say it does; (maybe I did something wrong).

author: mitchbtam
title: Poor Quality
body: This speaker is good when it works, but is not built to last. Less than 2 months after purchasing the speaker started having issues. Now it sounds like the speaker is blown and any music that is played sounds horrible. This is without dropping it or doing anything else that could damage it. I would recommend buying a different brand

author: Sandie
title: Best Bluetooth I've ever owned.
body: Excellent Bluetooth! Very loud with just the right amount of base. My family and I loved the first one that we each bought our own to enjoy. Also you won't miss a call ever when the Bluetooth is on because it let's you know there's an incoming call. My friends were very much impressed and got compliments about it. One of them even bought a ue boom just because she liked the sound of it and is planning on getting the megaboom soon. I strongly recommend this product.

author: C French
title: Excellent Speaker, Mediocre App
body: Great sound quality and battery life. It feels very sturdy, but I would still recommend buying a case for it if you plan to travel with it. The only negative comment I have is about the UE app. I don’t notice much difference after changing the equalizer settings.

author: Tony Cervone
title: Frustrating.
body: Within 8 months this device completely stopped working for me. I can't even get it to power up anymore. During the course of its short life it would sync to Bluetooth but not play, or only play when plugged into a wall outlet. Sometimes the battery would charge, then it would refuse to do so. Sometimes it would play through a wired connection; other times it would not. I reset it about a billion times. I updated the firmware. I did all the stuff I was recommended to do. It sounded good when it decided to play, but man, what a frustrating piece of junk. Expensive junk too.

author: Dillard Owens Jr.
title: This product was awesome the first 6 months of use
body: This product was awesome the first 6 months of use. I've never had it wet.Only turned up the volume to full twice, just to show it off. Yet 6 months after purchase, it has a blown speaker. Sounds terrible. I will definitely be purchasing a different product in the future. I do NOT recommend this product!!! Too expensive to be WORTHLESS in 6 months!!!

author: Buckoff92
title: Tough and sound great
body: I got this for Christmas in 2016 and it was worth every penny they paid I bet this speaker has over 2000hr of play time on it I use it at work just about everyday. It's been drop a lot left out In the rain several times handle with greasey oil covered hands. Been in the hot sun for hours and it still kicking would recommend to anyone looking for a good Bluetooth speaker

author: Brent William
title: It can get pretty loud. Audiobooks at home
body: Wow. I was very wary about spending so much money. This is a tough little speaker. And the sound! Clear. Full. It can get pretty loud. Audiobooks at home. Music pumping at work during the day. The battery life is crazy.

author: Debbie Duffy
title: Highly recommend this Megaboom!
body: I purchased the Megaboom as a gift for my husband. He loves it and carries it with him everywhere we go. It's light, the sound is phenomenal and it doesn't take any space. We are very pleased with this product. I highly recommend it!

author: JJS11
title: Speaker packs a punch that I would recommend!
body: Small speaker that packs a punch. Loud enough for my entire apartment. Sound quality is excellent.Pros:Sound qualityConnecting to speaker is easySpeaker volume is very loud for its sizeCons:Bluetooth range is not quite what is advertised.^^  Can be in my apartment and through a single wall and only 20 feet the speaker starts to cut out.Overall solid speaker and would recommend to anyone

author: julian martinez
title: my brother bought one at a retail store and i like the way it siunds
body: I had to return it, my brother bought one at a retail store and i like the way it siunds, thats why i ordered one from here but my brothers is louder than this one, i wasnt happy even i got it for 180

author: Amazon Customer
title: This is a great speaker. It's loud compared to its size and ...
body: This is a great speaker. It's loud compared to its size and the sound quality is good. Design is minimalist and you can take it anywhere without worrying too much if it gets wet or if you drop it. Battery lasts as they promise.

author: Joseph
title: the ATHM50x of speakers.
body: Great sound from a great speaker. The UE Megaboom does a good job at getting close to how the music is supposed to sound, and has a clear, 360 degree sound. Don't expect to get the deepest bass from this speaker, but there is an equalizer on the app that will let you tinker with frequencies. The app can turn the speaker on and off, control volume, tell how much battery is left in the speaker, and change some other settings; it's very convenient if you don't want to get up and turn it off or change the volume manually.

author: Michelle L. Herrly
title: Love it!
body: Great sound quality.  Super portable and durable.  We’ve used this speaker both indoors and outdoors (golfing, 4-wheeling, patio parties).  The price on Amazon could not be beat.  Pairs easily with a wide variety of devices.  Great product!

author: joseph pellitieri jr.
title: Have had most other brands of bluetooth speakers and this is the best yet.
body: I own four of these now and they rock.  Have had most other brands of bluetooth speakers and this is the best yet.

author: J;08
title: Just paying for longer battery life, sound is pathetic.
body: Pathetic sound for that kind of $$. I tried a phone my iPhone and android viaB luetooth, an MP3 player hard wired 3.5mm jack all same. My conclusion is, the difference between this and $30-$70 speakers is the UE has a bigger battery 20hours vs the 8-10 of other speakers.

author: Rebecca
title: The best at the best price
body: Honestly this is the best portable speaker I’ve ever used .. it’s extremely loud durable and the spud quality is amazing . For 100$ it’s so worth it . I watch my friends buy 30$ ones here and there and they never last . This one lasts years and is waterproof! You won’t regret it , promise you it’s better than the 250$ beats pill

author: AJones6435
title: Great Sound
body: I heard this unit in a T-Mobile store and knew I just had to have one.  So, I did allot of research before making my purchase.  I was considering the following three: UE Megaboom, the Bose Mini and the Beats Pill. I thought this was the best bang for my buck.  The features that sold it over the others are clear, water resistant, shock proof and great depth of sound.  I did get the warranty.

author: Devin Sowalsky
title: Worth It
body: Definitely wouldn't buy this for msrp, but now that it's been three years since it's been released, the price is right. Great battery life and a good sounding speaker.

author: Klr1996
title: Best Portable Speaker
body: I know this is kinda "pricey" but this is the best thing I have ever bought, the bass is deep and perfect for its size, it produces very loud and great quality sound, and the battery on it is fantastic!!! I haven't charged it for 3 days and it's still running great!!!!!! This product is a definite 5 stars!!! There is nothing I could see wrong about this item!

author: Bigwavedave
title: Five Stars
body: Speaker worked great on the river and pretty loud, and the bluetooth distance is great. A year later speaker stopped working after a rafting trip called Logitech warranty number I sent them bad speaker they sent me a new one great customer service.

author: Cale Banks
title: Cool technology when it works.
body: Very cool that you can link multiple speakers but I’ve mine for about 3 months and it’s acting funky now. On a business trip, sound kept cutting in and out, brought it home and it started working fine. Now it only works if it’s plugged in to the power supply. Called tech support and they were perplexed and sent a new one which was very cool!!Second one is working fine so far. My friend has had one for about a year now and he’s having issues with his.

author: Hoppaguy
title: Go with Megaboom if you plan on using outdoors, big jambox if indoors
body: Ok I know there's tons of reviews on the large portable speaker segment but I own the big 3 which are the UE Megaboom, Big Jambox and the Bose Soundlink 3. To keep it simple, in my opinion it really depends on how you plan on using your speaker. I won't call myself a professional audiophile but I can definitely tell that the Bose has the best quality sound BUT I would actually only buy either the UE Megaboom or the Big Jambox. The reason I say this is because the UE Megaboom is by far the best portable speaker if you plan on taking it outside like the beach, park, etc. Not only is it shock proof but it's also waterproof up to 30 min in 1 meter of water. My speaker has been dropped off a table multiple times and just really abused and it's still going strong. The sound is great and gets loud with decent bass (not as loud as Big Jambox, more on that later). The battery life is great too as I can get more than 10 hours on the loudest setting. The unique part about the Megaboom is the 360 degree sound which is great for outdoors because you don't have to be directly in front of the speaker. The Bluetooth range is amazing too, I can go easily 50 feet and it does break up. There is nifty app in the iOS and Android store which you can do firmware updates and play with the settings. Now if you want the loudest speaker in this category, the Big Jambox is the loudest sounding speaker with good quality and bass. The reason for this is the speaker is front facing so if you're standing in front of it, this thing can really blast some tunes with bass. The Bose doesn't come close to being as loud. Even though this is the loudest with good quality speaker, I would still only buy this for inside use or for use in a back patio. The design of the speaker is not built for taking to the beach or anywhere it could fall. Plus in large outdoor spaces the UE Megaboom's 360 degree sound is great. Finally back to the Bose, I wouldn't buy this speaker because it's not as loud as the Big Jambox and it's not as rugged as the Megaboom. Overall the UE Megaboom is my favorite speaker to play n my office and then I grab it and take wherever because Aof it's ruggedness!

author: Angelette Reed
title: It's worth every dollar!
body: I've purchased the MEGABOOM speaker with the carrying case for my boyfriend as a gift and now I'm jealous! This speaker has a very clear sound and get very loud to were you can hear it clearly while showering. I am glad that he loves it, now it's time for me to purchase one for myself!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Works as promised -- very very well.
body: This does everything it says it does.  It was not completely obvious how to make it work (I'm still in the mid-20th century that way), but once I got it, it's completely easy to use.  It has a very good sound -- much better than any non-hifi device I have ever owned or heard,  It also looks attractive and its small footprint makes it easy to use anywhere.

author: Always Looking For A Deal
title: Charge cord shorts out and may burn down house!
body: Love the speaker. Too bad the charger cord shorted out and darn near burned my house down. Not sure why that happened cause this is the second one I purchased. I'm disappointed.

author: connie jones
title: Different look
body: For some reason this speaker has a different look than one I purchased recently at a local Verizon store.  Wondered if it was a foreign version. Seems to work ok

author: K.N.
title: MEGABOOM is #1
body: I've had a Bose SoundLink I and II, some older ones I can't even remember and a JBL Flip 2 - this one is hands down the BEST sound of anything I've ever owned!...and with all the extras like waterproof, 20 hour battery, support for 11 bluetooth devices, 100 foot range! I'm looking forward to having it with me for every outing be it camping, at the park, at the beach, or on vacation :-)

author: Chad A.
title: The sound quality of the megaboom is fantastic, all the way up the scale
body: The sound quality of the megaboom is fantastic, all the way up the scale. I'm terribly disappointed in the battery life claim, as my speaker is dead in less than four hours. This is at less than full volume, using Bluetooth connectivity. The speaker will not run continuously when plugged in, as others here have said it does. Not sure I would have bought this product had I done a bit more homework.

author: shawn
title: Doesn't take a charge!
body: This speaker sounds amazing and feels like quality. However, it randomly stopped working and won't take a charge.

author: Mlewis
title: Great
body: these speakers rock. Bass treble sound they have it all. Bought for my wedding reception which was outdoor backyard bbq. Had everyone who attended asking about music and how great it sounded.

author: J. Migliore
title: Delighted!
body: I researched most of the high end bluetooth portable.  This is hands down the best I heard.  The sound and clarity through the frequency spectrum is is outstanding.  I bought this in November 2016 and listen to it much more frequently than my home system.  It's so convenient indoor and outdoor.  My friends love it too and some have also purchased.

author: David F. Campbell
title: Short product life. Can't recommend this product line.
body: It was fine while it lasted. It stopped charging, and won't link while plugged in, just two weeks after the support period ended. We tried different chargers to no avail. I purchased it as a Christmas gift so it really only lasted two months.

author: John
title: Needs serious improvements on Bass
body: My only complaint is that the bass is not good... to me this is very important. If they fix that, than the product is great.

author: Pamela B.
title: Love it and fills a big room
body: I ordered same in the refurbished and it came dirty.  This one was awesome. I'd order a dark color...

author: mary baglino
title: Best portable waterproof speaker!
body: OMG I've been looking for a portable speaker for forever! Finally found this one! It's water proof to 3 feet! Bluetooth rocks! I've used this on river and SUP, it's perfect! Expensive but worth it! Battery lasts forever on one charge. I've used it for a full day on highest volume and it still had life left in battery! Do it!

author: Sebastian Sölter
title: just the best of the best portable speaker of the market
body: the best you can get for this price, waterproof, dustproof, fallproof, battery last for 8 hours at max vol sound. Great sound, sound better than BOSE or others… great.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Incredible sound.
body: Just buy this. Doesn't get any better!! Sound is unbelievably clear but still has substantial bass. Would buy again. Would but 10 more if I needed them.

author: Jarvis Jordan
title: I have multiple bluetooth devices, NONE, I repeat ...
body: I have multiple bluetooth devices, NONE, I repeat, NONE, come close to this one. The sound is unmatched, the bass and battery life are just what I needed. The charge literally lasts forever! Where other bluetooth devices would get drowned out when played outside, this one carries sound and you can hear the bass from a considerable distance.

author: Noah
title: Great speaker for a larger space
body: This gets ridiculously loud and can fill even the biggest room with great sounding music! The packaging is great and incredibly easy to open. Even though this is the largest version, it's still very easily transported and can be tossed in a bag or backpack without thinking about it. The battery says 20 hours on the packaging and I get about 18 or so.

author: LTNJ
title: Missing USB cord
body: Received my Megaboom yesterday. Sound is great! Shipping box was completely caved in on one side but the unit doesn't appear to be damaged. Yay! Only issue I have is that the USB cord that attaches to speaker and the wall charger is missing. I looked all through the packaging and it is not there! The instructions claim it was to be included. Feel a little ripped off because of that!

author: Brian
title: Don't waste your money on this device
body: Don't waste your money on this device. Mine lasted only a couple of battery charge cycles.  Sound quality is not all that good but that is not why I'd rate this device so low. Device get one very generous star for extreme poor customer support and product failure.  I'm stuck with a dead Megaboom and have wasted way too much valuable time dealing so called company support.  Their website provides trouble shooting advice to correct my dead product when I  executed their written procedure numerous without success I called customer support where their rep told me their was no such instruction on their website...."excuse me, I reading your instructions direct from your website"  Thank-you Howell Ian (MegaBoom Tech support) you have solved nothing, wasted way too much of my time, and told me I'm wrong.

author: Amazon Customer
title: The UE Megaboom is better than imagine!
body: This speaker is better than imagine. I use it everyday at work packing out product over night. So I have this baby cranked up as high as it goes. The only problem is if your planning on using the the volume at full blast the charge only less than 4 hours. I have yet to use it with less volume so I do not know if the claim they make that it last 20 hours or not. For me it's not a problem because I just keep it plugged in until I need to move it away from a outlet. If you go beyond the 100 feet give or take the WiFI will break up for you like a scatched CD. The app for this still has not allowed me to update for some reason. The update is to be able to tap the Megaboom twice to skip to the next song. Other than I recommend buying this if you enjoy music a lot doing work or just hanging out like I do! Everyone I work with loves this speaker because it just makes work go by so quickly listening to great sounding music that does not break up when it's playing at full blast! I hope get to enjoy this like I been.

author: 2004Rhino
title: These are awesome! Great sound and super portable
body: These are awesome! Great sound and super portable....I take them everywhere....I use them as a stereo in my golfcart, my back porch, anywhere you want to have music. They have a good depth of sound, good low end which is hard to find in a bluetooth speaker. I love the pairing capability to have two play in stereo! Awesome!

author: Luis S.
title: absolutely love this
body: really loud, its water proof. easy to carry. doesn't die quick. well worth the money

author: Amazon Customer
title: Got one as adjunct to my Boom 2 speakers for ...
body: Got one as adjunct to my Boom 2 speakers for added bass and presence in my camper. Pairs well using Boom app, but you do go to monaural with the three paired into your source.

author: KristianL
title: Great speaker, just don't buy refurb.
body: Great speaker, just do NOT buy refurbished. I tried twice. Buy new, trust me.

author: Nicholas Drumheller
title: Not a huge upgrade over the boom stick. A ...
body: Not a huge upgrade over the boom stick. A bit more bass and volume.  I don't think it's worth an extra 100 dollars though. Buy the boom, tons of bang for your buck compared to this

author: JClark
title: I’ve always liked Logitech’s products and this one is on par with ...
body: I’ve always liked Logitech’s products and this one is on par with others I’ve tried. Great sound! The battery life and waterproofing are great extras. I’m pleased.

author: Henry
title: What a speaker!
body: What a speaker! Wow!! Use this speaker all the time and the sound is awesome.

author: Kathy
title: Amazing Sound!
body: What a great speaker! The charge lasts and lasts, and the sound is amazing! You can screw it to a camera tripod so it can be away from tables, etc. We use it with Pandora, but our son uses it with his iPod. Both work great with the Bluetooth. Couldn't be happier! Would definitely recommend this speaker!

author: Bruce Foster
title: I surprised by the sound
body: My son had one before me and the first time I heard it was an acoustic solo and I thought he was playing his guitar in our shop. I rolled out from under vehicle to see why he was goofing off. My hearing is not great and it brings out mid range parts in songs that I never knew were there.

author: ProbablyASatanist
title: Fantastic sound poor QC.
body: A definitive upgrade from the UE boom 2. Came exactly as advertised, battery can last well over 24 hours depending on the volume.*Edit* About two months after I purchased it the battery stopped charging. I was luck to get a return on it.Sound was great while it lasted.

author: Sparky
title: Smart choice of Speaker for my business and for conducting ...
body: Smart choice of Speaker for my business and for conducting presentations with its size and 360 degree sound. I found it user friendly right out of the shipping container. This UE MegaBoom charges quickly and holds a long 17 hour charge. Sound is very crisp and great tone. I would recommend this unit.

author: David F
title: Love this speaker
body: Love this speaker. I bought this for my parents as I have one myself. I have gone kayaking, gone to the beach, used it on the golf course and still no issues.

author: Ben
title: This is by far the most amazing tiny speaker I have had the pleasure of working ...
body: This is by far the most amazing tiny speaker I have had the pleasure of working with. Worth every penny.

author: Na9erab
title: Battery fail? Maybee..
body: The product had 40% of battery remaining as soon as i unboxed it. after using it once only i came to know that it wont recharge when i plug it in. The charging light indicator does not light up.  the speaker is not working at allPlease help.

author: CL
title: Sounds like garbage
body: I had read this was the best Bluetooth speaker available, but it sounds like it's already blown out, and it is almost impossible to play music in if you let it sit in the sun. Mind you it wasn't especially hot, in the 70s, but the speaker heats up and sounds like garbage.

author: Renee
title: Love this speaker!
body: When my husband first bought this, I didn't realize how much I would love it. The speaker quality is amazing and we literally use it everyday. The size is perfect and makes it great for throwing it in your golf bag for the course or just using it around the house.  Very pleased with this speaker.

author: Anthony R
title: Very Portable Speaker
body: Light weight, waterproof design, long battery life and shape make this a very portable Bluetooth speaker.  No fus parinig speaker with friends or my phones.Grips so far is the sound.  Hard for me to describe but not in love with it. Also to me you have to jack up the volume for the unit to be loud.

author: Wendy Zehr
title: Love it
body: I love this speaker!  Great sound compared to my mini boom.  I love to link it with a couple of friend's speakers when we get together too

author: Megan
title: Happy With this purchase!
body: My brother-in-law has been championing these speakers for a couple years now. My Bluetooth speaker died so I hopped on board, very happy.

author: JBH
title: Pairing Multiple Units Issue
body: I bought this to pair with my existing UE Megaboom.  Overall, it has worked well IF if I turn on the units in the same order every time.  But if I use this unit by itself and then pair or if I turn it on first, things don't work right.  I get a crackling sound.  I have to turn them off and start over.  I don't understand why but its annoying.Sound quality is good.  Mids are exceptional.  Bass extension is limited.  Wish UE made a subwoofer to pair with their speakers.Edit:  Just a huge disappointment.  Pairing has never worked right.  Okay as individual units.

author: happy customer
title: Good buy
body: Really like the performance sounds great.

author: Rafael Augusto
title: Good sound for the size, but missing AAC/aptX
body: The shockproof/waterproof aspect is nice, and so is the sound. However, it seems like the only Bluetooth codec supported is SBC; AAC or aptX would have been good additions. The bass is good, considering the snall size of the product.

author: Kyle
title: Super loud and clear
body: This thing is phenomenal. Super loud and clear, good bass too. Definitely worth the money

author: myjacksg
title: Quality & Price
body: good product, good price, fast shipping, would recommend to everyone

author: Crockett
title: New UE megaboom sold by Amazon directly
body: I like the UE megaboom from Amazon directly sold from Amazon. Ordered two other ones from other Sellers and not good. One had Chinese writing on the box. Thank you Amazon. This is really a good speaker.

author: Rebal
title: One in a million!
body: Recieved this product with an obviously blown speaker. I have heard other speakers made by this company and the sound was incredible and have heard no complaints from those whom have had them for years. I do believe that my speaker issue was a rarity.  I would feel confident in recommending this item to others.

author: RTD
title: Great speaker!
body: Great speaker with excellent base and ability to pair two speakers at once.

author: AddisonSusie
title: This is our 2nd BOOM
body: My husband uses this in his bathroom and we take it with us outside when working in the yard.

author: Travis
title: Little Speaker go BOOM
body: Took me 2 minutes of listening to order another for a pair!  Works great with the app, which you use to pair the 2 speakers, update the firmware, EQ settings, set alarm, etc.  Money well spent for an excellent sounding speaker, can't wait for the other to arrive.

author: john g willcox
title: Doesn't Work
