body: This was purchased as a retirement gift for a good friend and within a year the speaker will not charge. After a lot of back and forth between Logitech and myself, the speaker will still not charge.  I cannot recommend this product to anyone.

author: Michael E.
title: Bought a used-like new version
body: It was pretty close to the description of like new, it had one small scuff at the base of the plastic volume control panel...doesn't affect sound which is very good quality for the price I paid.  I love this thing and now our backyard is full of sound without additional wiring.

author: Layne Ryan
title: Damn!
body: This thing rocks! Great clarity on the highs and has decent bass response. I have a Harmon Kardon Go+Play and would take the Pepsi challenge against Bose and any of the other larger, well known brands any day of the week. But if you're looking for a smaller more portable unit this is where you need to go. Throw in the fact it's waterproof and it's one hell of a speaker. Considering getting another one for the stereo affect.

author: newagemom
title: Buy this one
body: This is the second Megaboom I have purchase as gifts for my college age sons and they love them. I have heard the sound quality as well and I think this is one of the best Bluetooth speakers in the market. Great battery life as well.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One of my Top Amazon Purchases
body: I’ve had my megaboom for about two years now after my roommate had gotten one and I love it. My brother and dad also got one around the same time. This is a great product and as you can tell once you get one, many of your friends will too, which is awesome because you can pair them up and have a megaboom party.

author: Norbert Ambenne
title: Great product, great sound.
body: This is an great bluetooth speaker with excellent sound quality and solid build.

author: StaycH
title: Amazing sound!
body: Amazing sound !! We already had boom so getting the megaboom was a no brainer.  It's still easy to carry/pack/take too. It came charged and ready to "boom". Super quick connection via Bluetooth also. So excited to use it.

author: Ben Dover
title: Battery life is terrible
body: Battery lasts 35 minutes after fully charging and it’s barely a year old!

author: Solipsis
title: Nice speaker but beware
body: I think this thing is pretty good. It sounds good and has a very long battery life. I'd be careful buying them online though, I bought one from a seller on here and it only lasted a week, I returned it and ended up buying one from a local store. The one I purchased online came in what looked like original retail packaging but the packaging was setup completely different than the one I bought from the store. I'm not sure if this is a sign that maybe the one I bought from here was a knockoff or what. I also was able to get the one from the store for 180 by price matching. I wouldn't pay over 200 dollars for this thing. It's good, but I don't think any of these bluetooth speakers are worth 300 dollars no matter how awesome they are. I wanted it primarily for my job, its got everything I need in terms of loudness, portability, and decent enough sound quality for a portable speaker. I also need durability, waterproof/dustproof since my job is very physical and I work outdoors over 10 hours a day no matter the weather.

author: Dennis P. Weisbruch
title: BIG IMPROVEMENT OVER UE BOOMS REPLACEABLE BATTERY
body: OUTSTANDING SOUND QUALITY BIGGEST CHANGE EASY BATTERY REPLACEMENT WHEN LITHIUM ION BATTERY GOES BAD AFTER 2 YRS

author: Kindle Customer
title: Horrible speaker!
body: I got the speaker today and the minute i turn it on it doesnt unless the charger connected to it. Then on top of that i hear the sound on it and it was horrible very static and was just all around bad. Dont get these speakers as a warning. Stick to jbl.

author: Emily Foster
title: Amazing speaker!
body: Amazing sound! WOW! Such clarity and sound. Beyond impressed. You won't be disappointed!

author: Alex
title: This is an amazing product. I have been using it for almost ...
body: This is an amazing product. I have been using it for almost a year and find it amazing. I have submerged it in water, and works perfectly after. The speaker has high quality sound, and is a perfect product to take to a party.

author: Almnb
title: Just perfect
body: Perfect, you won’t regret!!!

author: ellen s
title: super sound
body: made a great gift, really nice quality

author: Jason
title: Great Speaker with Great Sound.
body: Battery isn't that great!  Speaker quilty over all is about a 7 out of 10. Sound is great!  If the battery lived up to what it was supposed to, it would be a 10.  Battery Life is still decent though.

author: Tee S. Campion
title: Great sound, good value
body: Beautiful sound. Holds a charge nicely. Works well with the UE app. Travels well in it’s carrying case. Very good value and all the speaker I need

author: Ryan
title: The funny thing is i bought one before to do the ...
body: Hard to sync 2 together. I bought this so i could do this for a party. one of them ended up not being ablt to sync and the other turned off and every time i turned it on it turned back off with a wimpering noise. Ruined my event. The funny thing is i bought one before to do the same thing but it also has issues. I downloaded the app and updated all the software. Its a cool waterproof speaker but once you try to get them to sync up there can be static or connection issues via the app. If it was more reliable syncing with2 speakers I would give it 5 stars. as a single speaker its good but the jambox has more bass. If the jamboxes would sync with 2 I would get one of those instead.

author: That one guy
title: Absolutely Amazing Speaker - Great for the Outdoor Enthusiast!
body: Long review, so buckle up! I bought the Megaboom after buying the Boom II. I'll add a quick comparison overview at the end of this review.Short review: (scroll down for pros and cons) Excellent sound, excellent quality, and easy to use! 9.5/10Overview:The Megaboom is hands down the best wireless speaker I have owned.Utility: I bought it to use at several beach/river trips I had coming up during the summer. I tested to see if it actually floats in the pool, and it does! I threw it in, but it does takes a few seconds to resurface, but eventually it made its way back up. I clipped a carabiner and added a float device on as well so it would resurface quickly if anything happened, then hooked it to my tube and floated the river for 6 hours without any issues. I dunked it in the water a few times to show off a bit and everyone was impressed. I've taken it to the beach and set it in the sand and let it play. I even took it to a natural spring to hang out with friends. It is an absolute blast to be able to toss around the speaker and skip songs, or use the voice function to play a different one. Mostly I use this in the shower/bathroom when getting ready in the morning, and I typically have to charge it every 3-4 weeks, which is absolutely amazing!Sound: I am blown away by the sound from this wireless speaker. I have gotten compliments on it just about everywhere I bring it. I've already talked two people into buying it! The app does a great job of having some good pre-set sound settings (extra bass, voice boost for podcasts, etc.). The sound is extremely loud and can fill a room indoors. Outdoors it is loud enough to have a good time, without worrying about it easily being drown out. My only real complaint is that it seems to overheat in the sun and shut down after a few hours of direct sunlight, so I would quickly fix this by placing it under a beach chair or something similar.Pros:Shockproof!! (I dropped this (about 4 feet) in my bathroom on a tile floor and had a minor freak out knowing I joke broke my expensive speaker, but it just kept playing, no issues at all!)Waterproof/floatsVoice controlled audioExtremely strong soundMobileApp controlled/remote turn onVariable audio settingsLong battery life (sometimes I go 3-4 weeks without charging)Bluetooth range is extremely strong (I'll carry it with my as I do chores on different floors of the house without losing signal from my phone)Cons:Shuts down when in direct sunlightBattery life is a bit shorter when using at full volume outsideLong charge time (although can still be used while charging)Some people may say that the price point is a con, but you get what you pay for. This is a solid speaker that is worth every penny for the outdoor enthusiast!Megaboom vs Boom III initially bought the Boom II and absolutely loved it. I used it mostly indoors, and have zero complaints. The sound quality is great, but outdoors, is where the Megaboom really shines. If you are mostly indoors in smaller rooms, the Boom II is more than powerful enough. However, if you have large open areas, or are outdoors, always pick the Megaboom!

author: Pen Name
title: Speaker
body: Great speaker

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love this speaker
body: I purchased refurbished and it has worked out great.

author: Christy
title: Great speaker
body: Great speaker for the size

author: Marcy
title: Awesome mobile speaker
body: Very cool speaker, great bass, and super easy controls.  We bought a quick release clamp with a tripod fitting to attach it to the railing on our boat.  The battery life is awesome and the sound is even more awesome.  Sounds great on the water, in a room and in the car.

author: karvee kolliemelen
title: great
body: excellent

author: Amazon Customer
title: wonderful full sound
body: the sound quality is very very good.

author: aguilar2099
title: Easy to take every where you can
body: It's a decent size speaker easy to pair with any bluetooth device, the sound it's loud. I purchased two and look forward to get two more.

author: Joseph Russo
title: Best speaker ever
body: I love this speaker. It was recommended by a friend and its worth ever penny. The sound is incredible. Guests are always shocked when they see that the volume and quality of sound is coming from such a small speaker. Links easily to Bluetooth and you can even turn the speaker on from your phone.  The Charge lasts plenty of time and the unit takes up very little space.

author: Foster
title: ... from taxes and stuff and this speaker omg i love this thing
body: I got this because I got a lot of money from taxes and stuff and this speaker omg i love this thing, I don't always use it because sometimes the music I listen too I don't want everyone hearing and judging me for, I put this in my bathroom once with the fan on, my bedroom basically shares a wall with it and I was In my room and I could hear it clear, if you live in an apartment like I do don't worry it can go pretty quiet and very loud, sometimes I put my phone in a ziploc bag and take my phone and the speaker in the shower to listen to music,I don't have to charge it that often which is awesome and overall I would highly reccomend this speaker

author: efrain rodriguez
title: The best ever
body: I love this product wowwwwwe

author: rebecca jo griffin
title: Perfect small bluetooth device
body: My husband and I have been enjoying this little Megaboom. The only problems are, I do not like the look of the plus and minus on the top and when you walk away with your phone, the music stops, but that is to be expected. Other than that, it sound great to me, but I am not a sound expert.

author: Coach
title: Great sound!
body: Great sound.  Easy to use.  Connects easily.  Long battery life.  Loud.  Portable.  Waterproof.  Did I mention - Great sound!Dont think you need anything else in a portable speaker than what this has to offer.

author: Michael Vinyard
title: Great product!!
body: Great product, well built with awesome sound.

author: Stuart
title: We have the original Boom which is great but this MegaBoom is even better
body: We have the original Boom which is great but this MegaBoom is even better. The sound is great in the house and we used it in a open cabana for my son's birthday. It was very loud and clear, we had to turn the sound down so people could still talk. Absolutely love it!!!

author: Logan FitzGibbons
title: Best speaker I have ever owned
body: I am no speaker expert but I have owned my fair share of portable speakers. The Megaboom has great quality sound at all volumes. Great for parties. Well worth the money although I did get it on sale for $200

author: Tally Thoren
title: Great speaker, highly recommend!
body: Great speaker, very loud, great bass, very functional and easy to use. I have both the UE MEGABOOM and the JamBox by Jawbone. I compared the two and they basically have the same sound (if the UE MEGABOOM is not a bit "warmer" in sound). The fact that the MEGABOOM can get wet and is meant to withstand the bangs of everyday life... it is a great speaker to get!

author: Kolef88
title: Great sound and connection
body: UE Megaboom has a fantastic sound quality, with good bass and crisp highs.  At first I had trouble with the bluetooth connection ... turns out it was my old laptop's fault.  Got a new computer and -- bingo -- the connection is great.

author: gary pankratz
title: Great speaker
body: I love this speaker!!! Great clarity and good bass. Can be linked so I’m thinking of buying another one!

author: S.L.
title: Terrible sound quality
body: The speaker I received was a worthless piece of crap. All I could hear was bass, and everything else was horribly muffled and distorted even at low volume. Also, I bought it as a speaker to use with my laptop, but discovered the app/equalizer for it is  not available for Windows.

author: Rob
title: Couple touches, but very great speakers.
body: Expected a little better bass and quality for the price, but maybe i set my expectations a little too high. Great quality speakers that won't leave you disappointed, very light-weight, battery life is better than fair.

author: Jeremy
title: Not bad, but not great either.
body: Love the portability and the fact it's water/dust resistant, the sound is ok but nothing spectacular. I use it in a noisy environment at work and it's generally loud enough. My biggest gripe was that for a while I couldn't get it to take a charge, factory reset wouldn't fix it and I couldn't get it to update either. Finally when the battery was at "critical charge" I just factory reset it 3 times in a row, tried to update again and it finally worked. It now charges normally but I don't know if it will act up again. After the reset and update actually took hold the battery mysteriously went from "critical charge" level to 40%, this was not using the reading on my phone but when I pressed and held both volume buttons, the speaker itself tells you how charged it is. As a note this thing at max volume uses more juice than the charger can charge it with and will still slowly drain the battery. My equipment at work gets very loud which is why I need the max volume, your mileage may vary on this point. I won't be returning the item as I'm happy enough with it and it feels rugged enough to withstand my work environment but I wish I would have shopped around a little more.

author: Lisa A Danowski
title: Exceeded My Expectations
body: As a moderate audiophile, I was weary of the sound quality of this, or any bluetooth speaker. After listening to many types of music in different settings, I am very impressed. The equaliser works very well for achieving a desired balance between low, mid, and high frequencies, and the speaker can be oriented and postioned to further fine tune the sound. The bass reproduction is great, hitting all but the very lowest of frequencies. In some listening environments (high pitched background noise, for example) bass is a bit "boomy" but is easily remedied with the equaliser. The maximum volume is quite high, with minimal noticable compression (sound doesn't change when you crank it up!).As for features, the battery life is incredible. I use it around 6 hours per day, for 3 days before charging, and it usually has nearly 20% battery left. The range seems to be less than advertised, but is still very good. I haven't tested water proofing but Google images shows lots of brave people running water over it, putting it in fish tank, etc. The App works great and has never crashed on my android phone. The app gives equaliser controls and remote power option (and more), but is not required to have it running to connect or play music. The speaker connects almost immediately after being powered on, every time.As a nice touch, different sounds play for power on/off and connect/disconnect, and an audible battery level can be summoned anytime by pressing volume buttons simultaneously. This is really helpful since the speaker has no display itself.Overall this is a great product, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a premium quality bluetooth speaker with great sound and battery life, plus the protection offered by being water proof.

author: Dominick
title: Good value
body: This is a good sounding wireless speaker for the money. The bass response is excellent but lacking some "air" on the highs. I've owned a Bose wireless speaker which had a little better highs ans slightly wider stereo filed but was also more than twice the price.

author: Stephanie
title: Great for phones, not great for PC
body: Pros: The sound is 100% fantastic, it can't be beat.  I've downgraded to the JBL Flip4 since having the Megaboom and it doesn't sound nearly as good.  The Megaboom offers great sound and a very very surprising amount of bass for what it is.  If you're worried about which bluetooth speaker gives you the most BANG for the buck, stop here, this is it.Cons:  The EQ settings reset after disconnecting.  No Windows app or ability to control it other than using the speaker buttons.  Cannot use it for gaming on Windows laptop, it screws up all the mic coms settings because it has a mic built into it that can't be disabled.  If I could have used this thing for both my laptop AND my phone (I use the crap out of my laptop and phone daily), I'd have kept it.

author: Ernie de la Fe
title: Good sounds. Given the reviews I thought it would ...
body: Good sounds. Given the reviews I thought it would sound better. However, it does not sound as good and as clear as my JBL Charge 3.

author: Carol Kerr
title: Excellent if the battery life was as advertised
body: I love it except for the battery life! I bought the Megaboom over the Boom 2 strictly based on battery life. It was advertised at 20 hours but I only get 4-5 if I’m lucky. Sound quality is great especially for the size. I would give it 5 stars if I could use it all day without having to plug it in

author: yajaira mercado
title: Amazing sound, waterproof and long lasting battery.
body: Its amazing quality and 5 years ago would be perfect but with the new devices like alexa or google home it seems outdated to have just a device that only does bluetooth features. Its amazing bass though plus you can pair more than one. Its good to have by a pool or at the beach

author: Amazon Customer
title: Battery life nowhere near what's advertised
body: Not a bad speaker other than the battery life. I went for this speaker because of the heavily advertised "20 hour battery life". I've played through the battery on this speaker a few times now continuously and gotten at best 6 hours. Pretty disappointed. If I had known I wouldn't have spent the extra money.

author: pscoatx
title: Great gift
body: Gift for my son. He loves it. Sooo, its perfect.

author: Joe
title: Great speaker but expensive for what it is!
body: Great speaker but not worth the $300 plus I paid for it. Make sure you get it on sale or ebay for no more than $250 brand new. This is the best external speaker I have owned. But because of the price I don't think I can fully recommend.

author: Steven Reads
title: Yes. Buy it.
body: Excellent speaker for the price!

author: Dan J. Price
title: It's worth it!
body: I use this especially when I work out in my exercise room.  It's so handy to call up the song/playlist I want and get room filling, high quality sound.  I saw/heard a guy using this device on the beach in Key Largo in February and asked him about it.  Had to have one.

author: LS
title: This Boom ROCKS!
body: We love our Mega Boom. VERY EASY set up. Sounds great. Goes with us on the boat, playing outside, yard work, parties and more. Be sure to look in all the compartments for the charging accessories:)

author: bball
title: Not impressed
body: Very disappointed in the sound quality, especially for the price. Decent volume, but really doesn't get loud enough just playing inside the house. Not a very rich sound no matter how I tried to adjust the equalizer. Pre-set settings do not sound good, either. When you select the option to add more bass, it simply sounds like the music is muffled. Compared to other speakers I own, this one is just average. Probably more comparable to a $80-$100 speaker. Not at all happy that Amazon requires me to pay for return shipping, either. This will definitely impact the likelihood I'll ever buy something like this without testing it out first.

author: Oz
title: Five Stars
body: Love this speaker. The battery last forever and the sound is great after tuning it.

author: Justin B Oberg

title: I would buy this again.
body: Very good speaker.  Love the sound and feel.  Long battery life.  Waterproof.Base not quite as good as the Bose Soundlink Mini when I compared them side by side.

title: My megaboom
body: I can’t believe my mega boom stop working properly and I don’t use it that aften ...it’s not keeping charge the speaker has a buzz sound to it like the speaker damage...I really buy it to go fishing ...I’m so disappointed

author: Amy
title: Way overpriced for the quality of sound delivered
body: I love that this speaker can be controlled via the iphone. The app has a full equalizer with a few presets and a fully customizable treble and base range. It even allows you to apply firmware updates via the phone, and to easily change other settings on the speaker, such as pairing it with multiple devices at the same time. I love that it is battery powered, and comes with a brightly colored usb charging cable and adapter block. It also has a nice portable size and a hang loop for versatility. The bluetooth range is really good.I do not love the sound, for this price and for the reviews it has gotten I expected a fuller sound. It is bright and a little hissy, and the bass simply will not kick it. It also has a design flaw... if you turn the speaker on its end, the weight of the speaker presses the bluetooth button so you lose the signal. In other words, no you can't charge it while standing it on its end.For anyone who was wondering, there is absolutely no comparison between this speaker and the Fluance Fi50. The sound on the Fluance is much fuller, cleaner, and more pleasing.  I tried comparing rap, jazz, and salsa on both devices and across the board the Fluance sounds better than the Megaboom. So you choose - sound vs convenience...

author: Paul R.
title: The Best New Toy I've Had in Years!
body: I haven't enjoyed a purchase this much in a long time!  It's easy to set up and use and delivers enormous surround sound for such a small device. I can place it on the wall of my patio waterfall and control it with my iphone well over 50 feet away. I've downloaded playlists via the app Spotify and stream music to my UE Megaboom all day and night. The mobility of this device is limitless. I can take it camping, boating, to the stable, anywhere I take my iphone I can take this to enjoy great music. I bought it to provide great outdoor sound for an upcoming outdoor party. It has exceeded my expectations! And, you can pair it with another UE Megaboom to add t the experience in larger places. However I can't imagine a space so large you would need two of these.

author: J. VanGorp

author: D. Snipes
title: Battery Life and Bass Sound Are Not as Promised
body: The seller of this item is making some very specific promises that, in my experience, were not fulfilled. I'm going to  copy/paste straight from the product listing.1. "Freakishly amazing 360-degree sound with deep bass" - In my experience there was not deep bass. The bass was very thin and sometimes inaudible.2. "100 ft Bluetooth wireless range, 20-hour rechargeable battery* and ultra-fast micro USB charging (* Actual wireless range and battery life will vary with use, settings and environmental conditions)" In my experience I got 5 hours of playback, not 20. I did my best to extend the playback time by connecting through a physical audio cable and turning off Bluetooth, but it didn't help. Neither did I experience ultra-fast USB charging. In my experience it took over 2 hours of USB charging before the unit was able to be powered up.The main reason that I'm disappointed with the unit is the short 5 hour playback time. I wanted to use these speakers at work. My work day is usually 10 hours. Since the listing promised 20 hours of playback, I expected it to easily last through my entire daily work shift. It did not.Besides that, I'm disappointed with the sound quality. I realize that small speakers will never give you the full sound that even a 5" speaker can deliver, but the listing RAVES about how great it sounds. In my experience the sound quality was just OK. And the price! At this price point I certainly expected better.There are a couple of things that I was impressed with. The Bluetooth range is quite good. And it certainly is loud. But that's it.But I bought  a different wireless speaker unit made by TaoTronics called "Boom X" that has much better sound quality than the UE MegaBOOM. I use it at home, mostly in my bedroom. I tested them side by side, and the TaoTronics had better bass and just better overall sound quality than the UE MegaBOOM. I bought the TaoTronics Boom X in May, 2016 for $60. I just checked the price and the very same TaoTronics unit is currently selling on amazon for $36. For that price, the TaoTronics Boom X is an absolute steal.Here is a link to the listing:https://www.amazon.com/Bluetooth-TaoTronics-Subwoofers-Aluminum-Alloy-Microphone/dp/B013WPIGUA/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1484159159&sr=8-3&keywords=taotronics+bluetooth+speaker

author: tatonkaman
title: This is "THE" portable speaker to have...trust me on this one!!!
body: I love this speaker! My friend has a Beats Pill, can't even come close to comparing to the quality sound and the lows this speaker produces. The sound level is high enough that I can hear it while driving my side by side. But that's not really what its for, and you can't crank it up over all the road noise etc, but it's plenty loud for such a small package. The battery lasts an amazingly long time as well. I would definitely recommend this speaker, and may even be getting a second one to pair. Works phenomenally in my steam shower. I'm surprised how much I use it, and where I take it. Time will tell how it stands up to my abuse, but I'm betting it will work out just fine for me, and I know exactly which brand name I will use to replace it. The sound quality is so good, I wouldn't be happy with another brand now. Customizing the EQ on the App is key to a great sound!

author: Mr. Middle
title: Returned as didn't charge; new unit does charge.  But verdict is flimsy micro-USB charging port.
body: Mine arrived quickly and I downloaded the free app for iPhone.  From there I updated the firmware which took about 2 min total for the reboot.Then, played some music from my phone, and tested the volume.  Everything was great and even cranked up from the phone's volume rocker is was clear and bass was heavy.The downside?  It showed 40% charge off the get go (actually the app doesn't say the %, but the + and - can be pressed to announce it) and then plugged in the yellow charger to the wall and the yellow micro-USB cable to the Megaboom, but no LED light came on and the app didn't change to show it was charging.Checked the cable with another charger and a Kindle for my kid, and that worked so the cable is fine.Tried the 12V charger on an old Sony Handycam and it charged fine.So the unit itself is the issue and it was sent back.Update on 8-9-16:  New unit arrived (1 day shipping) and charges out of the gate.  Ok, I will diligently blow on the cable and charging port before re-sealing the bottom cover when it's done charging.  These are fragile on the unit so perhaps dust-off would be good.

author: Mickel
title: Four (4) months after purchasing this speaker it started to ...
body: Four (4) months after purchasing this speaker it started to malfunction. It would not take change but it started after a reset. Two months after that incident the same problem started again but the reset did not work this time. The battery is almost always at 40%,  when it dies and you leave it alone for  a while(about a week) it does back to 40% charge. Now as I'm posting the sound is starting to distort. title: Booming sound with amazing bass, durable quality, great value. The best choice for a portable party.
body: The best speaker I have ever purchased. Excellent connectivity, amazing sound and bass, great durability. I had a battery defect in my product, so I sent it in to Logitech for an RMA, and after going through standard troubleshooting procedures with me, they had me send the product in and immediately shipped out a new one to me without issue. The whole RMA process only took 12 days, including 2 days to ship, 4 days for them to receive and confirm, and other 6 days to receive my replacement product, quite painless. Yes, defects happen with every product no matter how high quality, and its in cases like this that quality of customer service and warranty count most. If I want bigger sound, I will buy more of the UE Megaboom speakers and link them, perhaps even create surround sound. This product is the #1 option for a portable party!

author: Patrick Brennan
title: CHOOSE THIS ONE!
body: This speaker is magnificent. I bought it to use with my mac (cuz I'm old and make playlists for parties and play them through iTunes, as opposed to playing them from my phone). Anyway, I put the speaker on top of a tall (7') book shelf in the corner of one of the rooms in my open-plan house and it sounded great in that room, one room over in either direction, and two rooms over in either direction. I mean it sounded really great! And I did not have to blast it. It's as if the sound waves just magically moved through the house without diminishing. The battery is also no joke: I charged the speaker up, which did not take long since it arrived mostly charged, and ran it via Bluetooth for eight hours nonstop about 40 feet from my computer (and through two walls). When I checked the battery power at the end of the night, expecting it to be around 40%, I was shocked when it told me it was at 80% power. It took a lot less than an hour to charge it back up to 100%. I haven't even commented on its design, which is flawless. I got the one in black. It looks so unassuming and classic: then it creates this stupendous sound! It cost 300 smackers, but so did every other high quality wireless speaker I looked at, and none of them looked this good or featured this kind of battery life. According to the Interwebs, you can even drop this speaker in the pool and it will be A-OK. I cannot say enough good things about this speaker! I did buy the extended warranty because a few folks on here said they had problems with this speaker's predecessor after a year or so.  I also had to go to YouTube to figure out how to open the packaging to get at the actual speaker- duh- and how to use the speaker, but, like I said, I'm kinda old, so I'm used to doing that kind of thing. If you are deliberating between this speaker and some other one, choose this one!

Had one that stopped working 1 year and 3 months after I bought it.  They replaced it free of charge despite being so far outside of the warranty period.  They never even raised it as an issue -- they stand by their product.  I'm listening to the one they just sent me right now.  Quite happy.

author: Ashlie Lee
title: MY FAVORITE SPEAKER
body: This is my new favorite Bluetooth speaker. I have had many Bluetooth  speakers including the Beats Pill, Bose Soundlink, and the Jawbone Jambox. The UE Megaboom  beats all of these both for sound quality and durability. But first let's talk about packaging. The outer packaging was great which is what is to be expected of Amazon. The inner packaging however was also awesome. The speaker was encased in a hard plastic case that was cyndrilical. The charger was tucked away in a neat little compartment. Suffice it to say,  I knew the speaker was going to be great right from the moment I opened it.Upon opening the package I powered on the  speaker which was fully charged upon arrival. It took about 5 seconds to connect to my phone and wow. The sound was incredible. Blows all others out of the water both figuratively and literally because it's submersible and is able to go where some speakers can't. I have taken this speaker to the beach twice and the river once and it preformed like a champ. Great purchase. If your on the fence about buying this, don't be. Just do it.

body: I originally bought a refurbished UE Boom a while ago. Loved it but I wanted something with longer battery life ad more loudness. I purchased the UE  Megaboom a few months ago. It has a lot better battery life but in the loudness department I'm not sure if it's a lot louder. The biggest thing I don't like about it is that it's huge. The original Megaboom could fit in a large pocket, or jacket pocket. The Megaboom is pretty light but it's unwieldy. I bought the MegaBoom to listen to music in my car while driving but it won't fit in my cup-holder, it rolls around on the floor. If I stop to go somewhere I have to make sure to put it in my trunk. The original UE Boom and the UE Boom 2 you can just grab and shove it in your pocket. I've decided to sell my  Megaboom and purchase either a UE Boom 2 or a UE Boom Mini.

body: This speaker is great! I love the sound and its durrable and waterproof.  The only reason I'm giving it the 4 stars is because the first one that I got worked fine for a week, but then stopped working on me. What was interesting is that the first one I got was a little different than the second one in that the buttons were much much harder to push on the bad speaker than the replacement. I don't think that has anything to do with why it broke, but it was interesting.  I think it was just a lemon.  The blutooth range really is great, the bass is not mind blowing, but its not bad at all.  The speaker goes very loud and even sounds good and clear at the loudest volume. author: E. Miller
title: DON'T BUY TWO - one works well but ...
body: DON'T BUY TWO - A single speaker works well but the bluetooth linkage between two for a stereo effect isn't ready for prime time. Linking two speakers, even when they are always plugged in, takes time and often has to be done manually. The app is able to properly link speakers on the first try maybe 20% of the time. The weak linkage often results in clipping in one or both speakers which really ruins the sound.Distance isn't the issue. This issue occurs when the distance from my I-phone to either speaker is only 10 feet and in the same room. Interference isn't an issue as I've moved the speakers around and still experience difficulty linking two and clipping.If I were rating just one speaker I'd give 5 stars. My experience with two speakers is bad - $300 is a lot to pay for a two speaker system that essentially doesn't work properly most of the time.

author: Jenson Titus Lavallee
title: On the fence? Stay there and read this review!
body: This is the best portable speaker on the market. My boyfriend and I were between the Bose Soundlink III and this. We bought both and tested them out ourselves. Here's what we found:Bose:Clearer, sharper tone at lower volumes, but became muddled and distorted at the louder volumes.UE Megaboom:Sounds a bit weak at a lower volume, but this is only because of the 360 design. The speaker sounds great at lower volumes when placed near a corner. When you turn this thing all the way up its crystal clear and completely fills a large room.Not only is it a better speaker, but it's more durable, so you can take it to the beach/pool/etc. The Bose is much more delicate.**UPDATE** DON'T BUY IT!!!About a week in to having this speaker, I turned it up pretty loud and I could've sworn something had blown. It sounded strange. I decided to ignore it and press on, but then at an event I was hosting I had TWO of these suckers on full blast and had someone come up to me and it was barely breaking over the sound of the crowd. It was an open, square studio space with decent acoustics... I had someone come up to me and ask if they could go any louder. No. The answer was no. TWO "Mega"booms ($500 worth of stereo equipment) could barely carry a room of 20 people.I went on the hunt again and found the Marshall Kilburn speaker. Much, much better. Gonna spend about $50 more for it, but it's worth it. It's much better than the Megaboom. The problem is that any portable bluetooth speaker just can't deliver what a speaker that plugs in to the wall can give you. I bought the Marshall Kilburn and the Marshall Woburn. The Woburn is out of this world. The sexiest sound I've ever heard from a personal speaker. The Kilburn is a magnificent portable bluetooth speaker.After trying all of the top brands (Bose, Megaboom, Jambox, Marshall) It's a definite with the Marshall Kilburn.

author: Hanssen J.
title: Favorite Speaker So Far!!!
body: The UE Megaboom is a relatively small speaker that is still portable yet delivers a loud and full sound. The Megaboom can seem a bit too big for some but in my opinion it is the perfect size. The genius design of this speaker allows it to deliver a nice loud and punchy sound with a relatively small form factor. The 360° soundstages allows it to fill a room with no problem without having to fidget around trying the get a "perfect spot" for the audio playback. When it first arrived I carefully examined the speaker to see the build quality. I found a spot that worried me since the cloth mesh did not cover and seal a part of my unit, however, I decided to test it's waterproofing and specifically in that area. I found no problems and the speaker continued to work great. This speaker gets really loud and that is big plus since I bought it for the purpose of using to get people hyped up for some football games. As great as the loudness can be the only downside I see about this speaker that keeps me from giving it a five star rating is it's battery life. The official documentation suggests a 20 hour battery life on a full charge. In my testing the speaker could surpass 20 hours on mid volume to low volume, however if you crank it up to 100% the speaker will last for about 7 hours. Now this is probably not a problem for most people but I did expect to get a bit more juice. Overall this is my favorite speaker by far. Many prefer the JBL extreme and while I have to agree that sound quality may be better, there is no denying that the UE Megaboom just has better portability and still delivers a great sound.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Hi-FI bluetooth speaker without the hassle of wires! 10/10
body: Outstanding, phenomenal, Hi-FI quality sound out of a bluetooth speaker.I tested the UE Megaboom with Zoe Keatings Escape artist at 720P and was blown away at the reproduction of the Cellos deep bass and clear reproduction and clarity throughout.The design is rugged and simple, minimal without being ostentatious. The speaker blends into the surrounding to shock listeners with its 360 sound. This speaker fills the room with Hi-fi sound and so far after its initial charge for about 18 hours continuous play.Would recommend without reservation for home, party, work, camping.

author: Justin Van Alstyne
title: Absolutely buy it. Love this thing!
body: Pretty much one of my most coveted gadgets. People are always shocked at how much sound this thing can pump out. Battery lasts forever. Water resistant. Very durable construction. Very good setup and config app for your phone. I use it outside on the patio, in the garage working, camping, sometimes even in the house because it's faster/easier to get it playing than my home theater setup. I even take it rock climbing with me sometimes. You may think the heavy weight is a negative, but for me, that just means it's built better.

Hands DOWN!Pros- Loud and clear sound for the size (Sound quality exceeds any similarly priced BT speakers)- Can be linked to another one for even louder, clearer sound- Easy to pair and operate- Reasonably portable- Water Resistant! I use it in the shower! :)- Battery life is great!Cons- Android app is sort of buggy- Default EQ is pretty base-heavy- Price- A bit on the heavy side, but has to be for the volume and bass you get out of itWARNING: Bringing this to events/parties with your friends will DEFINITELY make their non-UE BT speakers sound terrible, resulting in envy, and possibly spite.

title: Rough and tough
body: I work in a warehouse job and use this amazing speaker as my means of entertainment for the night. I must say I've been nothing but impressed by this thing.. Today just added more to it.. I cut a corner on my forklift too close and my speaker clipped a beam and fell to the ground. Before I knew what was happening it was on the ground and under my forklift.. Rather than getting squished by my wheel I was amazed when I saw it shoot out from underneath my lift like a dark gray rocket.. The wheel left 2 scuff marks on the speaker and that's it. No other damage, no operational issues.. Still perfect.. Love this thing!(2 images of scuff marks for viewer convenience)

author: GeezingInVA
title: Great Sound!
body: This is my first wireless Bluetooth speaker, and so far it's turned out to be a terrific choice. I purchased the MegaBoom to have music out by the pool, and it's sturdy enough, has great sound, and it's plenty loud enough to fill that purpose perfectly. I'm a bit disappointed in Bluetooth's range, but the MegaBoom's Bluetooth connects easily to every gadget I've got: desktop PCs, laptops, 'Droid phone, and my Kindle. Since WiFi has a better range, I just use either my phone or my Kindle at the pool over my home's WiFi signal running a Pandora stream, and that feeds the MegaBoom. It's a perfect setup for the pool.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great sound, finicky charger.
body: ***HAVING TROUBLE CHARGING?  I love this product, but when the battery gets extremely low it doesn't want to charge. When you plug it in, the LED flashes 3 times and then nothing.  To work around this, you need to have the original fluorescent yellow charger. Plug in said charger, let the LED blink until it goes out, unplug, replug, repeat.  Do this 3-4 times and it will start charging like normal.I tried this technique using my cell phone charger and no joy.  SO KEEP THE ORIGINAL CHARGER.

author: BSkando
title: *** WARNING: UE MEGABOOM ANDROID APP IS BROKEN!!! ***
body: BEFORE YOU BUY, UNDERSTAND THAT THE NEWEST UPDATE TO THE ANDROID APP IS BROKEN!!!  Logitech has not done anything to fix it!I've had one of these for about 7 months now and even bought a second one so that i could use the "Party up" feature to use them in stereo.  I'll start off by saying that the audio quality is very good on these speakers!  There is no complaint for me on that.However, the recent update to the android app is has almost completely disabled advertised functionality of the speakers.  To be specific:1) In order to use both speakers in stereo, I have to unpair/repair the speakers EVERY time i use them.  Otherwise, the UE Megaboom app will not recognize that they are connected.  I've had the same problem with three different android devices now, so it's not my phone!  So, if you plan on using two of them, get ready for a giant hassle.2) The previous version of the app allowed for power up and power down of the speakers from your phone.  They have removed this function from the most recent version of the app with no warning.  If i had known they were going to do this, i would have blocked the app update on my phone.  To me, this is one of the more attractive features, since im not always sitting right next to my speaker.3) The most recent SPEAKER update succeeds in the app but the app tells you that it failed and that you have to update via USB.  When you update via USB, it tells you the speaker is already up to date.  This identical issue happened with BOTH of my speakers.Before you buy these, go look at the reviews of the UE Megaboom app on the google play store and you will see that this is a problem that EVERYONE is having, yet Logitech has refused to address the issue.Bottom line, these are great sounding speakers with HORRIBLE support from logitech...almost to the point of rendering the speakers useless!  I highly recommend NOT buying these until Logitech addresses the unacceptable flaws in their app!

author: Shirleydoes
title: DIsappointing
body: Defective upon arrival. (speaker buzzed) support was slow. Tried every trouble shoot. Failed. Returning. Note: bluetooth cut in and out when "doubled-up" with second (purchased)Megaboom in field-test at beach setting. Possible interference from other cell phones with bluetooth turned on. No known way of preventing environmental interruption. Did not happen at home setting. Tried again at public park. Same result... signal interruption. Charge at full volume playing Joe Strummer/Clash, etc starting at fully conditioned internal batteries a week prior, at full charge to power down, lasted maximum 5.5 hours. Both Megabooms depleted power roughly 5 minutes apart. Disappointing.

author: Ol Traish Possum
title: Blows the BOSE system out of the water!
body: I'm an audio guy professionally. I have very high standards when it comes to equipment. That being said, this is an awesome little boombox. Very clear audio, BIG sound (even at low volumes), flat frequency response. Not studio monitor flat, but it's not advertised as such. Battery life is insane, it just keeps on going. For extended sessions, we use a 10,000 mAh battery pack from the get go to maintain the charge as long as possible, and it keeps going for DAYS. Tough and well built, too. Wish it came with a case, but there are many options out there from third party vendors. All in all, VERY satisfied.

author: Brian James Simpson
title: you get big sound good highs & lows out of a farily compact speaker ...
body: I do a lot of water sports and I've taken this speaker out on dive boats, river tubing, to the beach, down to the pool, kayaking, etc.  Gotta have my music.  NOTE:  This is my second speaker.  The first one proved to be not so waterproof while I was rinsing it off under the kitchen faucet after taking it out on a dive boat for a day to get any salt air off of the case.  The seller replaced the original with minimal hassle and I've had the second one out several times with zero issues, although I haven't put it under the faucet.  Regardless, you get big sound good highs & lows out of a farily compact speaker that will last several hours at max volume or nearly a full day at lower volumes.  Great for camping and day trips.  I don't use the bluetooth feature which would probably drain the battery faster on the speaker as well as my phone, so I just use a cord.  Very happy with this product so far and my friends are definitely glad I bought it.

author: AH
title: Tiny and powerful
body: Mysteriously good sound seems to defy physics (no idea how they get such deep bass from 3" woofers).Loud-enough for all but the rowdiest of pool parties.18-20 hour batteryBluetooth 4.0 has no audible compression artifacting, and way better range than older variants.The main weakness is that the water proof rubber covers for the aux and charger are a hassle to pop open, charger finicky to sit recessed deeply enough.Is it worth the extra money over a Boom? I can't say, never listened to one, but I think it's worth the money.

author: Jonathan Baird
title: Excellent hardware. Deeply flawed software. (EDIT: misleading advertising)
body: The UE MEGABOOM is an excellent bluetooth speaker that can be incredibly frustrating to 'DoubleUp' with another MEGABOOM in stereo. While there is payoff of having two speakers in stereo (the sound quality really is superb), the ease of doing so is hit-and-miss on mobile devices (iOS/Android) and absolutely *nonexistent* on computers (Mac/PC). If you're looking for a pair of flexible bluetooth speakers that can be used for both your mobile device *and* computer, UE will need to work on making their DoubleUp software available to Mac/PCs before I can recommend.EDIT: UE Customer Service has informed me that they are not planning on adding compatibility to Mac/PCs anytime in the near future. I have dropped my rating by an additional star (down from 3) and may return both speakers due to misleading advertising if I am unable to find a workaround.

author: briankangaroo
title: DONT UPGRADE FIRMWARE
body: This is a great speaker and I love so much about it. Sadly the software that powers it is not. It pains me to give less than five stars, but please see reviews in so store before buying. One star for MEGABOOM. After firmware "update" Audio lags about one second when playing video on iPhone or MacBook. I have two and unit without update works fine. Last ap update also hid alarm feature in a menu. How can you have such a wonderfully designed piece of hardware technology paired with such poor software and ui? Odd. I'd really think twice before buying again because of the software issues.

author: SnuggLife
title: Outstanding  Sound.
body: It’s just great. I bought it over Bose due to the battery and because it  Doesn’t need a proprietary charger.  However, if you lose or break the charger get a new one that has enough power.  Most high amp anker chargers work and are cheap.  Don’t just plug any usb in it.  It’s like charging an iPad with an iPhone charger.  Will take forever if it even charges at all.  This is not logitechs fault.  I am sure they get returns for battery issues with people using wrong charger.  Also speaker placement increases volume.  Put it 4-8 inches from the wall.  Distortion if you even get any at all is due to the source.  Always keep your phone volume less than 100 % as you should plugging it into Any stereo.

The clarity of the speaker is excellent, even at loud volumes. And it can get loud!  I use it at backyard problem with no issues filling out the sound.  The ability to pair it up with other Booms for stereo sound is an added plus.  The battery lasts long and it actually has a decent app.  I highly recommend it.

author: Nabil Durand
title: Love it, even though it requires frequent hard resets for bluetooth pairing
body: The sound is incredible - 5 Stars. Pair it with your laptop, watch a movie, and it sounds like Dolby THX or IMAX in your own home. The ugly - 3 stars - the speaker must be hard-reset (hold power and minus button for 10 seconds) every time it bluetooth pairs with a different device. Switch from phone to tablet..hard reset... switch from tablet to laptop.. hard reset... switch from laptop back to phone...hard reset.... I reported this to UE Customer Service and received a brand new speaker... with the exact same problem. Oh well. it sounds great, so I'll live with the hard resets.

author: Krystal Glover
title: The original has made it through some good times while playing loud music over long periods of ...
body: I have had a MegaBoom for over a year. The original has made it through some good times while playing loud music over long periods of time.  It is a rugged speaker that has taken many tumbles out of a golf cart at high G's.  I just had to purchase a second one (replacement) due water damage.  I would recommend to you that you avoid water if possible.  My speaker was not submerged but it was exposed to salt water while I was drinking rum on raft down in front of the Soggy Dollar Bar in the BVI's.  I personally do not think there is a better speaker on the market right now with all the rugged features.  It would be awesome if it was truly water proof to a decent depth just in case it falls out of boat giving you enough time to dive for it once you have found a mask.

author: Austin J.
title: This product has serious battery problems
body: This speaker worked great for a couple of months and then the battery just basically died. I also only used this product 5-6 times during that couple of months. I purchased this item less than a year ago and now it won't charge pass 40%. One day, it just decided that it wouldn't charge at all. I would charge it for hours and it would still be at 0%. I looked online, read reviews, read blogs, watched YouTube videos and even went to the ultimate ears website (which offered no help). I found a couple videos on YouTube of people resetting their speaker, so I tried that and now it won't go past 40%. The bottom charging light indicator will also not light up anymore.What stinks the worst? Amazon won't even give me the option to return or replace this defective device. I honestly logged on to try and either return or replace it, since it does advertise a 2-year warranty and it hasn't even been a year.I have seen so many people post online about having the same issue but I haven't found a legitimate fix. If you are interested in buying this product, just google "UE Megaboom won't charge" and you will find countless situations like mine. There are a few videos that claim they found the fix, all they recommend is a factory reset, which didn't work for me or a lot of other people.In my opinion, don't even consider buying this product. Some customers receive good working devices but there are to many others like me that get ones that fail after only a short period. You are better off buying a more reliable product from countless other brand name companies.

author: Jon
title: From a Bose fan
body: Speaker is well made and has excellent features. Even the charger and cable is of high quality. But the sound it's what's most important. It's loud for sure and does an excellent job of not being sensitive to placement and projects 360 as advertised for the most part.However, the over sound quality just doesn't do it for me. Judging by the other reviewers they seem to like it but compared to Bose it is no where near as warm, as accurate, as detailed and has no where near the base. The base of the Megaboom is boomy for sure, remind me of an old school ported subwoofer that doesn't hit the low frequencies at all but does a decent job of fooling you to believe it is. If you listen primary outdoor and need the rugged features it's a great speaker but if the best sound is what you care about get a Bose mini or other product. I personally think the mini sounds better than the soundlink 3.

author: nonniemoose
title: An all-around great speaker but I'm upset about a removed feature.
body: I've had this speaker for 10 months and I use it almost daily. Until a recent firmware update, this product would have received 4 stars but I'm compelled to write a review due to my recent issue. Logitech Tech Support confirms that the new firmware update removes the ability to connect to two devices simultaneously, even though this is still advertised on their website as a feature (screenshot included). This advertised feature will probably be removed soon as I informed them of this misinformation. I'm truly disappointed that my device lost a feature that I enjoyed and utilized frequently. I would connect to both my laptop and phone simultaneously while working and if I began to use the other device, I would never have to reconnect to the speaker: it would automatically switch sources depending on my use. Now, I have to manually go into the settings of the device I'm using as it remembers only the device that I last had it connected to.Pros:• Loud as can be. One of these fills spacious rooms with 10 foot ceilings quite well for its size. I take it around the house with me depending on what room I feel like working in and I'm always pleased. It is superb in the close confines of the bathroom (shower jams are the best!).• Waterproofing has yet to fail me. After months of only permitting splashes, I summoned the bravado (and wanted to brag to my friends) and dunked it into the hot tub while it was playing music for over a minute. There was no disruption. I was very impressed.• Excellent battery life. I've never measured it, but I can go for several days before I charge it.• "Bluetooth Smart" is a very convenient feature from the phone utilizing Bluetooth 4.0 LE. I can lazily turn on my speaker from my phone's app without having to push the manual button (attached screenshot). I cannot notice a significant battery drain and I leave this on continuously.• The equalizer settings in the UE Megaboom app are useful - there are presets as well as customization of 5 frequency ranges (attached screenshot).Cons:• Aside from the firmware update mentioned, there is no AAC support which would provide better audio quality.• The fidelity is not great - especially on the higher frequencies. When listening to spoken audio (e.g. podcasts) I have to turn up the volume louder than I would like, even if I adjust the equalizer settings.Other observations:• I am not certain if this is due to a firmware update (oh the irony if it were) or my familiarity with the device, but the tap-to-pause/tap-to-skip function has become easier over time. Originally, I would attempt to double-tap the top (to skip to the next song) and it would only pause the song (as if it only registered one tap). This does not happen anymore.• Recharging the speaker almost demands their proprietary Micro USB cable due to the deep recessing of the port (ostensibly for waterproofing). This can be inconvenient if I do not have the cable with me as all others I have tried do not fit.I have never used the double-up feature because I don't have a second speaker nor do I know anyone who does. I sure would like to try it one day.This speaker is heavy but I chose the UE Megaboom for a reason - I wanted exceptional battery life, a loud volume, and waterproofing. I do a lot of car camping so this is what I was looking for most of all. With these three features, the UE Megaboom was a great choice.

author: K Larrabee
title: Speaker is great, but the power adapter renders it useless - and dangerous
body: TL;DR - HUGE SAFETY CONCERNSAs a speaker, I really love the MEGABOOM. The volume and sound quality are about what I'd expect (or even hope) from this price point and format, and the simplicity of its design & controls means I don't spend time fiddling around with using it - I just use it and listen!The bluetooth connection is a little crappy, because it can sporadically lose connection to devices within 8 feet away, but it regains connection pretty quickly.What makes this a 1-star review though is the power adapter.My (now) wife and I ordered this a year ago to use for our small wedding reception. We received it, charged it, tested it, and used it for several hours' worth of streaming music during our wedding (pre-ceremony, cocktail hour, and reception). It worked out perfectly!We charged it a little (charge #2) and put it on the shelf, where it sat unused for probably 10 months, and we stored all peripherals (adapter components & cable) in the box it arrived in and put the box in a dry plastic bin in the closet.I started using the speaker again for occasional background music while I work about 2 weeks ago and have since charged it 2 more times (4-5 charges total across the year we've had it).Now, I am unable to charge this any further, as the power adapter SPARKS in every outlet we have tested it in (our apartment and elsewhere), and even leaving it in the outlet afterward (watching it the entire time) it cannot charge the speaker. The adapter sparks regardless of whether the speaker is plugged in or whether the USB cable is plugged into the adapter.The speaker charges via USB, but that USB cable cannot be plugged into any outlet <-> USB adapter - it requires the full power adapter. A power adapter that has been used about ~5 times and always stored properly/safely in between uses. Absolutely ridiculous.Needless to say, our UE MEGABOOM would be a fully-functional, great speaker - if we could charge it. Instead, it is now a paperweight.

author: Jeffitz
title: Feature Rich, but Sound Quality Deficient When Compared to Soundlink III.
body: I had high expectations for the UE Megaboom since I was looking for something with more features and longer battery life to replace a Bose Soundlink III. Amazon had the charcoal version selling for over $100 off the normal price, and I thought that was a great time to try out the Megaboom since I'd read favorable reviews and liked the look of the design.I've been frustrated with the Soundlink III primarily because of the lack of features, most notably not being able to tell when it's reached max volume with an audible cue and the fact that it demands you hold the volume buttons down to change the volume rather than allowing incremental presses (why can't I take it to full, and then just back it off three presses?). The Soundlink III also only has a rudimentary light denoting battery level that doesn't give you more of an indication than low, medium or fully charged. I liked that the Megaboom has these relatively simple features. I liked that Logitech has an app for their speaker and that they appear to make firmware refinements, whereas I don't think Bose has done anything to update the Soundlink III to add some simple features despite having a dedicated USB port on the back for that purpose; even the Bose Mini II has more features than the dramatically more expensive Soundlink III.So, why only three stars for the Megaboom? Well, primarily audio quality. I'm odd in that I'm really not interested in a portable speaker through which to play music from a phone or tablet. I want to use it as a portable external speaker for my Traveler guitar using the AUX input. This use quickly demonstrated some shortcomings in the Megaboom.First, was that a strong bass note like the low E will make the Megaboom's speakers buzz and breakup at high volume. This does not happen with the Soundlink III, at any volume. The same goes for hitting muted power chords. The Megaboom just can't handle them gracefully the way the Bose speaker can. I should add here that the Megaboom is a bit louder than the Soundlink III at top volume, and when I lowered the volume of the Megaboom using a dB meter for a fair comparison the problem was less noticeable, but still there. When hitting a low E chord, the other higher notes helped to mask the buzzing from the bass note, but it was still there if you listened closely. I also tried using the equalizer in the Megaboom app, and the "Custom" equalizer setting knocked the bass back a bit emphasizing the mids and alleviated the buzz at the highest volume, but not still not entirely. When listening to music, you'd probably notice this while listening to any music at higher volumes with a strong bass line. This would bother me. Again, the bass on the Soundlink III remained clear and defined at all volumes without having to try and manipulate anything. I want to add here that the Bose Soundlink Mini II exhibited the same raspy buzz when confronted with deep bass notes that sounds very similar to that of the Megaboom, so I sort of feel like the Megaboom has a sound quality similar to that of the much less expensive Soundlink Mini II, while only offering a little more in terms of volume.The second thing I noticed was that there was a noticeable delay of about a 1/8 second from striking a note on the guitar to hearing it through the Megaboom, and this was through the AUX input, not via bluetooth. I can only imagine that the delay through bluetooth would be even more noticeable. I guess the Megaboom's doing quite a bit of processing to the music, even to an uncompressed source coming in through the aux input. I'm sure there is somewhat of a delay using the Soundlink III and Mini II as well, but it wasn't discernible and I'd be likely to drive myself mad trying to hear it. So, if someone's application for the Megaboom speaker demands low latency (as in viewing video with audio), then it would probably be a disappointment. For simply listening to music, it would be fine.The third failing I noticed was while being paired with my iPhone 7. While paired, the Megaboom issued at high pitched hum/squeal. Not something you'd hear from a few feet away, but up close (2-3)' and without any music playing it was audible. The sound would immediately disappear when I unpaired the speaker from my phone. Didn't experience anything like this with the Soundlink III or Mini II.While I found the physical design of the Megaboom aesthetically pleasing, when placed horizontally, the cylindrical Megaboom obviously will want to roll. If you intend to use the AUX input and/or charge it while in use, you are basically forced to place the speaker into this horizontal position. Not really a big deal since it does find a resting place when the rubber strip along the side with the volume buttons settles onto a flat surface. However, in that position you want the speaker grill facing you, but that means the volume controls are now faced both away from you and slightly underneath the speaker which makes them hard to get to, to the point where I found myself having to pick the speaker up to change the volume. I'm pretty certain I would always find that annoying. You could place the speaker on end with the AUX and USB inputs facing up, but then the power and Bluetooth buttons are entirely underneath the speaker, which isn't ideal either.Overall, I'd say that if you're using the Megaboom at low levels in a quiet environment, these issues would probably not be issues, nor would they be if you're using it in a loud environment at higher volumes where a lot of ambient noise would drown the deficiencies. My intended use was a bit more demanding than that from a sound quality perspective. If the many features of the Megaboom, durability, and considerably longer battery life are really important to you, then I'd say it's a decent choice. For my purposes with the Traveler guitar, the Bose Soundlink III was clearly and immediately the better choice in terms of sound quality, so I guess I'm stuck with the niggling little deficiencies of that speaker for a while longer.

author: Mike
title: I though to myself how cool it is that the manager lets them play good ...
body: I went shopping at my 24 hour grocery store one night around 12:30 am. While I was shopping, I noticed that they were playing dubstep over the main speakers. I though to myself how cool it is that the manager lets them play good music late at night when the store is empty and the re-stockers are working. I then turned down another isle and noticed the music getting quieter. As I proceeded down isle 5 I heard Toto's "Africa" over my head. I quickly grabbed what I needed and went back to my original isle. Thats when I heard the good music again. I went down the next isle and saw a re-stocker jamming out to music while he was restocking the canned foods. That's when I noticed the UE Megaboom hanging from his cart.I yelled at him to see what was making the noise. He turned down the music so we could actually hear each other, and so I could get a closer look at this amazing speaker. Let me tell you, this thing is so load and has such amazing bass for a portable speaker! I was blown away.I promptly purchased on off of Amazon and am so glad I did. Since this has a hook for a carabeaner, I was able to attach it to the top of my gazebo with a pulley. I can now jam out in my backyard while this thing pumps out music link no one's business! The 360 degree sound is awesome, and the companion app is a nice touch. SO excited for years of great music from this thing.

The seller was EXTREMELY helpful in dealing with all of the hassle in getting Logitech to replace the item under warranty. I HATE dealing with warranty issues as the company always make it as difficult as they possibly can. The seller simply HANDLED it and had logitech ship me a replacement unit. The seller and the employee in question, Casey, were an absolute delight to deal with and really went above and beyond getting the situation sorted for us. Thanks!

title: and I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to recommend this one to you over either one of those
body: I have used, or heard UE's saucer type speaker, and the smaller "roll" style speaker, and I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to recommend this one to you over either one of those. You pay more yes, but: the speaker's rechargable battery lasts forever, the sound for a portable speaker is great, it is seemingly durable, the range of the bluetooth is impressive, and it's versatility as a car speaker, computer speaker, outdoor activity speaker etc is just some of the reasons I recommend the megaboom to you. I hope to keep this for a long time, but as it stands now, I would see myself replacing this one with another if it was damaged or malfunctioned.

Now I have a $300 fancy looking paper weight.  I have contacted customer support but all they told me is that it should be able to charge with any micro USB, and I can buy from them.  I actually have several micro USB cables from different phones and other devices.  None of them work.  I am currently not very happy my speaker will not work anymore.UPDATE May 17 2016Customer support has been helpful trying to figure out problem.  Now the say the speaker s defective and will check into the warranty.  I am hoping they replace the device.  Otherwise this rating will need to drop to 0 stars! author: John T.
title: Would be a 5 star review if not for their customer service.| But the more I use I realize it's just not a great product
body: I purchased this speaker because a friend of mine had the UE Boom and I was always impressed at how good it sounded. So I decided since I already had a smaller bluetooth speaker I would buy the MEGABOOM to get an even fuller sound.At first I was really happy. It sounded great had good connectivity, and even had a mic so I could use it as a speakerphone (which I would rarely do). I enjoyed that it was IP7X water and dust proof as this is a huge feature for something you are going to use at the beach or pool - or just need adult beverages.But then one night while using it the connectivity issues began. It would just disconnect whoever was using it. They could immediately reconnect, so I didn't think much of it. But then it happened to again and again. Not non-stop, but pretty consistently. At this point I decided it was time to contact UE/Logitech customer support as it was barely 2 months old.Having spent a career in IT I was well suited to do troubleshooting, so I made sure to go through what they would want me to do. Unpair and repair my iPhone, make sure the firmware was up to date, etc. I even included all of this information in the case I submitted. Two days later I received a reply from them asking me to do the things that I had already told them I had done. But they also left instruction to do a full reset on the speaker. I performed this as well. No changes - in fact some other features stopped working. Each time I updated the case it would take at least two days to reply, which I found aggravating.Finally I was issued an RMA, but of course their system requires that I send in the defective unit before they will send me out a replacement unit - which will likely take about 3-4 weeks before I have a replacement. And to make it even better I am going on a trip - one of the reasons I bought this speaker was to take it with me on this trip - but now I won't have it. I made a plea for them to send me one, and I would then return this one, as it is passable for the most part. But all I received in reply was a notice that the RMA would expire in 10 days. So I guess I'll be going on my trip sans speaker. This will make me consider other choices than UE or Logitech moving forward. Which is sad, as they had been my go to brand for PC accessories and the BOOM series sounds great.**** UPDATE 10/3/2016 ****So I went through the RMA process, got a new unit. Yay. The connectivity issues are solved, for the most part. The Bluetooth Smart functions, being able to remotely power on and off, do not function. But I have no interest in going through the sub-standard customer service again. Just going to live with some functions not working. Oh well. For what it's worth, I'd probably buy one again despite any of my negative comments.*** UPDATE 2/7/2017 ****This evening I discovered that the unit was not charging. I figured this time I would call rather than rely on a support email that took at least a day for a response. After about 15 minutes on hold I got to a representative. He guided me through a factory reset, which I know how to do, but was nervous about since I have heard this can damage your unit. But after it was said and done, it was charging again. I thought while I had him on the phone I would ask about the problems I had with the remotely powering the app on via the app. I will try and recreate the dialogue as best I can.Me: I cannot remotely power on or off the device?UE: Okay.Me: This doesn't make me happy, is there something we can do about this?UE: You can try to have another device to see if it will power on the speaker.Me: Let's just say that doesn't work, what is my next step?UE: It's an app issue, I can't help you.Me: But it's supposed to work, right?UE: Yeah.Me: Okay, Thanks for your help.*** Update 7/11/2017 ***The speaker hasn't worked right in a very long time. It now takes about 36 hours to charge. The battery is slow and burns out quick. I guess I am stuck at this point. Guess I'll be buying a replacement before too long. Probably not going to be a UE.

title: Not good for severely handicapped
body: This item has good sound as reported.  I thought it would be good for me, I am severely handicapped  and I  have use of two fingers. I plug the speaker with an audio cord into my Echo Dot which is  mounted  on my  powered wheelchair. It has an on off button  that I did not know about.  Someone has to turn the speaker on for me. I  don’t mind that so much but when I stop the audio for a time the speaker automatically turns itself off. I am not capable of pushing the button to turn it back on so I have to get someone to do it for me. Since most people do not have my problem this will be a very good speaker for most folks.

author: Mr. Martinez
title: This thing is awesome. This is the first tech toy I've bought ...
body: This thing is awesome.  This is the first tech toy I've bought in years (not counting phones). It has been an absolute delight and I find myself not using my stereo anymore.  When you first open the packaging you get excited because the plastic case this thing comes in is HUGE!, but your speaker won't be as big as it seems.  The sound can fill a room well though.  I take mine with me often when I teach Sunday school and use it for ambient sound during lectures and activities.  I also use it to play music during youth group days in the gym and it actually fills the gymnasium with good sound.  The bass is present bu its not booming. Basically, you never feel the powerful thumping in songs, but if you like your music for more than bass, you don't realy miss it, or even notice its not boomier.*** A side note - When I first got it I noticed there seems to be this glitch that happens from time to time where the sound will drop noticeably. An example might be while you're switching apps on your phone, or when you get a phone call during music and when it returns to the music it will be really low. I thought mine was broken but I found a simple solution was to hold the volume button on the actual speaker for a second and that would seem to fix it.  Also, sometimes just pausing and playing the song works.  I don't hesitate to return things when I don't like them, but for the UE Megaboom, I'm actually saving up to get another one so I can play them simultaneously.+ I like to use it on a small 10" tripod, but the floor works great too and corners boost bass for small rooms.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Buy it, you won't be disappointed!
body: Wireless range is awesome. I live in a 3000 sq foot 2 story house and this thing still picks up while my Bluetooth device is on the opposite floor and a few rooms away. Battery life is also good I've had it between 70-90% volume since this past Sunday playing about 4-5 hours a day it is now Thursday and still have about half the battery no joke. Sounds good, reviews about it knocking stuff off walls or vibrating are false I can tell you that. But for what it is I'm not complaining it sounds really good.

body: I bought a second megaboom to pair with the first.  unfortunately the advertised "party up" function does not work.  when I first contacted logitech I was told they were having problems with the app and it would be resolved.  that was a month ago and still the updates have not fixed the problem.  I cannot manually pair the speakers or pair them through the app. my s7 is connected to both speakers but the app won't play both simultaneously. I got it working for all of 30 seconds once but could not get it to work again.  this has been nothing short of an exercise in futility and IMO logitech has no business advertising this function if it doesn't work reliably.  I would also add that jamming alexa down our throats is pretty lame. will be returning.

author: Watch Guy
title: A Great Speaker and Worth the Money
body: How much money have we all spent on speakers over the years? Too much, I know. If you are one of the lucky few who has not gone through half a dozen, jump straight to this one. This speaker offers the sound performance of the original, $400 Bose Sound Dock in a much more user friendly package. The sound really does come out from all sides and not just one. That blew me away. The bass is deep. Volume should be sufficient to annoy the neighbors if you go there. The app allows fine tuning, software updates and on/off and volume control. Of course, a phone's volume controls also control volume along with the two big buttons on the speaker. Being able to set my own graphic equalizer pattern is seriously cool. This sounds like a much more expensive speaker in my estimation and really kicks SoundLink and Jambox to the curb.
