author: MIke
title: Don't waste your time and money.
body: I received my speaker with zero documentation. I had to go online to figure out what to do next. The only slip of paper was a foldout with safety info. The typical "Don't use in the shower..." type of info.  I called tech support and after attempting a number of times to get it to charge or connect, we both gave up. They said that they would send me another one and I might get it in 3-4 days. It might be longer. I bought this on Amazon and got it in 2 days. Didn't want to wait a few weeks to get a replacement. I ended up calling Amazon and they are processing a refund. I just have to drop the packages off at UPS.Frankly... If I knew this product came from Logitech, I would have never tried to buy one. I gave up on Logitech computer products a decade ago. Never again.A friend has one so I thought it might be a good idea. Shame on me for not researching the product better. Going back to Bose or another quality product.Amazon is great. UE/Logitech, not so much.Live and learn

author: Rahul
title: Pathetic support for Megaboom by Logitech
body: I bought UE MEgaboom from US in Jan 2016 and became a big fan of its sound quality, battery life and the awesome featured controllable by the app. I kind of became the evangelist for UE Megaboom and influenced many of my friends to buy the awesome speakers.I have moved to India and one fine day a couple of weeks back the speakers battery stopped getting charged, I cannot put on the speakers on battery. But on charging the speakers were switching on and playing a very distorted sound with a lot of disturbance at high bass. I tried to contact Logitech support in India but they said they cannot give any support to devices bought in US. I also notified the US support and told them about the whole issue but they said they cannot do anything as my speakers are bought second hand from Amazon.I agree that I have bought the speakers from Outlet Digital (https://www.amazon.com/sp?_encoding=UTF8&asin=&isAmazonFulfilled=&isCBA=&marketplaceID=ATVPDKIKX0DER&orderID=&seller=A3IJCHMGVXATT2&tab=&vasStoreID=)  at Amazon.in and they were described like new. But the speakers come with a 2 year hardware warranty(The speakers were launched in Jan 2015) so they cannot be past their warranty time. Also at Logitech UE website they themselves sell used speakers. I am really frustrated and dejected by their indifferent behavior towards their flagship product. I still hope if they can help me with the repair of the speakers as no one is providing any support.You can check the video attached to understand the problem I am facing.

author: Suraj Shetty
title: Major Fail Logitech
body: The packaging is pretty cool, but a bit clunky but makes sense from a protection/ shipping perspective. Does NOT come with a usb cord, so have one of those kicking around. Seems odd since it DOES come with a wall adapter, but no cord :|Was already partially charged, but I still plugged it into the wall since I did not plan on using it for a while. The controls are minimal and it didn't take long to figure out where to plug it in. Upon plugging it in, a nice bright white led started pulsing to give me simple positive feedback that it was in fact already fully charged.One nice big button on the side to actually turn it on. Did that and then saw the bluetooth indicator also immediately begin to pulse, so I then flipped on the blue tooth on my phone and within 30 seconds it was paired with a nice clear drum beat sound. The first song I played came through with gorgeous clarity and full, deep tones. It far exceeded my expectations from such a small speaker.UPDATE: 205-09-08After updating the firmware, the unit no longer can be charged. They published a work around but it was too late and the unit now has zero charge, cannot be turned on and cannot be charged and is thus a $300 paper weight. No fix to date and we leave on vacation very soon. I ended up ordering a Bose Speaker, same price, but a company that will stand behind it, lesson learned.

author: Leonardo Mercenari
title: Extremely disappointed, I would recommend the beats or bose over ...
body: (UPDATE): I had a malfunctioned speakers, sent it back after this and got a brand new one. Product is NOT waterproof, only water-resistant. I submerged 3 inches of my speakers underwater and they stopped working. The title of this product is extremely deceiving and would never buy again from a company who likes to lie and cheat to their costumers. Extremely disappointed, I would recommend the beats or bose over these any day.

author: D Collins
title: BEST $$ SPENT
body: Wow! What a surprise when I received the UEMegaBoom speaker... Great quality, great sound with just the bass I was wanting. Easy setup via Bluetooth. I have iPhone 5s and they synced fast. The app offered from Apple has received bad reviews so as of now I haven't downloaded it. But you can download app from computer with windows7 and that's what I'm going to do to get the updates from UE. The sound from this small speaker fills a large great room,kitchen, and master bedroom....and sound quality is better to my ears hi,medium, to low,and lots of bass without distortion compared to the Bose Soundlink Mini. I purchased both to compare bass. Mega boom blows the Bose away! Sound is loud! And you don't need to fiddle with the EQ. The MegaBoom comes factory set and to me it's perfect and needs no tweaking. I listen to Madonna for workouts and Frank Sinatra and Tony Bennett as well as Rod Stewart for easy listening. Clarity of the words in songs are crisp and clear. I will not be using outside even though it's waterproof. But will use on screened porch but using low volume because of neighbors. Love the casing and ease of turning speakers volume up or down. Can use iPhone to do this remotely. Also, the carry case is neat too because it has a nice handle. The Bose sound link mini did not come with one. For the price of it that's not good. I highly recommend the UE MegaBoom to all ages. Enjoy it!

author: sebastian
title: Dont buy
body: Litterally didn't work. Would not charge. Had to return.

author: Eclipse01
title: Horrible speaker with a horrible design and poor customer service!
body: First the good, when this speaker “works” the sound is great! now onto the problems i had with this speaker.First and foremost, the design of this speaker is really dumb, according to all the pictures and based on the overall sound quality being better this way, the speaker appears to be meant to stand vertical. The problem with this is you cannot charge and stand it vertical at the same time as the charging port (and aux port) are on the bottom of the speaker. I ended up getting around this by using an Oculus rift stand to prop it up higher (you can actually use any “tripod like” stand as it has the standard input port for using those. After the updates i was off to use this for the only thing i wanted to use this for, a speaker for my echo dot.For 2 days it worked and sounded great (hence the 2 stars and not 1) then the speaker would just cut out every other second while doing anything. Only way i could fix this was to disconnect bluetooth and reconnect which bought me another few days.By the way, side note...before this speaker I had a Bose soundlink hooked up to my echo dot for almost a year with no issues (its not the echo Dot)Anyway I eventually brought the speaker back after many different troubleshooting ideas i tried. Long story short the 2nd one did the exact same thing.Customer service was clueless of the issue and every response took about 2-3 days, I gave up and returned it for a whole different product all together. Pass on this one if you plan on using it with an Echo Dot, because clearly it wasn’t meant for that.

author: nkent1981
title: Heed the negative reviews
body: I purchased this speaker on 7/10/18.  I received in 4 days later and straight out of the box, it would not charge.  So I googled a fix to do a manufacturer reset and it worked ok for a few days.  Then the app (which you must download to pair) wanted to update the speaker.  And that was all she wrote.  It would no longer pair or charge, no matter how many resets I did.  This happened just one day after Best Buy's 15 day return policy.  Of course, right?  So I called ultimate ears and they did all of the stuff I already did and pronounced it defective and that they would send me a new one.  That was on 8/3.  Today is 8/16 and I have gotten nothing but the runaround from them . At first UE said they would send me a replacement and then I could send my old one back.  A week goes by and I hadn't received anything from them so I emailed them back and they said that something had changed and I must first mail the speaker back and then they would issue a replacement and in 48 hours I would receive a return label. That was a week ago and I have yet to receive a label.  I have emailed twice and heard nothing back.  This speaker is awesome when it works but once it doesn't, you're pretty much on your own.  I only got to use this speaker for one week before it went south.  So I spent $200 on something that doesn't work and the company won't remedy.  I knew I should have gone with BOSE.  You should too.Update: I just got off the phone with UE AGAIN, and they said that my case was pending and they would try to issue the return label.  So we will see what happens.  Don't buy anything from UE.  Read the negative reviews on here and Best Buy and know that the same will happen to you.

author: Chris Fortunato
title: NOT WATERPROOF!!!! Ruined two and returned them. GET THIS FIXED Logitech/UE!!!!
body: Supposedly these things are rated for IP7X (3 feet for 30 minutes) waterproof capabilities. When I got my first one (purchased at Bestbuy) I brought it into my pool and submerged it just below the surface for about 10 seconds. The speaker powered off, red light turned on, and never recovered. and yes i made sure the seals were set properly before trying this. I thought, maybe this is a lemon and another one will perform better. Returned it to best buy for a replacement after contacting UE (discussed later). About a week after having my 2nd Megaboom and it getting a bit dusty/dirty from a trip camping, I filled my bathroom sink to quickly rinse it off (not even running water, just a sink full). Different speaker, same result, a $250 brick now. Speaker powers on for about 5 seconds, then shuts itself off.The response from UE customer service below after first issue.:"We do apologize for the inconvenience but the device can be submerged into water not just too often. Also, for protection purposes, the rubber plug and D-ring is always advised to be plugged in to the speaker whenever it will be submerged to water. "Don't waste your time with this if you expect it to be protected from water.

author: Roland
title: Don't. Just don't.
body: Don't. Just don't.I bought two of these and they were great. At the time, $299 apiece, they seemed pricey but was overall pleased with them.Then, the update.Since then, they are essentially worthless. They sit turned off because they WILL NOT stay doubled-up.I've tried all the forum solutions, resetting to factory settings, pairing without the app, everything.They work well enough as a stand alone speaker but I didn't buy two so that I could have a backup, I bought two for stereo.I can't express how disappointed I am at Logitech's inability to address what is obviously a universal issue.Perhaps they'll prioritize if enough customers voice disgust.Buyer beware, until they fix the pairing issue, there are plenty of better, less expensive, options out there.

author: T. Shin
title: D.O.A (Dead On Arrival)
body: Man, UE's quality has gone downhill fast. I bought a brand new Megaboom and the first thing I noticed when I opened the package is that the front rubber strip had smudges all over it (like someone with greasy hands had packed it). If you spend $200+ on a speaker, it shouldn't look like it was already used straight out of the box.Then I tried playing it but the battery critical light immediately came on. Then it died. So I left it charge for about 5 hours (the charging light showed it was charging).I unplugged it and pressed play on my phone. It started playing fine, but then SECONDS later, the battery critical light came back on. I packed it back into it's box and returned it.Such a shame. It looked great, sounded good, but quality control is obviously a major issue as many people seem to be having similar problems. I bought a JBL Charge 3 and while it doesn't seem to be as loud as the Megaboom, its sound quality is noticeably better. Oh yeah, it's still works (unlike the Megaboom).Really disappointed in you UE.

author: Nicholas A. Gomogda
title: Speaker blows out after limited/mild use
body: i’m on my second one of these after the first was returned via amazon because the speaker blew out after 4 months (just after the factory warranty expired). I’ve had the second one for about 3 months and the same thing happened. Bass is blown out. I don’t play music loud on this thing, but any song with any bass and it sounds like blown out cheap speakers. Definitely not worth the money. It does sound great initially, however, I think the speaker itself is cheap Chinese made quality with awful durability. Look elsewhere.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Two Stars
body: The was no usb cable in my product

author: Mark Carrillo
title: whats wrong with you people, the speaker does not ...
body: whats wrong with you people, the speaker does not charge and also it does not have the cable for the charging the equipment, I am really upset  with you people, because its the second attempt to get this product and you have failed miserably

author: Didier
title: Great Investment
body: I am really clumsy/rough on my belongings so I buy my investment items for durability. This guy can match me blow for blow. I have dropped it from the hood of my car more times onto concrete than I care to admit (when cleaning/vacuuming)... ok like 5 times... and it didn't even flinch. In fact, it is barely scuffed. It feels weighty in the hand (in a good way, not unreasonably heavy) and solid. It's also easy to toss, just saying.I have the plum color and I find it very fun. It's a little smaller than the diameter of a standard 32 oz Nalgene, but taller, so I like to stick my speaker in one water bottle pocket of my trusty Patagonia (Refugio 28L... Googled in case someone else has the same), Nalgene in the other pocket anytime I'm going on a trip. On that note, my one complaint is that it likes to slip out of my water bottle pocket when I bend down to pick up something (refer back to the beginning of this review to get an idea of how frequently this occurs)... but that is clearly a personal problem. My only other problem is that it's sort of a pain to pair to a different device (or I have found that to be the case). I have had to turn off Bluetooth on my phone to connect to a Kindle Fire.Regarding sound, yeah, this thing packs a wallop. I like my music quite loud and I only turn it up to max when I won't be in the same room or immediate vicinity of the speaker (e.g., cleaning in the next room) or occasionally when listening to a podcast with inconsistent noise levels. I bring it around the house with me when doing house work, weeding flowerbeds, etc., and it's great to not have to worry with earbuds.

author: Lora
title: Love my MegaBoom
body: I bought this from a Sprint store when it first came out two years ago - i've used it almost daily since then.  I love this thing.  It travels with me a lot.  My only complaint after two years is that the charge port is a little fiddly now and i have to jiggle the cord to keep it charging.  Not a big problem yet since it holds a charge for soooooo very long.  I get longer battery life that is listed when I keep the volume at about 50% (which since I live in an apartment is my typical volume level).  I can go for a day or two before I need to charge it.  Keep in mind I use this all day every day.  i even listen to music while I sleep.  I rarely watch TV because I prefer to listen to music.  I originally purchased the MegaBoom over the Boom due to the volume of this thing.  It has great sound either all the way up outside or down low for sleeping or use in hotel rooms.  However, I have found that it doesn't sound as good at top volume as it does at low volume.  I think I may have messed up the speakers when I kept the volume too high for too long but I should be able to do that correct?  Anyway, that doesn't detract from my 5 star rating because this thing does everything I want it to and it sounds great to me.  However, for a pool party with lots of people I have a different party speaker that sounds better at the highest volume for long periods of time.  The lowest volumes have great sound quality and I have absolutely nothing negative to say about that.  I'm thinking about buying another MegaBoom because I bought a Boom due to the smaller size and wanted to use it in hotel rooms but I don't care for the sound quality nearly as much so therefore I rarely use it.

author: Russell Teller
title: Good, but not great (for the money)
body: I have been researching to purchase a decent outdoor Bluetooth speaker for almost 2 years (as they are an investment at this cost).  I'm happy with the UE Megaboom, but am left wondering if it's the best option for the $ I spent on it.I had also considered the Fugoo XL and the JBL Extreme.I landed on the UE Megaboom as an "impulse" buy when a work function was without music.Listening to the JBL Xtreme in store, it seemed to have a much better sound on the low end (bass response).  Part of the reason I did not go with the Fugoo XL was not being able to listen to it in store, but the Fugoo had been my top choice.The only reason I chose the Megaboom over the JBL Extreme was the fact that I have kids, and the exposed woofers of the JBL concerned me while the Megaboom is fully enclosed.Pros:Fully enclosedSounds very good within 15' of speaker (without low bass)Great battery life!Carries just like a thermosEasy to sync withCons:Expensive*I'd love to review how this sounds with 2x paired together, but at this price that's simply not feasible for mostPoor low bass response (sounds like a $20 speaker at 80%+ volume with very low bass notes)* I find myself reducing bass on equalizer to compensate for this, which is what I was hoping to avoid with such an investmentNo charging port for phone, making your phones battery the constraint for your music

author: G Money
title: Best Outdoor Bluetooth Speaker, Not the Best Sounding Indoor
body: Let me first start off by saying that I purchased my Megaboom on Govx.com. I've now owned this speaker for 24 hours and this is what I have to say: If you are looking for a portable speaker that sounds great inside your home and sounds even better outside, then this is your speaker. It is loud, and really excels outdoors. There is no distortion when played at full volume. If you are looking for the best sounding speaker to use inside your home only, then there are better sounding Bluetooth speakers such as: 1. Bose Mini  2. Bang and Olfusen Beolit 15,  3. Bose SoundTouch 30,  4. Beats Pill XL,  5. Bose Soundlink 3. They all sound better at lower volumes (punchier bass and better room filling sound) than the UE Megaboom. The Megaboom sounds best when placed in the corner of a room and on the floor due to the 360 degree sound output. Bottom line: The UE Megaboom is the best portable speaker and best sounding at loud volumes when placed outdoors. It is not the best sounding indoor speaker. If you have deep pockets, the best sounding indoor bluetooth speaker is the Bang and Olufsen A9 at $2699, followed by the Bose SoundTouch 30 at $499, but neither are portable.

author: Richard C.
title: Best OUTDOOR speaker there is!
body: First off, I love Bose. I have many Bose items, but Bose Speakers are not made to be outdoors. They do not have 360° sound, they are not water proof and they are not shock proof. So many times I would put my SoundLink on my patio table and it would appear dusty at the bottom, even though my table is pretty clear. I would also CONSTANTLY have to move it for better placement.  Bose Soundlink's are made for indoors where they are 2nd to NONE! They sound phenomenal....But for outdoor use, I AM OBSESSED WITH MY MEGABOOM!!  I set in on the ground near the leg of my gazebo and forget all about it. I don't have to worry about my 2 dogs running into it and breaking it since it is VERY durable. I don't have to worry about re-positioning it depending on where I am at in the yard due to it's 360° design. The bluetooth signal strength is A LOT better than my Bose, so I don't have to worry about walking too far off and the speaker going out until I come back. I don't have to worry about sudden rainfall ruining it since it is COMPLETELY water proof.  It also sounds very good (not as good as Bose) and gets even louder than my Bose. I don't have to worry about battery life (much better than the Bose).If you want an indoor, stationary speaker that sounds amazing, get the Bose. If you want something made for the outdoors, get the Megaboom!

author: Michael Todd
title: Really great portable speaker
body: Sound quality is really good especially for something of this size, though I couldn't notice a big difference between this and the UE Boom 2 (that's the only reason I gave it 4 stars). Battery life is amazing -- I've been listening to it all day in my office at about 30% volume and it's at 95% charge. The waterproof claim is true too -- check out my dunk test video.The software is no-frills and pretty basic, but it doesn't really need to do much.Setup was a breeze, and testing with it on one side of my house and my iPhone 6S Plus on the other (with several walls in the way), there was only a little jittering. That was about 40 feet with lots of stuff in the way. I'd say if you're outdoors, with a fairly clear line of site, you could probably go about 70' or more without an issue.The model I got is refurbished, but so far it seems to work well.

author: MARKY-MARK
title: Durable.. Loud.. Long-Lasting Battery..
body: This wireless Bluetooth speaker can stand up to the elements, will bump your music to the highest possible level and have you partying it out for hours on end.The UE™ Megaboom is exactly what the doctor order for my situation. I needed a loud speaker that could stand up to the elements and have a long battery life. This device delivers on the goods and in a nice rubber and cloth design.My Bose™ SoundLink mini and Soundfreaq™ Sound Spot could not stand next to the mega loud sound and bass performance of the UE™ Megaboom. The Megaboom left the other two speakers in the dust when it came to sound quality and bass response.The device can be paired up with their the Megaboom app for even more popular features like EQ, Settings, Bluetooth Smart and plenty more. I love the Bluetooth Smart featue that allows you to remotely power on the device.Nothing else can be said about this unit that hasn't already been said. It's a little pricey, however, like the old adage states: "You get what you pay for." Demo the device out at your local electronic store and see how it truly makes your music MEGA BOOM! CHECK IT OUT!

author: E. Gershuny
title: and I'm happy I did
body: I sold my Bose Soundlink Mini to get this, and I'm happy I did. The UE Megaboom (really any of the UE line) has above average sound but it didn't blow me away.  The Bose sounded better.  So did the JBL line.  I find the highs to be a bit muffled, but not bad.  The mids are ok but also not super crisp.  The bass is definitely present but there's not a whole lot of "mega boom".  So why did I trade in a better sounding speaker for this?  I had a party and the Bose Soundlink Mini wasn't loud enough. Plus I was very cautious about taking it outside.  The UE Megaboom is loud, it's waterproof and shockproof, and it doesn't sound bad.  When I first got it, I took it to a BBQ in the rain without worry of it being damaged. I realized I wasn't buying a small bluetooth speaker to sound awesome. I was buying it for social gatherings and the occasional listening at home.  Some of the JBL speakers are also waterproof and decently loud.  But the problem with them is the"passive radiators" are on either side of the unit and exposed. I didn't feel like it was as durable as the Megaboom - potentially easier to damage. Overall I'm quite happy with the Megaboom.  Evaluate WHY you want a portable bluetooth speaker first, then get something that satisfies your needs. If you want something loud and waterproof with a really long battery life, this is it.  If you need something that sounds awesome, look elsewhere, like the Bose or Infinity.  If you are looking for a happy medium, check out the JBL speakers.

author: Amazon Customer
title: even better than the regular Boom
body: even better than the regular Boom! I purchased the boom awhile back and loved it instantly. the only problem was the bass, which was very light. this resulted in a somewhat thin sounding sound signature. enter the megaboom! it's larger drivers and bass radiator give the megaboom a much more full bodied sound, with deeper bass. mids and highs are great as well, just like the boom, but now there's some decent bottom end to fill out the sound.I'm extremely happy with the megaboom. it's built like a tank, isn't as big as some have made it out to be, though it is bigger than the regular boom. it's loud, doesn't distort until the very upper ranged of it's volume limits, which is quite loud, and sounds great. the app to control the boom is really useful too. it's not a thoughtless add on to list on the stat sheet. there's some real functionality with the app. you can link multiple booms, change the EQ, get help and support functions, and update the firmware, which is critical for keeping up with added functionality and bug fixes UE puts out.did I mention this thing is a tank? dropped it? no problem! did that drop happen to be in water? no problem. it's shock and water resistant so a quick dunk wont hurt it at all. I dunked mine in the pool to test it (knowing amazon's great return policy of course!), and guess what, if floats! all while still playing my tunes. word of warning, sound quality is greatly diminished when submerged! duh!so if you're in the market for a premium Bluetooth speaker that sounds great, can be used outside in moisture, and can take a tumble, the megaboom is a great choice. it can even act as a self defense weapon in a jam! boom!

author: J. Kinzel
title: Warranty problem
body: Had them for about 3 years and they worked great. Sound quality was very good.They stopped charging so I began the process of trying to get them fixed.It has been frustrating to say the least.Buy them and be happy. If they break or in my case, stop charging, best of luck dealing with their customer service.

author: Tripoli
title: I absolutely love it, use it constantly, everywhere, anywhere...
body: After a friend recommended the UE Boom, I started doing some research.  I wanted water-proof (which this is) or at least water resistant.  I wanted to be able to hear some bass (doesn't come though in the Boom very well).  I wanted durability, remote control, long battery life, and it needed to be loud enough to fill my back yard (75'x85') with decent sound, without needing a whole sound system.I'll admit, I bought this at Best Buy for the same price as Amazon.  (Why wait two days when you can have it in 20 minutes?).  While there, I got to compare it side-by-side to three or four similar products.  The UE Megaboom was, without any question or debate, by far the best of anything they had to offer.The first day, I set it next to my pool, where it got splash on, rained on, handled with wet hands, all while my iPhone streamed Pandora from the safety of our house, 20 feet away.  It ran for 4 hours at fairly high volume, and at the end still had an amazing 70% battery life remaining.It will pair to two Bluetooth devices, so both my wife and I have our iPhones paired to it, and it works beautifully.  We use the apps on our phones to turn it on remotely, which is a great feature, making it easily for the speaker to know which device to pair to.  Volume is controlled by either the phone or the buttons on the speaker.The only things I find myself wishing for are a track forward button and an output for charging my phone.  Other than that, this is PERFECT product.  It goes to the pool, to the beach, and hangs out in the shower, or wherever else you go.The Megaboom is still small enough it will fit into larger-sized cup holders, while the Boom is about the size of a soda can.

author: Kerem Ozkan
title: New latency issue makes speaker useless
body: I'd written a glowing review about this product, and I really regret having to change it. But I'd invite anyone considering purchasing a UE product to first check their forums (under their umbrella company, Logitech), where dozens of users are absolutely exasperated about their products not functioning properly.Long story short, UE rolled out a new firmware update in October 2016. Previous updates had introduced cool features, and they were very convenient to install through my phone. So I was excited to download and see what they had in store for us this time. Unfortunately, this update introduced a latency issue, such that there was now a little delay before audio is actually played.This is fine for music, but it makes movie-watching unbearable. Like it's not even close to OK. It's just very out of sync and very distracting. I previously used this speaker for Skyping, transcribing audio, doing basic audio editing. None of that is really possibly with the delay we now have.Moreover, users' frustrations have been dominating their forums for weeks, and their support team has hardly even acknowledged the issue. I'd suggest savvy customers stick with a company that doesn't manage to remotely break their products.

author: seanMJP
title: audiophille reveiw: i like it a lot
body: I have 3 of these now and plan to get a fouthoverall they are great speakers. they have a very solid feel in your hand and have equal sound quality. one of mine fell off my atv, rolled in the dirt and i had to go find it down the hill in the tall grass. besides a small dent and sone scrathes there is no differnce, it still sounds great and works the same way.Pros:great mids and highs +1 stargreat bass +1 starthe app is very functional + 1 starVERY durable +1 startotally waterproof and it floatscons:small distortion at high volumes -1 starBluetooth doesn't continue when it goes under waterbottom line its a great speaker for camping, outdoors, roadtrips and more! it has great sound considering the size and multiple of them is betterwould i recommend them, Yes and I have, some of my friends and co workers have one which just adds to the fun

author: Chris
title: Best bluetooth speaker I have ever owned, amazing value.
body: I have now owned and religiously used the UE Megaboom for nearly 2 months now. I have previously owned the Bose Soundlink, Soundlink mini, and a few other Bluetooth speakers and can easily say the UE Megaboom is by far my favorite!Pros:Superior sound quality, not only is the range fantastic, Logitech did a great job with speaker placement to ensure the speaker evenly distributes the sound in all directions. I notice little to no distortion when playing at maximum volume either.Battery life, my god they really outdid themselves here. The battery life in this speaker is FANTASTIC. I believe Logitech rates its lifespan on a single charge at 20 hours. I don't doubt that estimation for a second, I have not sat and let the speaker run for 20 hours however, in fact I have yet to even run the battery below 50%. I have gone nearly 3 weeks without plugging the speaker in and the battery was still over half charged. And during that 3 weeks I used the speaker nearly everyday during showers, at the gym, outside party's, at the hot tub and so forth. The only thing I really wish Logitech would have done was allow you to charge devices from the speakers battery, with a battery life as good as this speaker has I doubt I will ever run it completely dead. I would love to be able to plug in my phone however and get an extra charge out of it while at the park or pool while listening to music, I can assure you my phone's battery will die before the speakers does. The speaker charges exceptionally fast as well which is great!Waterproof: This is one of those specs that I am going to just believe is true and not go out and test it. The speaker carries an IP7 waterproof rating with it which is defined as, "Ingress of water in harmful quantity shall not be possible when the enclosure is immersed in water under defined conditions of pressure and time (up to 1 m of submersion, 30 minutes)" So in theory if you completely fumble this thing and it ends up at the bottom of the shallow end of the pool you don't have to panic. More likely than not though this won't happen to the majority of us. What the IP7 rating means to most of us is that if we are outside using the speaker and it starts to rain you have no need to fear. Also if you use the speaker in areas of high humidity such as your bathroom while showering you don't need to sweat. It may not be something that is needed, but it is definitely nice to have none the less.Updatable firmware: This is something I think a lot of people will take for granted when it should be extremely appreciated. Logitech has set up the speaker to be able to update its firmware via Bluetooth from your device using their app. What this means is that you can expect continuously improved performance and possibly great new features from your speaker in the future as Logitech pushes out updates for the speaker. Which leads me to my next pro.UE Boom App: The app available for you to download on your iOS or Android device is great and easy to use. It allows you to change the equalizer set up using either presets or completely customize it yourself. You can power on and off the speaker which is great, it means you don't have to get up and push the power button if the speaker isn't next to you (this does require you to enable "Bluetooth smart" on the speaker which states it has a small impact on battery life between charges, I can assure you that you won't notice any battery life difference). You can update the speaker firmware via Bluetooth from the app, view the battery level of the speaker, and set up an alarm as well. You can also "Double Up"Double Up: Doubling up is an awesome feature as well, if you do happen to have the $600 it would require you to purchase 2 of these things you can set them up to play in stereo format which means you can listen to your music through both speakers at the same time which is awesome if you are outside at a large gathering or just really want to immerse yourself in the music. Now I assume if you have one Megaboom and one regular boom that you can still double up but don't quote me on that because it may not be true, I have not been able to test that theory.Bluetooth range: Good god this is great, the Megaboom has a rated Bluetooth range of 100ft give or take depending on the environment you are in (walls etc..) but I have yet to walk to far from this thing to hear it disconnect! I recently used the Megaboom at a picnic and had the speaker set up where we were playing volleyball and I had the phone in my pocket while playing, no connection issues whatsoever, I ran to the barbeque shortly after to grab some food which was what felt like a mile a way and could still hear my music loud and clear playing all the way across the park. It also means you don't have to leave your phone next to your speaker when you are just walking around your house. When I owned my Bose Soundlink Mini I hated that if I had music playing upstairs and ran downstairs to grab a bite real quick the speaker would disconnect half way down the stairs.Cons:Volume buttons: This is totally a personal thing, I am sure lots of people really like the big + and - buttons on the speaker but personally I would enjoy a cleaner/sharper look to it, some buttons that offered some real feedback would be great. The buttons may look huge on the speaker but it is only a small dot in the center of each that actually depresses and changes the volume.Unable to charge external devices: As I mentioned in my pros list under battery life, this thing has such a great battery life I am sure it has some milliamps to spare to power an external USB to allow me to charge my phone/iPod on the go. My phone will die 2 times over before this speakers battery runs dead.No ability to adjust speaker volume from app: UPDATE: Logitech has since updated the firmware and now you do have the ability to adjust the speaker volume from the app itself!Summary: This speaker is wonderful, personally I believe this speaker to be one of the best values on the market right now. If you are considering it against anything in the same price range, you can't go wrong with the Megaboom. Heck, if you are comparing this to the $200 speakers on the market such as The Pill or the Bose Soundlink I would highly recommend spending the extra money to get the Megaboom. And if you don't want to break that $200 mark, Logitech offers the UE BOOM which is a slightly smaller version of this speaker which I am sure is a great value as well. The only thing to consider if considering the smaller Boom is the volume may not be as loud, the battery life is shorter, it is not waterproof, and the Bluetooth connection range is rated as half as far as the Megaboom. So if you really want any of those features, step up and get the Megaboom, you won't be disappointed.

author: GreenMan
title: Logitech customer care is third rate
body: Logitech customer care is third rate. They have ruined UE by acquiring it.I bought 2 Megaboom and one of them is defective - when playing via AUX cable the sound is glitchy.Unfortunately I am just outside the return period for the device (30 days)I contacted the logitech customer care via their email support. It has been 2 days and no response whatsoever.I contact via phone and the customer care rep is very rude to me and would not proceed unless I had gave him the device software version.When I created the email ticket I put all of this info in the ticket. He refuses to proceed further in diagnosing the issue saying "it is our protocol and we cannot proceed". WHAT protocol? What are you running here? customer service or some sort of nazi army?Will never buy another logitech product for me or recommend to anyone.

author: Ryan Johnson
title: Loud, Proud, and purely AWESOME!
body: The UE MEGABOOM is a fantastic product. It is a pretty decent weight, easy to clean, and has clear instructions via their website. Upon shipment, the speaker is tightly packed with care. Other than the standard amazon box, the speaker comes in a large "capsule-like" tube with a center compartment for the speaker and the plug base, as well as a side pocket for the charging wire. When you turn on the speaker, you immediately hear percussion instruments come to play, informing you that your new product is ready for use. That being said, here are the pros and the cons that I found with this speaker.Pros:The speaker can be "updated" via a smartphone app.It has a HUGE volume capacity for its size.The battery life is AMAZING. (I highly suggest not charging it overnight, it may shorten its life)It is small, compact, and easily portable.It is perfect for indoor and outdoor.When it rains, the weather-resistent cover protects the usb port and the speaker itself.It is easy to pair both wireless and wired devices to it.Cons:It does not come with a convenient portable case. (I highly suggest purchasing a separate case to protect this investment).It does not come with an audio cord. You need to provide your own in order to hook your speaker up to non-bluetooth devices. (They are cheap though).The app is CRAZY fun, but it lacks stable connection to the speaker. I find it to be inconsistent. Sometimes it can locate my speaker, other times it can't.I highly recommend this product. However, I only owned it a week. Hopefully its shelf life is longer than 2 years.

author: Jeff Goeson
title: Really good sound packed into a small package
body: I have this unit. More specifically, this is my second one, because the first one got stolen out of my car... Anyway, I saw the reviews that discuss a lack of bottom end; I beg to differ. Hit it with a soundtrack to a movie that has some space battles or war scenes (or thunderstorms) in it. There is no lack of bottom end. This is one of those rare small portable speakers that fits the bill well. Portable-ish (a little heavy for a mini-speaker), lots of volume when you want it, easy to use. The price is not inexpensive, but it also doesn't sound cheap.I'm an audiophile, so cheap speakers don't normally do it for me. This unit is not a reference speaker by any means, but it's not intended to be. It is supposed to be a good little speaker with decent sound that fills up a small room or patio with reasonable sound quality. It does that.

author: John B.
title: Trouble connecting more than one.
body: After Amazon sending us refurbished units even though we explicitly bought new units we finally got the new ones we ordered.  You do not want a refurbished unit because the waterproof rating changes and they say only two can be paired. We also noticed the refurbished units couldn’t hold their charge nearly as long as the new one could.Be prepared to shoot yourself in the face if you’re trying to connect 2 or more of these.  It’s basically an embarrassing event in front of your friends at the pool every single time.  If you can actually get them all to show up in the app, 1 or more of the speakers will intermittently cut out the entire time. You’ll find yourself googling countless videos telling you how to update and reset to factory or showing you “hacks” to get it to work and they have yet to do the trick.I’m pretty damn annoyed with these speakers to be honest while their clams have them somewhere close to perfection.If you plan on just using one, you’ll have no troubles and you’ll like the quality of the sound.  Unfortunately for us, that’s not what we bought them for.I’m seriously hoping a firmware and app update will address this all.

author: Julie
title: Best portable speaker ever!
body: I've been using this speak in my bathroom for several months, but I bought it primarily for the pool, so I've waited until pool season starts before writing my review. This speaker replaces a solar speaker that took an accidental swim in the ocean last summer. We bring the music to our condo pool in the summer so we wanted a waterproof one this time with really good, loud sound that can be heard all around the pool and this one is the perfect fit! The music was so loud from this little beast that we had to turn it down to hear conversations. The battery lasts a long time and it sounds great! It also pairs flawlessly with our iPhones and stays paired, unlike our previous speaker. I highly recommend this speaker!

author: Marine Man
title: Nice unit, idiot cable colors!
body: First, the positives. It is pretty damm loud.  Louder than my large kitchen wants to hear.  Nice bass response.  Worked the best when I put it in a corner as the bass filled out more.  What I do not like about this is the STUPID COLORED large AC adapter and cord that comes with this.  Why put a NEON long cord and NEON big wall adapter on a slick looking black speaker?  It looks ridicules.  Luckily the cord is a standard micro USB and I had another lying around as well as another 2AMP USB adapter.  Also, if you are going to leave it on the charger like I am in the house the charging port is up top and buttons on the bottom, so if you need to get to a button you have to pick it up, which I don't care for.

author: Josh Anthony Gupta
title: Once it breaks...that’s it. Battery problems took me down.
body: I used this for everything.  I actually own three.  Since they all stopped charging and one fell, it needs new speakers, I called the company to get some repairs. I was informed via a phone call they do not fix broken or defective products.  So never again. I buy Jbl now.  They are pretty flawless.  I actually just found my old booms the other day and it reminded me I never wrote anyone about it.  I was part of a large group of people who really loved this speaker when it was new. One night around a camp fire we actually linked 16 speakers together.  It was great! Unfortunatly once I found out there was no path for repair I moved on to products that don’t break or fail.

author: Taurus
title: They are loud enough and the battery life is good.
body: THESE SPEAKERS ROCK!  Especially when paired two together with a Sony Xperia Z5 Premium.  They are loud enough and the battery life is good. The UE Boom and MegaBoom speaker are the best bluetooth speakers you can buy.  I purchased a pair of the UE Boom first and when the MegaBooms came out I purchased a pair of them.  Now they have a update for both speakers.  After I updated the the speakers I'm able to pair both sets, and BOY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  IT SOUNDS SO DA??? GOOD.  Yes UE speakers are the best,  as far I know there are no other bluetooth speakers that can do this.

author: Jack of all Trades
title: UPDATE AFTER 1 YEAR
body: 1 YEAR UPDATE: The device will not last you.  It is a throwaway piece of trash.  All of its features have an astonishing degree of planned obsolescence built into it, and to top it off the customer service is agonizingly slow, redundant, and tedious.  My speakers blew after 1 year with never exceeding the maximum volume for longer than a few test runs when I first got it, and less than 2 hours a week of use.  I definitely used the speaker in some wet and jostling conditions, but that's what this is advertised as built for!!!  After a deplorable degree of having to repeat myself I was finally shipped a replacement, which stunningly was faulty right out of the box.  There seems to be little to no quality control.  At the very least Logitech honored the warranty, but now I'm stuck in the 2-3 week purgatory of trying to get this faulty device shipped back.When I first got this I asked rhetorically "what's not to love?" The answer: the fact that you will be throwing this away in less than 2 years.

author: Elijah Stephens
title: Fantastic sounding little speakers.
body: This is another product I own that I did not purchase off of Amazon but am reviewing.  I had never even heard of these speakers.  Then one day my wife and I were in T-mobile store picking up the new Galaxy Note 5 for myself and the S6 edge for her.  She was telling me she liked the music that was playing and pointed to this little wireless speaker it was playing from and I was amazed.  Simply because I remember what bluetooth speakers sounded like when they first hit the market and ruled them out a long time ago, because I am the type of person that would rather have no music at all than crappy quality sound.The speaker the music was playing from was the smaller version of this one.  The UE boom 2.  It sounded great and so I asked one of the employees about the speaker.  His answer was "yeah its a bluetooth speaker and its awsome".  Usually it takes more than that to sell me on something but I was sold, because I had been wanted some good wireless speakers to play music on when I am just relaxing at home.  So I decided since the Boom 2 sound great, its bigger brother the Megaboom must sound great in a more powerful package.  So I ended up purchasing 2 of the megaboom speakers because while I was at the counter the guy told me that you could pair them and use them as stereo sound and if I bought one he would give me 10% off the second.  Now these speakers are 299 each so 10% isnt much but its something.I got them home and opened them up and just loved the way they both looked sitting on my sofa table.  Now these things do not require a rocket scientist to get them paired to whatever bluetooth device you are using to play music, but the fact that they do not come with any directions at all was a little crazy to me.  I mean they are 299 each.  The least they can do is give you some direction.  I got one paired to my phone and started playing music and I was so excited because just the one speaker sounded great and couldnt wait to hear them both together in stereo.  Upon trying to hook them both up I got a little frustrated because I couldn't get them both paired.  Again no directions.  After a while I finally went online and found out that you had to download the app to pair them.  That's fine but it would have been nice to have directions saying that.  That way something that took me a half hour to figure out would have only took a couple minutes to get working.  Needless to say I downloaded the app and got them both working in stereo and I love it.  So much that I just bit the bullet and ordered another one to go in my bedroom.  Now they are easily moved from one room to the other, but I don't want to have to move them.I will say that these are not the loudest speakers in the world.  They are definitely loud enough for me to hear from the back room in my house, but I know some reviewers were expecting for them to be rock concert loud which is ridiculous to me.  You are talking about a small wireless speaker that is ran off of a battery which plays continuously for 20 hours by the way.  You just are not going to get a ridiculous amount of power in a battery powered active speaker at this price point in this small of a speaker.  More power equals a bigger speaker because of the larger amp.  Which equals more money and to keep the same quality of sound with the larger amp it would cost even more.  More power also means a larger battery.  Are seeing where I am going here people?  Some people just do not think about those kind of details when they purchase an item.  Then they don't like it and blame it on the item itself.  When if they had put a little more thought into their purchase they would see there is no way at the price point they would get the power they were thinking.  Anyway as I said they gave this speaker as much power as possible, and focused more of their attention on sound quality itself, because power is easy.  Sound quality is what requires the attention.All in all. I love the speakers.  They are great.  They are build very solid.  They sound great and put out enough power to fill my house with beautiful sound.  In fact the only thing I would change about them is.  I wish there was a way to turn them on without have to physically touch them.  That would be nice, but also not a big deal.  I also would have given them a vertical flat face so that they could be laid down without rolling.

author: Zach Gruber
title: Run Over By Jeep And Soaked In Rain
body: About a year after purchasing a roommate backed over my UE Mini Boom 2 with his Jeep Wrangler equipped with offroading tires. The speaker was lying on its side perpendicular to the wheel's direction. Justifiably, my reaction assumed the speaker was  crushed. To my surprise, after the dust settled so to speak, I found the only damage the speaker sustained was a small dent to its shell while it functioned no differently than before.Today, a month or so after the Jeep incident, I pull into the driveway and notice my UE Mini Boom 2 nestled among the rocks of our retaining wall where I'd set it and forgot about it five days ago while cleaning my car. Literally four of these five days it rained almost constantly punctuated by a severe storm two nights ago. Justifiably, my reaction upon realizing all of this was a string of expletives borne of an assumption that the speaker was destroyed.  However, after grabbing the speaker and holding the power button, to my surprise, the speaker immediately turned on and once again functions no differently that it had before.I've never written a review of a product but the performance of the UE Mini Boom 2 in my rigorous unintentional tests unquestionably merit that I sing this speaker's praises.

author: Ryanj
title: Absolute Quality. A+
body: Every once in awhile I feel absolutely compelled to write a review bc my experience with the product has been so good that I feel like I owe to the guys over at Logitech and UE to help them out and write a review. Very positive experience.Pros:- EXCELLENT sound and loudness for the size- LOVE the IPX7 water proof, I take it into the shower daily with me (owned for 2 months now)- Build quality definitely shines through when you pick this thing up. You can tell this thing is rugged and is going to last a very long time. Very sturdy feel.- easy connectivity, and love that you can wake up from the app so you don't have to get up to turn it on.CONS: - I'm REALLY nit picking here, but it'd be nice to have a play/pause, skip too buttons on the device but I understand why they forgave those buttons to please the simplicity and ascetics of the device.

author: Jason
title: The sound of the megaboom is great, and I would prefer it to its little ...
body: The sound of the megaboom is great, and I would prefer it to its little brother. But problems and slow, confusing support are overwhelmingly frustrating.The first unit I received had Bluetooth connectivity issues so I returned it. Once the second unit was received it had the same issues so I contacted UE and they had me do a factory reset, first one did not resolve the problem but the second time appeared to. But only after about five days I lost all sound on the unit. This appeared to happen after the battery was completely drained, and then recharged fully.It has not been over two weeks working with support and I am about to send my megaboom to them. Hard part is a get a response support needs more info, I respond in five minutes, but I get an email back three-four days later asking for something else.Who know what will happen. My guess is I will send my brand new unit to UE and will get a refurbished unit with the same problems and this will keep up till they wear me down.Edit 2/15/17.I got a replacement a replacement for the second one. After about a month of having the third one it one only work with power applied. Contacted ultimate ears and they said that was a known problem with certain firmware and gave me an application to resolve it, which did not work. So the third one is on the way back to them now for another replacement. I think they have a serious problem with this model. The Boom 2 I have works flawless.

author: W.M.
title: So I decided to give the Megaboom a try and couldn't have been happier with my choice
body: I recently bought one of these after searching for a replacement for the Beats Pill XL due to their recall. I first tried out the Bose Soundlink III and returned it in less than 24hrs. It just didn't have the volume or bass I was use to with the Pill XL. So I decided to give the Megaboom a try and couldn't have been happier with my choice. It has plenty of volume and the bass is decent enough that I don't miss my Beats Pill XL. Battery life seems to be pretty good considering I've only charged it once & have been using it on & off for the past week (playing music at 50%-75% volume). The app that you use with the Megaboom has some great features. You're able to turn the Megaboom off & on from the app. You can also adjust the equalizer to however you want it. The app allows you to see battery life & pair up another Megaboom or boom for a stereo sound. & don't forget, this thing is water proof! So no worries having this at the beach or by the pool, just make sure the rubber stoppers are firmly in place prior to exposing it to the outdoor elements. If you're on the fence on what bluetooth speaker to go with, give the Megaboom a shot. IMO, it's the best bluetooth speaker out right now for the price.

author: Otto Mileti
title: Best little speaker money can buy!
body: Great little speaker.  The battery last forever and in my opinion it's the best speaker in this size and price range.  I take it with me everywhere. One more thing.  I just got back from running the Owyhee river in Oregon.  My speaker was in it's case and I thought securely located in my friends dry box on his raft when he broadsided a huge boulder and flipped.  The dry box only works when it's locked but unfortunately it wasn't and everything including my megaboom speaker fell out.  It was in the case logic case and we were able to recover it at the bottom of the rapid.  Later in camp I turned it on and it worked perfectly.  It is truly waterproof.

author: Alain Aguiar
title: The quality of sound is great!
body: The UE megaboom produces great quality of sound. Once the volume is turned all the way up, you can hear the music clearly. The sound it produces has a good amount of bass, but not too much where it takes away from the music. During Thanksgiving, my family gets together and plays football in the morning. We usually use a bigger speaker because we can listen to it down the field, but we couldn't use it this year; Luckily, I had this speaker in my car and once I started playing music it was very similar.This product is said to be shockproof and waterproof. I can agree with the waterproof because I've had water other things like beer spilled on it and it hasn't effected the speaker in any way.The design is my favorite part of the speaker. With the speaker all around the cylinder shape, the music shoots out in all directions so one side isn't sacrificed.  I like modern look and I also like the portability of the speaker as well. With a clip on the top of the speaker, you can't clip it on to anything and not have to worry about it falling. The Megaboom is small enough to not be a burden wherever you take it, but the quality of music is like it would come from a much bigger speaker. The overall technology that UE used to make this speaker is incredible.The coolest feature for the speaker is that you can connect one phone, using the UE app, to multiple speakers which results in a louder and funner party.Overall I loved this product, and I would recommend it to anyone. It produces great music for any type of atmosphere.

author: A007girl
title: We loved the megaboom while it worked
body: We loved the megaboom while it worked, but after a few weeks it completely stopped charging.  We spent countless days on the phone with their customer service trying to get some assistance, and with great difficulty were finally able to mail it in for them to take a look.  They sent us a replacement, which also stopped working a few months later (with the same problem). The second time, customer service was not able to help us, so after 6 months, we basically have a $300 paperweight.  This also happened to our brother's family. :(

author: Amazon Customer
title: My Charger Still Works!!
body: I got a UE Boom about 2.5 years ago and LOVED IT! I accidentally left it on a plane when I was coming home from Boston and I've missed it ever since.I enjoyed the sound quality and the portability. I always received comments in the positive when I was out setting the mood wherever I went.I've seen a few comments on the charger going out and I have to say that even though I lost my Boom I still have my charger two years after I lost my speaker and the charger still works great as I use it to charge other devices.If you have the money to spend, based on my experience and a few nerdy reviews I've read, I highly suggest that you purchase this speaker especially if you find it at a great price!

author: Amazon Customer
title: The sound just wasn’t there – it was pretty loud for it’s size
body: I have a Sonos system for my house (love it) and was in the market for something portable that I could take to the beach, pool, camping, vacations, etc.  After reading reviews online, I decided to buy the regular UE Boom.  The first time I turned it on and played a song, I knew I wasn’t going to keep it.  The sound just wasn’t there – it was pretty loud for it’s size, but it had no bass and wasn’t clear.  So I went to the store and bought a Bose Revolve.  In terms of sound there wasn’t much of a comparison, the Bose Revolve was MUCH better.  I had a few friends over and did a blind test where I would set the Boom and the Revolve next to each other and switch a song between the two.  We tried it with a variety of songs and the Bose won every time.I thought the Bose would be it, but a couple days later I saw the Megaboom on sale for the same price as the revolve.  Enter player three.  The sound comparison between the Megaboom and Revolve was a lot closer, but I would have to give the slight edge to the Revolve.  The bass was a little better and the vocals/instruments were slightly more distinct.  But it was close, I’m sure if I would have done another blind test, people would have picked the Megaboom on some songs.  The Bose was also about half the size of the megaboom (I’m comparing the regular revolve, the Revolve+ would probably blow the Megaboom away).  In the end though, I decided to keep the Megaboom because it beat the Bose in pretty much everything else.  Battery time is 20 hours vs 12, Bluetooth range is 100 ft vs 30, it’s waterproof vs splash resistant, charge time was 2 hours vs 4.  It was a really tough choice, but with price being equal, and my need of something portable that I could toss in a backpack and take to the beach without fear, I chose the more durable Megaboom.  If the Megaboom was regular price or I was looking for something that would be my primary speaker (in other words, I didn’t already have Sonos) I would definitely choose the Revolve or Revolve+.  Hope that helps anyone who may be in the same situation I was.

author: Tim Gardner
title: Works fine as an individual speaker
body: Anyone who rated this more than 1 star probably doesn't have more than one speaker. Works fine as an individual speaker, but good luck trying to use multiple speakers simultaneously. Their software and sync technology stinks once you bring a 2nd speaker into the equation. You'll also spend hours trying to do firmware updates that will always fail. I returned.

author: Allen L Youngpeter
title: Waterproofing tested
body: I held out on buying a bluetooth speaker for about a year, but thought it would be fun to take one on a kayaking trip.  The MEGABOOM was perfect!  In the open air of the river it provided lots of sound. It's best features are the ease of use, metal ring on the bottom for attaching it to a safety line, and that it's waterproof.  We had three hours of music, it survived the squirt gun fight, and even full submersion simply shaking off the water with the next bass hit.  I didn't do any deep or long submersions, but you won't need to worry about taking it to the beach.  It received many complements from friends and even random other kayakers.I was also impressed with the bluetooth range. I set my phone on my truck and walked down the block, I was 4 houses down(over 100 ft) before I got significant signal loss.

author: Henrik Lettuceberg
title: MEGABOOM For President 2018
body: Purchased in December 2016. Have had no serious issues yet. Recently used it at Electric Forest and Bonnaroo. Lasted all weekend and was loud enough us and a few neighbors. I can run it at full volume for 99% of my library. It has also replaced my truck stereo, and find it sufficient even with the windows rolled down.I'd also like to note the durability of the Megaboom. I've dropped this thing like it was hot countless times. It's scuffed all to heck, but still keeps tickin'.Would most definitely recommend. There isn't a better portable speaker at this price point. Maybe any price

author: Nathan
title: Pretty darn good
body: Got it today. First impression is just good. I'm not sure what I expected because you can't make good bass in small space. I own the ue boom and it gets loud, without direct comparison it seems as loud as the mega boom, minus the extra deep end the mega boom has. My suggestion is, don't turn it to full volume and it should offer a satisfying sound for what it is, push it all the way and the experience becomes mediocre, but same goes for most high end systems as well. Lastly, don't forget to play with your speaker, what I mean is, put it against a wall and watch the sound go a bit deeper, tuck it into a corner and listen to the bass improve dramatically.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Awesome speaker w/ crap battery!!!!
body: Great speaker. Super versatile. Waterproof. Awesome sound. But... Weak battery. Does not hold a charge worth a damn. I charge it up fully, play it for an hour or two, then completely turn in off. Then, I turn it on a week or two later and the battery is DEAD!!! Very, very frustrating!! Only way to change battery is through the company. I want to love it but battery is killing me 🙁Maybe I have a bad one?!?!?

author: Android Zulu
title: Falls so so short from the UE Boombox
body: Coming from the UE Boombox the UE Megaboom was such a disappointment. The UE Megaboom is a loud, water resistant speaker, able to fill an entire room with sound. It has high gains but the bass is rather flat and there was a lot of distortion when the volume was raised. I liked the app that allowed for EQ settings. Sadly, if you use the AUX port the volume doesn't get much louder, the volume is actually lower for some weird reason. The tweeters are on the top of the Megaboom and the bass drivers on the bottom. You can't lay it sideways and if you want to use the aux or charge at the same time you have to flip the Megaboom upside down. From a distance the music can be heard but up close it's a poor experience.

author: Lora
title: Good, but not good for the money
body: Sound quality is fine if you're not that picky about sound quality-- but then again, why would you spend $300 on a speaker if sound quality wasn't important?  I had super high expectations for this, coming from the Sony SRSBTX500.  It is not crisp by any means, absolutely no bass, just a hard knocking sound.  the treble is more of a whispy sound than clear as i expected.  I also purchased the ue roll which actually surpasses my expectations for its size.  It is really nice that it is waterproof and as portable as it is; unfortunately, I just can't pay that much money for a speaker and have it sound as inexpensive as it does.

author: Jacquelyn Y.
title: Great product, Gives Bose a run for their $$
body: This is the second one I've purchased. Originally received the UE Boom 2 (waterproof/shockproof) as a gift and love it. Works great, decent battery life, portable, great sound quality, loud/clear, durable design, easy to use. I purchased another UE Boom 2 for my fiancé and we take them wverywhere! I also purchased the MegaBoom for my brother a few months ago- very similar to the UE Boom 2 as far as specs and quality, just a little bigger and louder. Love that you can pair the stereos and play music from multiple areas if you have more than one of these. Great product for an affordable price- highly reccomend.

author: Pri.Ch
title: Returning my Bose Revolve Speakers
body: Although I bought these from the T Mobile store and not Amazon, I feel as if I should share these as they have completely beat my new Bose Revolve bluetooth speakers (360 speakers most comparable to the MegaBoom). As I stepped into the store for something else, I was so blown away by the sound that filled the store from these speakers. As a household that loves Bose products, this product made me question Bose a lot more. This speaker KILLS the Bose speaker and surpasses sound quality with flying colors. I love how you can turn on the speakers remotely and the ease of connecting to it. Its reinvented the love for my music, and even has Equalizer settings you can adjust. Knowing its waterproof and shock proof is great. I highly recommend this product!

author: S. Someone
title: BIG SOUND, long battery life, waterproof. What else is there?!?!
body: Bought this for a LOUD like listen at a beach, and pool LOUD. It does not disappoint!!  Waterproof and LOUD! Nice sound, small and portable with a long battery life. I heard the life quoted by the manufacturer is often the battery life while the speaker is played at half volume. I use mine at full volume and it goes for hours!!Only thing I would change is add the feature for it to automatically power down after a period of inactivity. But get one!! You'll love it!!!!

author: C. Beheler
title: Megaboom took a MegaDump
body: Son I am disappoint. I bought my Megaboom in August 2015, at the end of our pool season, and it has been fantastic  The sound is clear, it has good bass, fills a space, easy sync, etc.  My heart was broken when I turned the speaker on and it began to distort MASSIVELY.  The distortion happens at all volumes (low to high) and absolutely ruins the device.  It is very perplexing as I don't list to bass heavy music nor do I listen to music very loudly.  I loved this speaker and it was perfect for my application but it has literally turned itself into a paper weight.  To the potential buyers out there, this speaker sounds fantastic and lives up to reviews but I have to question the quality/durability as I've only gotten ~10 months of use out of mine.

author: Josh Twitchell
title: Hard to overcome the charging issues
body: The speaker itself is awesome. I loved the feel of it, the sound quality was top notch. It does get quite loud, and I had a lot of previous experience with this speaker before purchasing one for myself. I know it is a great sounding speaker, no denying that; however, the charging issues are hard to overlook. My first speaker I received would not charge at all. The charging light would not come on, yet the cord worked fine when charging other devices. I have since returned and gotten a refund for my purchase. As much as I want to order one of these, there are just too many complaints of the charging abilities just going out and people being S. O. L.I think I’ll move on to something else...what a shame.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Sound quality is not as good as the Beats Pill
body: Get a Beats Pill XL. I use a portable bluetooth speakers everyday for 5-8 hours to run a dance studio. I also have perks of taking a speaker home to go camping and use around the house etc. The design and convenience of the UE Megaboom is intolerable. Charging is a hassle. The battery DOES NOT last 20 hours, it goes about 7 hours maximum. Disconnecting and connecting from different devices is inefficient. Sound quality is not as good as the Beats Pill. You cannot charge your phone from the UE, the Beats Pill XL will charge your device. Since the UE does not sit flat it tips over easily from whatever its staying on. -- The UE speaker is waterproof. Although, if you read the instructions it says not to submerge in water. This speaker is also too much money. I could go on . . .  AWEFUL!

author: Daniel R. Sanderman
title: A fantastic portable bluetooth speaker
body: Put quite simply, this thing is great. I have owned the smaller version of this speaker and been quite happy with it. It was my go-to speaker for listening to music while taking a shower (not with the speaker, obviously), listening to podcasts while cleaning around the house, and playing along with songs while practicing guitar. But this monster will replace it in every way.The range on this device is incredible. I was able to connect via Bluetooth and it maintained a connection even when I went upstairs. I was surprised and heard noise downstairs after taking a call upstairs. It dawned on me that my music had started up again and the connection was still solid.The volume from this device is very loud. It rivals a soundbar we have in our home. The bass is pretty decent, especially when it is sitting on a resonant surface (like a hard countertop). Overall, I do think it is a bit bass heavy in the EQ. I believe they did this in order to emphasize the bass properties in such a small speaker. However, I needed to adjust it using the iOS app in order to comfortably listen to podcasts without the boom. The app is a bit cumbersome to download and use. It gets the job done, though, and I am happy to be able to tweak the EQ settings.All in all, this device is great. The battery life is so long that I don’t have to think about charging it all that often. It’s my new favorite portable speaker.

author: Jessie Galloway
title: it still sounds great! Will forever be a UE customer
body: I purchased this speaker and was quite nervous. However, this speaker - literally - survived the jaws of my daughter's pitbull. Please see attached pictures. Not only did it survive, it still sounds great! Will forever be a UE customer! Any product that can survive the jaws of a pitbull is worth the money!

author: Calvin R. Stiff, Jr.
title: A very excellent Bluetooth speaker!
body: First let me say that I did not purchase my MegaBoom from Amazon I would have but I just didn't. The price I paid for it retail was competitive and I didn't have to wait for shipping. Ok. Now that's out of the way. If you're looking for a really good Bluetooth speaker and still on the fence about which one to buy don't be. Get off of that fence and buy this one. When you buy a speaker this small you have to give up a little of something or in some cases a lot of something. This speaker will not shake the walls. Don't even shop for small Bluetooth speakers if you need that kind of performance. They make Bluetooth speakers that will shake the walls but you're moving up to a much bigger speaker set and about $500 just to join the club. The MegaBoom is well worth the money compared to similarly priced units that don't sound anywhere as good. I did some pretty intensive comparison shopping. I looked at Harmon kardon, Bose, fugoo, monster and a few other brands. I kept coming back to the MegaBoom. So one day I just bought it. I bought it from bestbuy and they only had a demo display that wouldn't allow me to connect to,it to test drive it for real. So I just bought it to play with it since I couldn't do it in the store. It was the only unit that was like that. All the others I could connect to and play my personal library through them. Lucky for Best Buy I enjoyed the performance of it and I didn't return it 30 minutes later. It's small footprint takes up little space and can also be hung on a hook. It fills the room with rich sound and quite a bit of bass. A suprising amount of bass from such a compact package. So buy the MegaBoom with confidence

author: Rafael
title: The battery that never dies
body: Let me say this first. The battery in this thing is impressive. It seems to last forever. I rarely charge it.The sound is great. Many other reviews compare the sound to other similar speakers so I won't go into any detail except to say this is the most expensive BT speaker I've bought and it has the best sound I've heard from a BT speaker. I adjusted the EQ just slightly to my taste.Taking away one star for the price. It is a hefty retail price. True it has some great features, but I feel it could be a bit less expensive.

author: Gia
title: Speaker Blew TWICE
body: When I first got this product I absolutely loved it. I got it back in April and used it for parties at my college house and it was great for that. However one day the speaker completely blew out. I delayed sending it back because life got in the way but come September I finally did. I got a new one sent back to me without 5 days. IT JUST BLEW AGAIN. I don’t even want another one. Don’t buy.

author: phillydet000
title: My favorite features of this speaker are
body: Previous owner of a UE Boom (1st edition) I wanted a little more sound and the added waterproof and impact resistance features.  Sound quality seems to be very similar to the original UE Boom....just a lot louder.  If you can find this speaker for $250 its worth the extra $50 over the regular UE Boom 2.My favorite features of this speaker are: quick connection to Bluetooth, durable build, long battery life and overall Bluetooth range is fantastic....this thing never drops out.I remove a star because after 2 months it stopped holding a charge.  From what I've read this seems to be a common defect (my firmware is up to date too).  I've contacted UE on a solution/fix and will update this review.Hope this helps!

author: Bart
title: Spend the money, this unit is worth it!
body: I purchased a pair of these while I was driving my 40' RV from NH to ND. I didn't want to wear a pair of headphones, and I couldn't hear my phone even using the Mini Jambox I had. One of these is enough to fill most areas with sound, the pair of them is amazing. The sound quality is excellent, and it is good even at high volumes. If you need or want to be able to fill a larger area, or need to overcome background sound. Buy one of these, or as I did, buy the pair!

author: WineCPA
title: The King Of Wireless Speakers In My House!
body: I've been using this speaker at various volumes for a solid month now. The pairing with my Samsung Note 3 and my wife's Galaxy 5 was simple. Immediately upon installing the app, it performed a firmware update for the speaker. There haven't been any since that first one.Given the relatively expensive nature of this speaker, I'd like to get right to the sound. This is the best wireless speaker that I've heard in this price range. I had my friend bring over his Bose Mini wireless speaker for comparison. This speaker fills the room just as well as the Bose Mini, and seems to have better range. The highs are definitely crisper and the lows are sufficient enough for a speaker of its size.  I also compared it to my recently purchased Amazon Echo. There's no comparison, the Megaboom blows the Echo away in terms of sound and loudness.  I also put it up against the Soundkick speaker that I purchased a year ago. Sound wise there's no comparison. The Megaboom blew it away as well- as it should for over three times the price.I found the 360 degree of sound claim to be very interesting and placed the speaker on my outside table so I could walk around it and evaluate the sound in an open space. When I walked around this speaker outside I noticed that the left and right channels are absolutely directional in nature. To figure this out I simply put on Van Halen 1 and Van Halen 2. If you know these albums, you know that Eddie's guitar was recorded in the left channel. If you place this speaker with the volume controls at the BACK, you will find that the left side of the speaker represents the left channel. I found this little tidbit to be quite interesting given how the speaker is constructed and based on the 360 degree of sound claims on the website.Overall, the speaker is very well constructed. It's got a soft fabric feel to it and claims to be weatherproof. I personally would not try dropping a $300 speaker in the pool, so I'll just accept their claims and keep it safely away from such dangers. The website claims it will still function after getting dunked.It's light enough to tote around without any problem. It charges via a simple USB cable that we have dozens of. It doesn't require a proprietary wall wart of an adapter thankfully! (Hear THAT Amazon Echo??)  It would be nice is there was some sort of retractable handle for carrying, but that's a minor gripe.There's nothing I can complain about when it comes to the UE Megaboom, except perhaps its price of $300.
