Then again, it sounded better than the Bose Mini. So I suppose you get what you pay for in terms of quality. It's a lot of money for a portable speaker. But it's got a two year warranty and should last quite a long time being that the battery is replaceable (at what price I do not know.)

author: Just Mike
title: I am both amazed and happy with this thing
body: I purchased mine through T-Mobile today looking to replace my old "iPod driven alarm clock"...I am both amazed and happy with this thing.  It's SO easy to use, great sound, perfect high's and great low's.  The base is there, and its so portable and convenient.  I will probably purchase a second and replace my living room stereo system in the near future.  I've received numerous compliments when I put music on while making dinner by guests.  One speaker, fill up my entire living room and kitchen, roughly 350-400 SQ FT...Amazing.

author: Steven
title: Sounds great... Too bad connectivity and the app suck. Does not double up with other UE Boom speakers.
body: Sounds great.The worst software / app available. I constantly have to pair my speakers. THE APP USED TO WORK GREAT UNTIL THE RECENT FIRMWARE UPDATE . You will rip your hair out trying to get this speaker to double up with another boom.I regret buying two of them. If I had the opportunity I would pack this speaker in a bag of dog crap and return it to Logitech

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible reliability with UE products
body: I have had my UE Megaboom for around 9 months and it completely broke. Before owning this speaker, I had a regular UE Boom and that speaker broke in just over a year, which was out of warranty; they would not even do anything to help me repair it, making it useless. I got the Megaboom as a gift, and I have enjoyed using the speaker, but UE products are NOT reliable at all. I would not suggest buying any UE speaker if you want your speaker to last more than a year.

author: Charlie hall
title: The best in portable speakers
body: I got one of these for Xmas last year and it is absolutely amazing! Obviously do not expect home stereo sound quality since it is portable but these are getting incredibly close to being on that level! I use it for small get togethers and camping trips and get nothing but compliments on how amazing this thing sounds. Battery life is also fantastic, have never had an issue with it dying on me. If you are in the market for a well made and great sounding portable speaker, then look no further!

author: Concepcion Venegas
title: ... half years now and still today it works as good as new
body: Been having this speaker for about 2 and a half years now and still today it works as good as new. It's fallen inside a pool (stayed afloat), fallen down a flight of stairs, rolled down a hill of dirt and still plays like it has never been hurt before. With it's strong sound  system  and long lasting battery, you can play any type of music & the whole house will be able to  enjoy clear sharp sounds with a deep bass, for long hours. Since the moment I bought the UE Megaboom, it has never disappointed  me.

author: Pavan Kumar Kora
title: Faild to chargeI it's first recharge. I don't recommend to buy/gift this at all.
body: As long as it works and charging you will enjoy the music.Mine is new, its just 3 weeks old and when I start charging it never worked, Just blinks 3 times and turned off the charging indicator light and never charged and completely turned off.As got it as a gift, I don't want to give this hassle to any my beloved one at all.Self Service: Nothing worked.Tried resetting, power + vol down.All weird combos people suggested on net, like 4 buttons, 2 buttons (vol) press.Update:Someone in internet suggested to keep it in refrigerator, I know it sounds crazy, but it worked to bring the charging light on and blinking.But it stopped blinking after a while, however huge improvement is it started turning on.Called customer care at 646-454-3200 (Mon-Fri 6-6 PST) and they are going to replace with new one.Update: it changed 100% and running fine as of now. Trying to drain it completely and see if it changes second time.

author: MrHamilton
title: Months after purchase I hereby declare this product highly over priced and overrated. Keep shopping
body: Paid $40 more for this speaker (not from Amazon) and frankly I'm not that impressed. It's designed for iPhones and such but I'm an android user.The deeply recessed charging port on the bottom of the unit is NOT a plus unless it's a feature designed keep it waterproof, but for a $300 unit I'd rather not find out the hard way that it's just a BS selling point.Even downloaded the UE Megaboom app but I have yet to be able to turn speaker on/off remotely.As far as bass quality and overall sound I prefer my Bose Mini Soundlink.

author: EastCoastal
title: Best Waterproof Bluetooth Speeker on Market
body: The UE Megaboom is a great buy. I bought mine to use while out on the boat and for at the beach. This thing performs, I can here the music just fine while underway at 20-30kts (4Stroke) and it works perfect at the beach. So far the battery life is better than any other portable electronic device I own. I'll update this post if anything changes.If you're looking for a waterproof Bluetooth speaker, stop searching! This is the speaker for you. Also, BestBuy has a one year replacement policy with UE so no need for extra coverage.

author: LunaTic
title: Great till it was updated to a paperweight
body: Don't update the firmware after buying it!Gifted the MEGABOOM a few Months back. Everything was great till the recent update.  since the audio and video have become out of sync and I can't seem to get it to work.Otherwise it's a great speaker, portable, easy to sync and great sound.  Sadly I can't use it to watch video. I know others are having the same issue.

author: cjhsa
title: Very nice but not perfect
body: Very nice, however, it is bass-centric and difficult to get good midrange and treble out of it.  The one big drawback is the micro-USB charging port.  It is extremely difficult to get the charging cable inserted, and even worse if you try to use a standard micro-USB cable instead of the hideously green one supplied with the speaker.

author: Darcy Pennell
title: Amazing
body: I am loving this speaker. The sound is fantastic. It is very sleek and modern. I thought it was a bit overpacked, but I like that the clamshell case is comes in can be used to carry it and its accessories.If I have any complaint, it is that maybe it is a bit too sleek. It took me forever to find the charging cable and I was using it for a few days before I realized there are volume buttons on the front of it. I thought the plus and minus buttons were just decorative!The waterproof design means that the aux and charging ports are under a thick rubber plug. It is a bit tough to open them at first, but it gets easier over time.I have it synced with my laptop and have been using it all day to watch Daredevil on Netflix. The sound is really incredible. It is a bit bass heavy for my taste, but that is a minor issue. I'll never use my crappy Sony laptop speakers again!I've been using it for several hours straight and it is still 80% charged. To test the charge you hold in the plus and minus buttons at the same time (the cross on the front of it) and then a lady's voice tells you how much charge is left.I've tested a few different wireless speakers and this is by far the best. I'm really surprised by the sound quality given the price point.

author: Thomas L Gretch
title: A Best Buy sales guy said these speakers were amazing
body: A Best Buy sales guy said these speakers were amazing. I wanted stereo so I bit the bullet and bought two right away. To tell you the truth I went through hell with tech support to get satisfaction but they FINALLY got it right, I have an iPhone 7 with 2 UE MEGABOOMs and I could not be happier. Playing music in stereo with my two MEGABOOM speakers is unbelievable. Admittedly it it is not as good as wired speakers but I would not expect it to be. But I am still blown away! Six months ago it was all frustration but finally I am overjoyed with my purchase. It was all software issues that needed to be improved and Bose and Apple came through. I stand in awe at their hard work because I sure had a lot of complaints for a long time.

author: James C.
title: AVOID...FOR NOW
body: Bought this speaker at Best Buy, and there happened to be a little lag when watching youtube or videos on my computer. Called customer service and they told me that this was a "known issue that they're trying to resolve," but for now, "there is nothing they can do about it." For something that I paid $250 for, I was upset that they wouldn't replace the speaker or try to offer me a refund. After watching youtube videos with it for a while, I decided to just use my computer speakers for the time being because the lag really does get annoying after a while. There's a connectivity issue with this model. I would avoid this until they come up with an updated model...

author: ThisIsNot
title: Sounds great, sturdy, good battery life
body: I recently decided to upgrade my current Bluetooth speaker (the original UE Boom) to something a bit bigger.  I wanted a unit that could last just as long on a charge (at least 15 hours), produce more volume, and at least be able to replicate the same sound quality of the UE Boom.  I originally went with the Beats Pill XL as I really liked the overpowering bass but that was recalled.  Now having received my money refund, I went back on the market.This time, however, there was the Megaboom.  I purchased the Megaboom along with the SoundLink III to test both speakers at my home in various listening conditions.  These include a small bathroom (10'X15'), sitting on my desk (which is in my living room), on my patio deck (13'X13'), and out in the field with all sorts of loud equipment running.  My music source was my Samsung Galaxy Note Edge with music all downloaded from Google Music All Access (320kbps mp3 files).  I listened to the Megaboom and SoundLink III (which I will now call MB and SLIII, respectively) in those environments using songs in the genres of metal (everything from Metallica to Korn, Cannibal Corpse, Rob Zombie The Black Dahlia Murder, Slayer), classic metal (Black Sabbath, Judas Priest, Iron Maiden), classic rock (AC/DC), some hip-hop/rap (mainly Eminem and old Ice Cube), and then dubstep/techno (Nero, Skrillex).Overall, I found the MB to be more pleasing.  It was able to produce a louder volume while retaining its clarity, more highs, and more lows without being overbearing.  The only time the SLIII was able to produce more lows was when its back was up about 1-2" from a solid wall.  I only use the speaker like that when its on my desk and when its in the bathroom.  Otherwise I'm not putting my speakers up near a wall.  The MB was also more balanced with one aspect not taking over another while the SLIII was definitely more bass-heavy with muffled highs.  I think the SLIII is definitely more stylish that the MB but, at the same time, it is also more fragile.The MB is full on waterproof for up to 30 minutes at a depth of 1 meter (3.28 ft), it also floats for quite a bit of time before filling up with water.  That means you can put it right next to the pool and, if it accidentally falls in, you have plenty of time (a good 5-10 minutes) to get it out of the pool before it sinks.  It also means that you can take the MB in the shower with you, it's also dust/dirt resistant so you can take it to the beach as well or out camping.  The SLIII requires the purchase of a protective case if you don't want to scratch the aluminum (which is an additional $35).  There's also the issue of power.  The MB is rated for 20 hours of playback but that seems to be the number if you play at maximum volume.  I have read many reviews that put the MB's battery life at 25 hours on medium volume and my numbers (I've drained and charged it twice) agree with that.  The SLIII is rated for 14 hours of playback and that's about accurate, it's a little less when playing at a higher volume.  The MB comes with an AC adapter that has a standard USB port and it charges via micro USB.  You could always charge it with a smartphone charger (even an iPhone/iPad charger) if you had to.  It wouldn't be as fast as the included AC adapter but it would still work.  The SLIII only charges with Bose's proprietary AC adapter.Lastly, there's the issue with features.  The SLIII has basic playback and volume controls on the top of it along with a standard 3.5mm input, that's it.  The micro USB port on the back of the SLIII is for firmware upgrades and I didn't receive one while I had the unit.  The MB only has volume controls on the unit (along with power and Bluetooth buttons) but you can turn the speaker on and off, remotely, using the MB app from your smartphone or tablet (Android and iOS only).  You can also change the EQ of the MB using the app, upgrade the firmware, and the best feature: double-up.  This lets you pair the MB with another MB to get proper stereo sound or dual-mono sound.  You can also pair up with a smaller UE Boom with the same setup (stereo or dual-mono).  It's a great feature and I wish more speakers would do it but UE and Beats seem to be about the only ones supporting it.The price of the MB may seem a little high but you really are getting a great Bluetooth speakers that's still extremely portable.  The original Boom was about the size of a can of Monster/Rockstar energy drink and the MB is about as big as my 24 oz Thermos water bottle (it's a little shorter and has a slightly larger diameter).  It weighs 339 grams (almost 3/4 of a lb) more than the UE Boom, equating to an extra 63% but it's still very portable.  You can hook a carabiner clip to it and take it everywhere.  You can also hook a small camera tripod up to it if you want to wrap it around a tree limb or keep it up off a puddle of water or out of the sand (neither of which would hurt it).  The bass is lacking a bit compared with the SLIII but the highs are more prominent and the sound is overall more balanced.  The MB is sturdier, lasts longer on a single charge, and has a lot more features.I highly recommend this over the SLIII and definitely the Big Jambox (which I had a couple of years ago before the Beats Pill XL).  People who had to send their Pill XL units back to Apple for a recall would be wise to pick one of these up instead.  It's a great solution.

author: Ed
title: Microphone Does Not Work
body: It sounded great, but the microphone didn't function. So it did not work as a speakerphone. Not sure if this is a defective unit, but just not really an option. No reply from Logitech customer service. Returning it.

author: Lee
title: Dodgy software and minimal support
body: I bought a pair of these for my iMac. There was no user guide. So I googled and found the on-line "help," which is not user friendly. I finally figured out how to pair them to the iMac and get them working together (required an odd button combination on both speakers). After a lot of aggravation, I finally got my iMac to see them and play them through iTunes. Sounded good.Next time I tried, I had to go through the whole routine again!Downloaded the app on my iPhone to see if I could adjust any settings. iPhone didn't "see" one speaker to pair. Finally got them both paired and then the app didn't see them. (The app is also user-unfriendly and buggy.) I could never get the iPhone to play on both speakers.When I went back to the iMac, it wouldn't play both speakers either, no matter what I tried.I could have spent hours trying to figure out how to reset the speakers, download new firmware, try to get customer support, etc. Or maybe one or both speakers were defective and replacements would have worked. Either way, I have a lot better things to do with my time than fool around with dodgy products, so I returned the speakers.Here's all I wanted: a pair of speakers that automatically, reliably comes on whenever I play a tune in iTunes, watch a DVD, or look at a YouTube video. These speakers didn't do it.

author: SMH79
title: Great sound!
body: Bought this to replace a dewalt radio DCR015 for backyard gatherings. I wanted something with durability, portability, waterproof capabilities, and longer battery life. Originally bought the JBL Charge 3 as a replacement but returned it because it wasn't loud enough for outdoor use and my personal use. The megaboom was louder than my charge 3 and has way better sound and battery life than my dewalt radio. Bonus is the 360 sound. Highly recommended!

author: Jimbo
title: Not a good experience
body: I received the MAGA Boom over the Fourth of July holiday. It worked fine for about two weeks and then It began to fail. It will not charge. The battery would not charge or work and the unit could only work while plugged in. Then when the sound was raised even though plugged in the unit had a cracking sound in the speaker. We have returned it to Amazon. It has a nice sound and we liked it and hope the replacement will work correctly

author: Robert Alfieri
title: THE BEST PORTABLE WATERPROOF SPEAKER ON THE MARKET HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
body: I bought this last month and I am overwhelmed of the quality and sound of this Speaker.  My friend owns the bose soundlink 3 and he was blown away to the sound of this speaker.  He paid $299 for his bose and he said this speakers sound is clearer and more powerful than the bose.  He sold his bose and purchased the ue megaboom.  I recently just purchased a second one and when I paired the 2 for the first time the sound is like having a $2000 home speaker surround system.  The batteries last me if I play at full volume for around 7 hours.  That is double the time from the bose soundlink.  Also the waterproof ability is unreal.  My brother has a pool and I set one speaker on each side of the pool on edge and I done have to worry about them getting wet.  I highly recommend this Speaker.  The cost is well worth it considering the sound, quality, portability and being waterproof.

author: raylay
title: so far so good!
body: Received as a gift about a week ago.  Sounds great and battery life is ridiculous.  Available volume is up there, but as with most speakers like this the sound quality takes a nose dive when you get it near the top end....but that's not a problem at all.  i have a fiend that has one as week and the double up feature is great...it will make you want to buy another for the stereo.

author: JMM
title: UE Megabook Bluetooth Speaker
body: I have been using this UE Megaboom Speaker for over a month now, I enjoy it very much.  Sound quality is excellent - most 360-degree speakers like this leave something to be desired when it comes to audio quality, but the Megaboom is one of the best I have tested.  It's also worth noting that the speaker can go very loud - certainly far louder than I would ever need it to be.I find the insane battery life and the extended wireless range are much better than the average speaker on the market; so if you care about those features (which are not necessary, but are certainly more convenient) then it may be worth spending the money on this.The "waterproofing" feature is a nice bonus; it allows you to use the speaker outside or at a party without having to worry about it getting a little wet.  I would not go submerging this in the water though (although UE's product info states that it can be submerged for 30 minutes - I'm not going to find out!).

author: Joe Wojnowski
title: Best Bluetooth Speaker Available
body: An absolutely amazing product.  I went for the megaboom because I never wanted to have to say "I wish this speaker was louder" as you often have to do with other speakers.  The fact that this speaker is rugged and waterproof puts it leagues ahead of other products because it can be used and abused and still produce amazing sound.  I have left this speaker outside unattended for days and it has no issues.  The battery life is phenomenal and the speaker doesn't lose charge if it isn't used for a while.  The bluetooth connectivity is seamless, and the app gives you full ability to turn the speaker on/off, check the battery level, adjust the eq, etc.

author: AMZ
title: If you are caught between buying the JBL Xtreme and the UE Megaboom, this review is for you!
body: I purchased a UE Megaboom, not from amazon, but from best buy because i'm super impatient.Initially i was caught between buying the JBL Xtreme and the UE Megaboom because they were both rugged speakers designed for the outdoors. Primary usage for this speaker would be around bodies of water so it needed to have some form of water resistance. In this review im going to use the Harman Kardon Onyx as a benchmark for some aspects of comparison.SOUND QUALITY:The UE Megaboom has a very balanced sound, it is not super bass heavy like the JBL Xtreme, but it can definitely hold its own. One thing i should mention is that the JBL Xtreme is only water RESISTANT, it is not waterproof and submersable like the UE Megaboom. This aspect will definitely affect sound quality because as we know, bass is created by air movement. When you have a watertight space, it makes releasing air difficult. The Megaboom has 4 passive radiators to remedy this issue. The JBL Xtreme only requires 2 because it is only water resistant and is designed with the radiators on the end of the device. It is impossible to get a waterproof speaker to sound like, say, a Harman Kardon Onyx because the Onyx cant even go near moisture, it has a radiator and absolutely no water protection so it can move the most air and create the most bass tones. That being said, the UE Megaboom has a very solid sound that can keep up well with many different styles of music.I put the UE Megaboom through a series of tests with different styles of music from the Amazon Music streaming service, here are my findingsHip-Hop: Hold On, Were Going Home - DrakeThis song's tight, punchy bass comes through super bright on the UE Megaboom. Vocals are also clean and bright. it struggles slightly with the deep sub-bass tones, but that is to be expected from two 2 inch drivers. The most important aspects of the song come through.Pop: Get Lucky - Daft PunkThis is a song i have heard on a multitude of different speakers so i would say that i know how this song should sound. On the UE Megaboom, this song's rich, warm tone comes through beautifully! The speaker has no problem clearly differentiating the guitar from the bass guitar. Pharrell's vocal tone also comes through nicely also. When the robot's start to sing towards the end, the treble tones are incredible and come through loud and clear, but not enough to drown out the rest of the tones.Classic Rock: Panama - Van HalenRock music is really where the UE Megaboom shines. This song sounds good on just about any speaker, but on the UE megaboom, it makes it sound like youre hearing them live. The guitars come through very nicely and compliments the bass tones from the drum kit. Guitar solos come through incredibly since they consist of treble tones, which the Megaboom is able to replicate clearly.Reggae: One Love - Bob MarleyReggae music is not a bad option for this speaker. On a remastered version of Bob Marley's One Love, each instrument comes through the clearest of all the genres i have played so far. It is super bright and clear, that is all i can say. Buy one and listen for yourself.EDM: Be Right There - Diplo & Sleepy TomEDM is a genre that is rather hit or miss on the UE Megaboom. Some songs can sound good and some not so much. Be Right There by Diplo and Sleepy Tom is a great example of EDM that sounds fantastic on the Megaboom. Bass tones come through with a nice rumble. Between bass and the majority of the treble tones, the Megaboom has no issues differentiating them. By the time the first drop comes around, the Megaboom handles the bassline fairly well. We do not get very much of the super deep sub-bass, but we get the bass tones that matter.Country: Brad Paisley - WaterIt is at this point that i am starting to see a pattern between the UE Megaboom's clear tones and organic instruments, and Brad Paisley's Water is no exception. Brad's vocals come through very strong and the guitar tones benefit as they are complimentary. Like in the rock genre, guitar solos come through very clear and clean.VOLUME:I usually listened to the Megaboom at around 40-50% volume. Playing an hour of music at 75% volume got me a nice note from my neighbors on my door (I live in a college dorm with thin walls). So trust me when i say, volume is not an issue with the Megaboom, its got a ton of oomph behind it!Now lets compare features and weigh out the Pros and Cons.BATTERY LIFE:The JBL Xtreme only gets a 15 hour battery life while the Megaboom keeps the party going for an additional 5 hours.You are able to charge your phone on the JBL Xtreme while you cant on the megaboom, but with the money you save buying the Megaboom, you can buy yourself one of those power banks to charge your phone from. One other advantage is that if you have a Power Bank, you can charge the Megaboom off of that since it charges via USB instead of a proprietary plug that reminds me alot of the one that came with my Harman Kardon Onyx.EASE OF USE:The Megaboom and the JBL Xtreme rival in their ease of use. Both have a complimentary app and they both have some form of social mode. They both are able to pair a second speaker to create stereo sound. Do i have the budget for that? Heck no, but it would sure be cool to see them work in tandem! Once you get the Megaboom charged (It requires at least 6 hours for the initial charge, the charging light will stop flashing when it is fully charged), turn it on, and you can get it paired to your device within 30 seconds initially. Once its paired to a device it will pair almost instantly once turned on.SIZE:The UE Megaboom is about the size of a 40oz HydroFlask. It is skinnier by about 1/4 inch which makes toting it considerably easier. Its weight is about half of the JBL Xtreme which also makes portability a win for the Megaboom. The JBL Xtreme is heavy, weighing in at almost 5 pounds. JBL knows its heavy too because it comes with a shoulder strap. The Megaboom can be easily tossed into a backpack while the Xtreme requires you to carry it off body which could limit the places you could take it.CARE:Both the JBL Xtreme and the UE Megaboom can be cleaned under a running faucet. However, i believe the UE Megaboom can handle water better since it is IPX7 waterproof and can be submerged for up to 30 minutes in 3 feet of water. I would honestly be wary about a device that can be cleaned under a faucet, but you cant submerge it (JBL, im looking at you). Both the JBL and the UE have the same woven skin over the speaker which gives it a really unique look. Ive heard that the fabric is plasma coated which gives it its water resistance.SUPPORT:The UE Megaboom has a 2 year warranty and a battery replacement service (yes, the battery is replaceable!). For 49 bucks you send your Megaboom to Logitech and they replace your battery. The JBL Xtreme is a sealed unit and the battery is not replaceable, or it is and they dont advertise it like Logitech does, its kind of a mystery.CONCLUSION:While yes, the JBL Xtreme may sound better, it has some limiting factors that affects intended usage. When i think "rugged speaker", i want to be able to take it everywhere without worrying about damage. Since the UE Megaboom is not only waterproof but also shockproof, i believe that it is a superior rugged speaker in terms of the amount of abuse it could be able to handle. The only speaker that may surpass it in ruggedness is the Braven BRV-PRO which is designed to go wherever a go-pro can go because of its mount but you are sacrificing sound quality at an even greater level for ruggedness. The UE megaboom is a great compromise between ruggedness and sound quality and i would recommend it to anyone heading out on adventures and wants a great sounding speaker to take with them!

author: BSullivan
title: Just buy it already
body: It's sad when you talk about replacing your car sound system with a Bluetooth speaker. That's how amazing this is. I have a three story house. On full volume, I can leave it on the bottoms floor and enjoy it on the third. The sound is amazing. Why are you still reading the reviews? We have 2 of these. One for me and one for my husband. My husband got jealous.

author: Cory
title: You can get a better device for your money.
body: I've had warranty replace 2 devices now, I'm using my 3rd. First of all, their customer service is TERRIBLE. Second, when you spend this kind of money on a bluetooth speaker, you wouldn't expect crummy quality that causes the device to be replaced for 2 different issues. The first unit wouldn't charge after using it for only a month. The second unit started crackling like a blown speaker.

author: PeterTheCheater
title: Perfect for backpacking / camping
body: I've had a jbl charge 2 for a long time, and was looking for an upgrade because of it's poor battery life. If you go backpacking often and don't have access to power for long periods, this is the perfect party speaker (as it has been for me). I've played it for 24 hours straight without a charge, had to clean all kinds of water and gunk off of it, and all the while, it has played its brilliant, balanced sound. The only possible complaint is that it's mods are a bit low... but I'm not too bothered about that. It sounds just as good as any other speaker, even some of the more expensive ones.

author: Cliente de Amazon
title: Wirecutter said this almost equaled their top choice Sony XB41
body: I own both. Took the Megaboom on vacation to Acapulco. Very, very impressed. So was everybody else in the hotel!  Need to use an equalizer - I have 3 different ones on an Android tablet. An incredible purchase.

author: JF
title: Bluetooth pairing very faulty
body: I purchased this device from Best Buy, and had a great experience for 6 months - brought it on a 7-day bike ride, it was loud enough to listen on the road, and paired wonderfully with my phone.However, after about 6 months of use, I got a new phone and new computer, and it wouldn't pair with these devices' bluetooth.  After some searching and testing, I found that I needed to reset the device to factory settings (holding down the '-' volume and the power button for 10 seconds); this evidently is necessary since the device can only remember 8 bluetooth devices total, and then won't pair with any new device.  However, after doing this, I've needed to reset my UE Megaboom after each use...if I want to use it with my phone, I do that, but then if I want to pair it to my laptop to watch a movie, now I need to reset the UE Megaboom to pair it to my laptop.  It appears to only recognize the last device it's paired with.Hence, I wouldn't recommend - for $300, we should get a device that pairs with bluetooth devices seamlessly..and not have to reset our speaker every single time we want to use it.

author: Austin
title: Loud, Crisp Sound - Went with this over Soundlink III
body: I got this speaker on sale form T-Mobile for $220 after doing pretty extensive research. I was deciding between this speaker and the Bose Soundlink III. This speaker is crisp, provides great bass and is LOUD. It provides sounds in virtually every direction and it is waterproof. This thing is built like a tank and will last for years to come. I am taking it on a boating trip in a few weeks and I am really excited to use it. I would definitely recommend this speaker over any others in this price range.Update: Speaker is still amazing and they keep adding features!!! You can double-up with another speaker, use block party to have multiple people play music, and use tap features to navigate through songs. I couldn't be happier and I am considering buying another!

author: CJ Deiley
title: I want my $300 back
body: Had the speaker for a year and it blew out about a year later worst $300 I’ve ever spent. Should have invested in a more reliable speaker since it’s not cracked up to be what logitech made it when it came out. Was an amazing speaker at the start and always was until one day I used it well getting dressed then came back for it a little later and started to use it and realize the sound quality want from amazing to poor.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Disappointed
body: I've had this product for about 2 years. I use it lightly and don't blast it, it's mostly for indoor personal use. Currently it is staticky at all ranges of volume (never had a blowout) and hasn't been able to hold a charge for over a year. I'm very disappointed for the high price that multiple things have gone wrong. Even charging for 3 hours I can barely get a 1/5 of a charge and after an hour or so it still states "critical battery, please charge" and won't turn on. I bought this expecting a durable solid speaker but now it's at the point I may as well throw it away.

author: Andrew Grieve
title: NO REPAIR OPTIONS ONCE WARRANTY IS DONE!?
body: The speaker is fine but once it’s out of warranty they offer absolutely no repair services or even sell spare parts for DIY repairs. All I need is a battery replacement and they are telling me they cannot do anything and that maybe I should google it and see if there’s any solution!?!??!?! What a load of nonsense.Long story short, Logitch / UE has lost a customer and I recommend other stay away as well.

author: Alex
title: Not good speaker
body: Does not stay on, I have the app, it use to connect when I turned the app on. It doesn’t now. When I turn it on manually I will just make a weird drum sound and turn off

author: Lukas
title: So yeah, it's waterproof
body: Going through the reviews, I figured this would be the next thing I'd try. I was using cheap bluetooth speakers for picnics and outside before, but wanted to crank it up a notch.I bought them yesterday in a local Apple Store (cheaper than Amazon due to company discount) and took them to the pool. The clerk told me these were waterproof, not water resistant, and I can dump them in the water just fine. I wouldn't believe him but was offered to just return them if anything doesn't work out - he knew what he was talking about...Put it on max, blasted some party music and got everyone's attention (incl. the people 100ft away on the balcony, err) and then just threw it in the pool. THIS THING IS AMAZING. Rugged, sturdy, waterproof (excellent for jetski and boating, apparently) and nice weight to it, you kinda want to hold it and play with it.

author: Chelsea
title: I really want to like this product because I was so excited for the ...
body: I really want to like this product because I was so excited for the waterproof capability as well as the 20 hour battery. For the first two weeks i owned this, it was my favorite. But then it stopped charging after the first full use. I have had for two months now and one time it magically charged and hasn't done so since. I have tried every thing recommended and have spent waaaaay to much time trying to figure out how to get it to work. It now will play songs as long as its plugged into the wall but the sound quality isn't very good. It is distorted, scratchy, it clicks and disconnects for a couple a seconds every now and then in a middle of a song. Very Disappointing!!

author: ModHay
body: Most amazing speakers I have ever used. These are the kind of speakers that are so loud...you get scared to turn them up ha ha! I was going to to go with the UE Boom 2, or the JBL charge 3...but I chose these. These are 100 times better.

author: Mark Twain
title: Not worth $299
body: Its just okay. I bought mine from Best Buy. While having waterproof and it is really loud, it lacks low and midrange. I am returning mine for the sharkk. The sharkk isn't as loud but it provides rich sound quality, lasts 15-18 hours and is waterproof, plus it is 200 + cheaper. I was hoping to really like this. It is simplistic to use and is great quality build though.

author: MJP
title: I love it. I got mine 30% off otherwise I ...
body: I love it.  I got mine 30% off otherwise I probably wouldn't have gotten it.  It sounds amazing for its size and the battery life is really great.  I throw it in the shower, take to bonfires, and anywhere else I go.  I love having music no matter where I am which makes this speaker a great fit since it's extremely durable and sounds great.

author: D. Blankenship
title: Stunning!  I hope we can keep it.
body: It is really rather stunning that such a small speaker can deliver the volume and quality of sound that this thing does.  I must admit to have been pleasingly shocked when we first tried this speaker in our home and on our patio.  Both my wife and I had to smile when we remembered growing up in the late 1950s and the little record players we used to play our 45s on...wow, what a difference!Set up is more or less effortless and even a non-tech person such as myself had very few problems once I found where the cable was stashed.  My wife and I play a lot of "oldies;" stuff from the 60s and 70s and this speaker handles it all quite well.  I suspect it would do an even better job with some of the current rock music but as we don't have any and don't care to have it, that was not a factor for us.This thing, while not absolutely completely water proof, most certainly is water resistant and can be used near the pool and in a rather damp environment.  The range is quite good and we have had no problem with that what so ever.We have several speakers of this ilk but I must say that this is by far the best we have listened to and used so far.  I am sure in the near future something better will come around, but for now I simply don't know what is better.The only problem we are having with this speaker is that our grandsons, all in their early twenties, are looking at it, playing with it and gazing upon it with coveting eyes so I do not know how much longer we will have possession of it.  This such as this seem to vanish around our house...they are like a flock of ravens that love bright shinny objects.Very happy with this speaker.Don BlankenshipThe Ozarks

author: STEVEN A. ZITTEL
title: Avoid mega money boom ripoff.
body: That one star is really represents minus 50 stars.I bought 1 mega  $bucks boom that worked ok after trying to connect to Bluetooth several times every time I tried to use it. Like a fool I spent more $$$ on another one to have stereo sound. This will only make you pull your hair out and curse out loud. Check the boom app reviews  in play store a see first hand on all of the negative reviews that are not only from me. Avoid their products- Tech support won't even contact you! Way over priced so complicated it is not worth your time to get any sound from them.

author: M.E. Design
title: Dont be a dummy, It comes with a cord!!!!!
body: Anyone that says anything about "weird, it comes with a plug in, but no cord", needs to go back to the càse it came in and check the bottom edge, there is a "hidden" compartment, an it is nicely coiled up inside, kinda sneaky actually. Anyway, the speaker is awesome.  Been with me on 4 float trips (even did the water proof test) ,  up 4 cell phone towers,  many other jobsites and will play on full volume for about 10 hours. On lower settings It lasts much longer. Lasted me almost 4 days in the office without a charge.  The smart phone app is awesome, and has customizable settings for sound.Makes an awesome gift. My gf thought it was stupid when I bought her one for her b-day..... because it's not a diamond or a porche. She loves it now that she has used it. I probably should have bedazzled it for her.

author: Rodney Castaneda
title: Great loud and full sounding speaker
body: This speaker truly has a full sound. I tested others and they didn't compare. This one is really loud. It's enough to power the music in the patio and while in the pool. It sounds just as good as my wired speakers by the pool and in the patio. This really exceeded my expectations.

author: Terry L Colby
title: Does NOT Work With the UE Roll as of 12/2016
body: Actually, I like this device, but it was purchased to work with a UE Roll, which it did until the latest firmware update.  Logitech decided to pull the rug out from under all the "mixed speaker" users.  This device no longer works with the UE Roll.  As for the Boom, buyer beware.  Logitech can ruin your day with the next software release.  I just spent a hour with their tech support.  Conclusion: "Tough, you cant roll the update back and we're not changing it."  Don't you hate it when a respected company leaves you out in the cold with an update and doesn't care.

author: Jeremy S.
title: NOT WATERPROOF!
body: I purchased this from BestBuy and luckily got the 2 year extended warranty. I use this on the boat so I payed more for the "waterproof" model... Let me first be very clear about this... this IS NOT WATERPROOF! One drop in the water and it no longer works. The seriously need to just say water resistant and waterproof this is not.Asides from the weakness to water, this sounds great and works much better than the JawBone Big Jambox IMHO. The App allows you to do some simple tweaking to get better sound. Also, when the box touches water the speakers shut off immediately, I liked that. Unfortunately, it shortly stopped working in about 30 mins.2 stars only due to it being "waterproof" when it clearly is not. If it were, 5 stars would be a fair assessment.

author: Tyler W. Kuehn
title: Great speaker! Highly recommend!
body: It's truly a great speaker. I can echo everyone point of it having slightly weak bass but as a whole it's tremendous. I sell these at a store I work for and we have a demo model that we keep in a tank of water almost 24/7. It works great, I finally bought one and after I got over the sticker shock I couldn't be happier! I'm so happy in fact I'll be buying my second Megaboom soon. If you need big sound, do anything outdoors or just want a better home listening experience you can't beat it. (Heck, I even use mine as my car speaker...).

author: Cameron dowiak
title: Sounds Great, Battery Stinks!!
body: Love the sound and connecting several at the same time is wonderful..... but the batter doesnt last.  Now it wont let me connect at all.  Even with the hard reboot, nothing.  Lasted about a year.  junk now.

author: L. T. Davenport
title: shock proof and has fantastic sound! I have yet to use the entire ...
body: I purchased this from a local big-box store after having read numerous reviews & I found this was exactly what I wanted. I broke a previous Bluetooth speaker when it took a 7 foot fall in my shower, this one is waterproof, shock proof and has fantastic sound! I have yet to use the entire battery, even after a full 10 hours of use at a comfortable indoor volume level.I have not used the app much, but I hear it has some nice features. I do not know, however, how to use this during a phone call (supposedly you can answer the call with the speaker?).I am so pleased with this, I have been seriously considering buying another one to pair up for better surround sound.

author: Judith C.
title: Awesome sound, waterproof.
body: This Bluetooth player has awesome sound and can be controlled easily from a distance, and you can connect multiple units for stereo. There is an app that lets you personalize the sound, so if you want to increase the bass, you can. A friend has it and loves it, so I ordered it. Well worth the price and waterproof for outdoor use.

author: J. Wise
title: Totally impressed with the sound quality
body: Great bluetooth speaker.  Totally impressed with the sound quality.  I listed to this speaker and several others in store.  None of the competitors seemed to offer the same level of bass.  Most had a tiny and non-full sound.  Also, the smaller products, although well designed, could not come close to this in sound quality

author: frederic drzewowski
title: PERFECT COMBINATION . Size Weight
body: I ordered an overrated overhyped Soundblaster Creative Labs Roar 2.  I received it at 10 am in the morning ; i was at the post office by 2 pm to return it. By 3 pm i ordered a MEGABOOM . I also own a Harman Kardon Onyx Studio which is great sound but poor battery life outdoors and a bit heavy in my back pack .  I checked also the MiniLink 2 . But the UE is by far a real Nomad Speakers.  Some people call themselves nomad when they go from the Bathroom to the Kitchen, and when going to the bakery it's an expedition. So they love the good sound of Bose Mini Link 2. UE MEGABOOM is so long battery life; great power volume,  and overall good quality sound . Perfect Size and Weight.

author: Tony Wells
title: Buyer Beware!!! Poor quality and service
body: Buyer beware!!  I was a five star rated customer for the first 9 months, but then the speaker quality started to get poor and then eventually the speaker wouldn't even take a charge.  I called UE Megabom (logitech) customer support, and the Customer Support Rep Carlo told me I can return to them, if I remove the rubber off of the speaker.  I call them last week for an update, and they told me since I listened to them and removed the rubber piece of the speaker, the warranty is now void!!!!

author: ketama
title: They were wonderful until they were not
body: They were wonderful until they were not. First problem that many many others have experienced ... speaker, despite being 100% charged could only be used when hooked up to the charger . . .Read so many reviews of Logitech's abysmal customer dis-service  . . . THEREFORE BEFORE BUYING ANYTHING, PLEASE CHECK THE COMPANIES CUSTOMER SERVICE RATING!

author: MW
title: These speakers are pretty expensive for what you get
body: I have a love/hate relationship with this device.  These speakers are pretty expensive for what you get.  In order to justify that cost you really expect these things to be top notch as there are some speakers like the Bose that really are amazing.  If you are going to pair two or more of these together think twice about it due to performanceSound - The sound is pretty darn good.  It has a bit of a "honking" tone to it and sometimes the treble can be muffled and sometime the base can be a bit light.  overall I would say its very good.Loudness - This thing is loud as you could ever want with little distortionDurability/Build - This thing seems tough as nails and is waterproof.  top notchPortability - its a bit big but I bring this everywhere.Dual Mode - This is where the speaker really stinks.  I have not been able to get the android app to connect.  Their customer service is worthless to help me.  Its really annoying after you buy two of these for such a high price.  You can pair them without the app thank god and that is what I have done to date.  Once paired however the results are spotty.  Sometimes they work perfectly.  Sometimes they cut out, flutter, etc.  Again super annoying when you have spent sooo much on two of these things.

author: Bucky
title: This sucker is LOUD!
body: It took me a little while and some study to figure this device out, but once I managed to get it in comms with my iphone, I was able to to use it to play music through the phone.  I would have greatly preferred a written instruction manual for its setup and use, rather than the modern method, which consists of go online to find instruction and/or suss things out for yourself.Once I got it working though, it was so loud it scared the daylights out of me and my cats.  But we're all having fun now.  I'm very pleased with  the sound and like its portability.Cool device!

author: BM
title: One of the better ones I've seen
body: For any outdoor gathering, at a beach, pool or yard, this speaker would be a hit, especially since it is water resistant. I found the sound to be quite loud and space-filling, and the effective radius is nearly 360 degrees. The form factor makes it easy to carry around, too.Pros:1) Loud/powerful. Definitely has good ability to fill a large open space with sound2) Water resistant. Have to have that for beach or pool gatherings3) Good Bluetooth range. I had no problems from 50 to 75 feet away, which should cover most party crowds4) Sound. Overall, it is better than other such speakers and in a party situation will not be an issue. Music fills the air evenly all around, but instruments are muted a bit directly behind it. See Cons for further comments5) The app is a must. You need it to connect 2 MegaBooms and has an equalizer that you most likely will want to use6) Can be used as an alarm7) High quality, durable build quality and feel8) Software updates happen and may add future functionality9) Linking 2 can be used as stereo or 2 monos9) Bonus: The lime green USB power adapter and flat wire cord has fast charging capabilities. If you bought a new Samsung S6, it will work with thatCons:1) Volume Buttons. You will get used to them, but the tactile feedback is weak. People unfamiliar with the product will most likely be stumped how to change volume. However, the app can be used for volume, as well2) Sound quality. On one hand, for this type of speaker, it is far above average. Perhaps one of the best. On the other hand, it is not going to pump out audiophile quality sound. Not even close. I have used other Bluetooth speakers, including a high end Bose, and they all seem to have something missing. It seems like you have to sacrifice something in order to push the base out and turn up the highs. There is a hollowness to the sound. However, the app (or you could also use any similar app you like) comes with preset sound profiles or you can customize it on your own with the equalizer, so that helps. Still, and I can't emphasize this enough, in an outdoor party situation, with a lot of people talking, in the open air, this speaker will not disappoint. It will deliver the sound at a volume needed and fill up a large space, and no one is probably going to nit pick at the details of the audio quality. This thing can rock!I am not sure about the battery life, but I've used a bit with no issues. And, since it has a fast charger, that's helps get it back up to speed sooner.I think if you are a purveyor of large outdoor gatherings, especially at a beach, this is a device worth looking into. Pretty impressive sound for this type of speaker, high quality build and an app that can help tweak your sound.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Almost perfect
body: It's sounds very clear and it's the same volume on all sides. But this ain't a party speaker and the bass isn't amazing but for the size and the price it's perfect. It lacks music control buttons which is disappointing. But all in all I think for highschool and hanging out this is better than any speaker out there because it's really portable and produces plenty of sound and it's waterproof . Something like the JBL extreme is much less portable and isn't something you can shove into a backpack full of things.

author: Angel A. Enriquez
title: Survived a week under water
body: I love the sound this speaker puts out. As far as reliability goes, this speaker was under water for a week when my house was flooded during hurricane Harvey. I dried it out and recharged it and it immediately began playing like nothing had happened to it. I still play it as I rebuild my house again.

author: rabbit rabbit
title: BE WARNED, YOU CAN NOT BUY A REPLACEMENT RECHARGEABLE BATTERY FOR THE MEGABOOM.
body: The rechargeable battery can not be replaced, so when it dies, you are left with an expensive paperweight or landfill.Below is the response I received from Logitech customer care when I asked about buying a replacement battery:"My name is Amphie M., I understand that you would like assistance with your UE MEGABOOM Unofrunately, the speaker is not detachable and there are no available spare for it.To contact us by phone or obtain additional information (FAQ's, Forum, Manuals, etc.) please visit support.logitech.comBest regards,Amphie M.Logitech Customer Care"

author: mikhail
title: Speaker keeps losing connection
body: It’s an excellent speaker, light, durable and great sound quality, but the speaker keeps losing connection when I’m playing music from my phone through Bluetooth. Does anyone else have this problem?

author: D
title: Better options for the price, unless you really need a waterproof speaker
body: I bought this from another online retailer (starts with C and rhymes with Dutch field, LOL), but I wanted to leave a review for the Amazon people, too. The Megaboom has two things going for it: long battery life, and durable (waterproof) construction. The sound quality is very mediocre, with harsh highs and hollow-sounding, boomy bass (not tight, punchy bass). I realize that you need to have realistic expectations with a bluetooth speaker, but the sound quality of the Megaboom is just not worth the premium price. If it was 100 bucks, it would be a decent deal, but it's just not worth the $270 price tag. My iLoud was $50 bucks cheaper, and it sounds so much better than the Megaboom, that it's not even a contest (much louder, too). There is an obvious reason for this: the iLoud uses two larger drivers, and two actual tweeters, with separate amps. You will never get full range of sound from a speaker by trying to get all the frequencies from two 2" drivers (as the Megaboom does); it would defy the laws of physics. You're probably wondering, "if you already knew that, why did you buy the Megaboom?". Well, that's a good question. I bought the Megaboom because I wanted a waterproof speaker for outdoor stuff like fishing and kayaking, even though I knew that it wouldn't sound as good as some of it's competitors.If you really need a waterproof bluetooth portable speaker, there just aren't a lot of options, so the Megaboom might still be the best one. But if you want better sound and/or higher volume, get the iLoud. If you want better sound at low volumes, get the Sony SRS-X7 or the Soundlink 3. The iLoud needs some volume to sound really good, where the DSP of the X7 and SL3 gives them fuller sound at lower volumes. I also had a Beats Pill XL that I returned. It sounded better than the Megaboom, but not as good as the other 3 that I mentioned, and it had short range for the Bluetooth.

author: Ham85
title: Great but on two replacements....
body: I bought this speaker a few months ago. Since then, ive had to have it replaced twice! The first speaker i owned a little over a week. I used it three times and while using it at the beach, it died. I knew the battery wasnt dead because the display on my phone had said it was half full. I took it home only to find it would only work plugged in. I sent it back to logitech and got a replacement. The next one i got was great. One day, a week after i had it, i took it to a bbq at the beach. The speaker was never submerged, just splashed. I was being careful because of what happened the first time. It played music for about 3hrs then all the sudden, died. I took it home and tried to plug it in, no luck. I let it sit in my house and came back to it later, it turned on and worked fine. Went to use it the next day, it wouldnt do anything. I finally sent that one in and i just got another replacement. Im really worried now for it to get wet. The speaker sounds great and pairs easily but durability seems to be a problem.

author: Chris Reardon
title: Battery does not hold charge.
body: There is clearly a problem with manufacturing and with customer support. The battery doesn’t hold charge at all, the second you unplug it dies. Customer support is terrible. I got my speaker in August, and still don’t have a replacement or any sign of service.

author: D. Kipp
title: Great Product
body: I had been talked into a Pill and ordered one last week, it was recalled even before I got it. After returning it, I spoke to a Samsung vendor at Best Buy and he was familiar with all of the speakers and he said by far get the UE MEGABOOM. I took the time to try all the latest speakers and the UE MEGABOOM was the best, no contest. After having it now for a few days I'm really happy I went with it. If they weren't so expensive I'd buy a few of them and have them everywhere....

author: Stacey
title: Love it.
body: Incredible battery life, solid sound, easily portable, and the app is great! I realized today that I can remote start it using just the app. Love it.

author: chapman
title: This speaker is amazing, sounds great for it's size
body: This speaker is amazing, sounds great for it's size, is perfect for the beach/by the pool since it is essentially waterproof.... However, since day one I have had problems with it charging! This has been an issue for many, many people I have discovered while trying to find a fix for this problem...

author: M Dan
title: Not worth it
body: Got 2 of the smaller versions of this for my parents for Christmas a few years ago and they’re  awesome put out a lot of sound and decent bass for their size.  I was Very excited to receive this model soon after… However it’s not any louder and doesn’t have any more base then it’s little brother. What’s the point of it being twice as expensive and twice the size. I think the sound quality actually went down.

author: Amazon Customer
title: YouTube ue megaboom problems.  This happens to other units.  Don't buy.  A shame great sounding speaker !!
body: Don't buy babied it.  Never left on charger for more than 2 hours.  Still now won't charge . Only had less than 2 months.  Won't charge now.  Feel like I waisted 300 bucks.  T Mobil 14 day return policy.  They don't care either.  So pisssed  They are obviously aware these have issues.  They better send me a brand new one I am so mad !  Waste

author: Linda Levin
title: Worth every penny
body: Best money I've spent in a long time.  It sounds great, connects to my phone with ease, and has a good battery life. Bass is pretty good for such a small speaker. I use it 1-2 hours a day and battery lasts all week.  I will warn you I took it camping and assumed I could charge it with a lighter adapter and it did not charge at all.

author: Loren W. Christensen
title: Get this one
body: This is an incredible sound speaker. It met and beat my expectations in size, appearance, and sound quality.I ran "Music with base" in youtube and played a few on them the Megaboom. Wow! While it wasn't my kind of music, the demonstration of its base quality was amazing.The set-up directions could be better, but once I figured it out, it was fast and easy.

author: dane wilkins
title: Best $300 a broke College kid could spend!
body: The UE Megaboom is the best $300 I have spent on technology since I bought my television! Never underestimate the power to take your music quite literally everywhere. With its 360* degree sound the Megaboom throws your noise for hundreds of feet, loud and proud! With its waterproofing that actually WORKS I have taken it on float trips with tons of beer and good music(kayaking and canoeing too!). With its 20 plus hours of play time it's great for a weekend of camping and or backpacking since it's only 2lb's! Quick recharge makes it easy for a three hour excursion on your long board after a 30 min charge!  Doing outdoor sports with music, playing ultimate frisbee, football, soccer, baseball, you name it and this thing can be heard over anything. I lived in a fraternity house with my neighbors all competing for the loudest speakers but this little guy packs the loudest punch through it all, it's 360 beet the directional speakers every single party and was always heard down the hall! Plus they have great customer service, as you can tell I put this device through the works and after the little charging port on the inside(only problem I ever had!!) got bent because of the terrible angle I was charging it at, they sent me a new one free of charge! Oh PS it totally hangs so get a carabiner or some para cord and hang that sucker from EVERYTHING for maximum noise!! Oh and PSS enjoy your great purchase way better than any other speaker on the market!

author: JDW
title: WOW. And apparently waterproof (?) besides
body: Well, what can I say?  You are going to be paying a lot for this item.  Do you get what you pay for?  I'm not sure.  You get a lot, yes, but it is not perfect, nor is it to everyone's tastes.When they say party speaker, they mean it.  It can be VERY loud, as loud as your typical portable boombox (but obviously more compact and with bluetooth).  It is also EXTREMELY bassy, to the point where for some folks and some types of music, it will definitely be too bassy.  With alternative rock, for instance, the bass guitar overpowers everything.  This can't be changed unless you have the ability to download the accompanying app (iOS or Android) which lets you fiddle with the EQ somewhat.  It will still be really bassy, though, which means bassy voices go above others in podcasts, and bass guitar overpowers everything.  EQ helps.  I can understand their wanting to minimize the amount of buttons on the actual unit, thus leaving it to the app, and most folks who buy/use this will probably be able to get and use the app as well.  Not to mention it is a party speaker, and for dance music and stuff, people will be really impressed with the bass/volume output.Battery life is pretty fantastic.The carrying case it comes with would have been a great idea and really neat, but it does not latch.  It's about worthless.  For $300, a carrying case that actually works would have been nice.So, while this is pretty awesome, I am taking a star off because of the carrying case, the default sound balance, and the high price.  Maybe that is a little unfair of me.  I would go with 4 1/2 stars if I could.  I don't know what this kind of product costs to make or what the profit margin is either, which would help me with the score.  If they are making a huge profit on these, I would be a little less forgiving.  On the other hand, if these are expensive to make...Oddly enough, this unit is also waterproof.  Does this mean it can sit in the pool with you?  Not sure.  Go in the shower?  Maybe.  Go to the beach?  I don't know.  With a $300 speaker, who is going to want to test this?  I'd be scared of it getting ruined.  Could be a great feature if properly explained.Speaking of explanation, there are no instructions really.  It is quite easy to pair, but instructions explaining features (like being waterproof and to what extent and how to download/use the apps--make sure you get the correct app! there's more than one!) are missing.All things considered, going with 4 stars for a really impressive, great sounding speaker with great battery life, ridiculously bassy sound (seriously), great volume, good quality, possibly waterproof--with a few bells and whistles that aren't really up to what I'd expect (having to use the app for EQ, useless carrying case, lack of instructions).

author: Darrell Nguyen
title: Best investment.
body: Price is steep but definitely worth the investment. All my friends are impressed by it when I bring it out for parties and gatherings. The thing I love most is the self shut off feature when you are not playing any music. I hope this thing does it job for years to come.

author: Amazon Customer
title: T-Mobile Purchase brings same great speaker quality. RECOMMEND.
body: Just picked it up from T Mobile in the Midnight Magenta color scheme and oh my gosh is this thing awesome! Super loud in doors and great sound quality for a wireless speaker. It does come with a aux input at the bottom where the charging slot is, in case you aren't into wireless or if you feel wired brings better sound.

author: Alex Blackman
title: Best speaker
body: This is probably my favorite thing that I have ever bought. The sound quality is amazing, and there is just enough bass but it's not over powering. I have found that to make it better for me I just play around with the eq. They sound great when they are paired, it gives a type of immersion into the music that you have to do to know what I'm talking about. Truly amazing speakers

author: saundra lewis
title: Great sound
body: Partys

author: Bryan
title: Perfect take everywhere speaker
body: Beautiful sound and you can change the placement to get different sounds (corner of a room to project sound etc). This thing gets louder than I expected. I watched YouTube comparisons with this and it was slammed by some. I don't get it as this sounds great and has every rugged feature you need. Speaker phone is better than most as well. For $199, you can't go wrong

author: knitting ninja
title: A-ma-zing.  The best small all-in-one speaker I have heard.
body: This is a truly amazing portable speaker.  From opening the hard shell presentation case to listening to music, the UE Megaboom is a delight.In the reusable case, there is the speaker, a USB charging block and - in an easily missed separate compartment on the bottom - a USB cable.  What is lacking are any instructions.  Fortunately pairing was so easy with my Galax S5 none were needed.  The volume is controlled by the phone volume or the big plus/minus icons seen on the front of the speaker.For the most functionality, there is a phone app that provides several useful features.  With it you can adjust sound quality via an EQ interface, pair Megaboom speakers, set an alarm and update the speaker firmware.  My only trouble with using the speaker came with the app install.  Or should I say the wrong app install.  I found out the hard way that there is a UE Boom app and a UE Megaboom app.  Google play pulled up the more seasoned UE Boom app first with my search so I installed it.  It did not work.  Tech support was very nice in working with me to solve the issue (with no wait time I might add) and after installing the correct app everything worked just as it should.Then there is the sound.  Wow.  Just wow.  The range and quality are impressive.  The bass is outstanding.  The room filling capability amazing.  Compared to my other portable Bluetooth speakers -  a Jabra SoulMate, a larger Altec Lancing, an Edifier – well actually there is no comparison.  The Megaboom is the best sounding speaker of its size and portability I have yet to hear.  In addition it is waterproof, light, has great Bluetooth range and has upgragable firmware.  The only thing I can think of that could improve is the USB connection.  No Mini USB cord I own would fit it.  Only the one that came with it would fit because the opening on the speaker bottom is oddly shaped and small.

author: warmgirl
title: Five Stars
body: I love the volume and sound of this speaker.  BOOM!!

author: Tomer
title: The castumer service was great and I got a replacement
body: After three months it stopped charging. The castumer service was great and I got a replacement, but I don't feel confident about this speaker anymore.

author: Amazon Customer
title: the sound quality is amazing.
body: I had this speaker for one year now , there is no problem which i faced till date , the sound quality is amazing.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Totally Worth It
body: I bought it on Cyber Monday for $200 and it was a very good purchase. The sound quality is great, the app constantly has new updates which you can use it's equalizer. Although I haven't tried it yet, the PartyUp option sounds awesome. It is very loud and good for a party on it's own. Very satisfied.

author: Beetsrimesandlyfe
title: Great speaker!  Until it’s not.
body: Be warned!  This thing is great!  ...for a while.  Eventually it will rattle your ears off, and not in a good way.  Admittedly, my unit has been dropped a few times.  I assume something came loose inside, and now any music with bass even at moderate volumes sounds like the thing is wrapped in cellophane.  Turn it up and it sounds horrible.

author: Hilisa
title: These are wonderful and the bass is surprisingly good for this size ...
body: These are wonderful and the bass is surprisingly good for this size speaker! I love how long the battery last, how loud they play and that you can pair them up!

author: Kathy R
title: Great Sound
body: The sound that emanates from this speaker is amazing. Range is great and the sound quality is exceptional.Love the carrying case that holds the speaker and the charging cord. Very compact and manageable size.I am not a "techie" so had some initial difficulty figuring out pairing, but with a little help from the internet found it to be pretty simple! Would be nice to have some printed instructions for those who need them!

author: AmazonFan
title: The new standard in wireless Bluetooth speakers
body: I have tried several premium wireless Bluetooth speakers and most are fine when used inside. But take them on a deck or patio and sound volume and quality diminishes greatly. So I was eager to try the UE Megaboom speaker.Cutting to the chase, I am so impressed, I just ordered a second one to take advantage of the ability to simultaneously connect two speakers to one source - a real plus when it comes to outdoor use (think picnics, parties and tailgating).The design of the UE Megaboom is sleek and simple. Pairing with several devices all worked well (iPhone, iPad, Kindle Fire and even a Blackberry Q10). The Bluetooth and power controls are discreetly placed at the bottom of the speaker and volume controls are represented by a large "+" and "-" on the side. There is a small hook on the top if you want to hang it rather than set it on a tabletop.As for the sound, it really is amazing - rich and full - and the Bluetooth range easily hit the 100' mark (outside in an open, flat yard).A separate travel case is available but the one that this comes in should be more than enough for most people - it is sturdy and offers good protection for the speaker.I'm no audiophile and the last person you would expect to be touting a $300 speaker but it is worth every penny.

author: Walt D.
title: I would purchase again !!!
body: This is a Wonderful unit. Great for traveling, home and private listening. The people who have had problems must be the problem. This unit is better than the Beats and surpasses it hands above the rest.

author: C713V
title: UE BOOM
body: The speaker is very awesome for music. Flat out the best sound in the market. I really love this thing and want another one..

author: Gina B.
title: M
body: Just replaced a Bose Soundlink (which I loved, but the speaker has given me a lot of trouble lately, and Bose support was no ok). Anyway, I treated myself to this one. It's awesome, but think the sound could better for the size b

author: Harrison Collett
title: Great speaker
body: This thing is awesome.  I use it for multiple hours everyday; I only have to charge it about once a week. The Bluetooth syncs amazingly smooth with my phone, so all I have to do is turn it on and press play on my phone. The sound quality is terrific; the best portable speaker I have ever heard (I think it rivals the stereo set up I have at my house to be honest)Awesome device

author: The Pink Heart
title: awesome features, love that it can connect with other ...
body: incredible sound, awesome features, love that it can connect with other devices in the same family and that it's waterproof. I do not like that you cannot go back and forth to change songs. You can hit the device to go forward, but there is no "back" button, which is exceedingly frustrating, especially when you love a song and want to hear it a second time.

body: Amazing sound. I had trouble charging outside of the factory warranty. I called Logitech and they sent me a new one no charge. I love the new party mode. You can add so many speakers.

author: Billy

body: Probably better than anything this portable. Also deceptively light weight.

body: Was given this for Christmas last year, and it is still running strong. The charging is not well thought out and only seems to work half of the time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Motorcycle Speakers
body: I have this mounted on my Harley and can hear it with the loud pipes. VERY clear.  Great for cruising around town.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Unreliable and faulty - worked as intended for only a few weeks, company will not fix.
body: Unreliable and faulty product with no support offered by UE. Company has issued faulty firmware updates that create problems with the unit. In my case the battery no longer functions so its strictly a plug in unit no longer portable. Company will not reply to requests to have the product looked at nor will they offer a solution to fix it. For a product in this price range it is unacceptable, a quick look at the companies own forum reveals the extent of problems people are having with this faulty design and firmware. Avoid this and stick to other companies offering reliable products and support. This product is not worth your time.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for volume but battery life no where near 20 ...
body: Great for volume but battery life no where near 20 hours died from a full charge in 6 hours ..plus it has overheating issues..and will not play when hot ...i live in so cal

author: CCU/RN
title: DO NOT BUY, Horrible customer service!
body: First impression: Solid feel with seemingly good manufacturing.  No issues at all with syncing to iPhone, effortless set up.  Speaker could get pretty loud, more than enough for a get together or backyard BBQ.  Sound was good for a portable BT speaker, but NOT worth the price.  I have honestly heard BT speakers that are comparable or better for half the price.  The EQ, is a joke.  The sound field was a lot better than one directional speakers, but not 360 as advertised.  I set it up on the center of my patio table and walked around a few times....there were definitely spots that were dull.  The battery life was great, and the protection from elements was a plus.Second impression:  I have now owned the unit for nearly 7 weeks, and it has progressively gotten more disappointing as time went on.  My battery life continued to get shorter and shorter each time I used it.  I would fully charge it and set it aside for a day or so and when powered on for use, the battery would be half gone?  Odd considering it was not used, on, or messed with and the battery kept draining.  Even if I had paid HALF of what I paid for this that performance is UNACCEPTABLE!  All of the things that drew me to the speaker no longer mattered.  I guess none of it really matters if your speaker keeps dying.  Sadly I had such high hopes for this speaker, but it was a HUGE disappointment and a waste of time and money.  Oh and UE's customer support was horrible, I will never buy a UE product again, guaranteed!The high point: I ordered it from Crutchfield and was able to return it.

author: Jennie Sydney
title: Great sound, long battery life, awesome design.
body: I got the Megaboom after an attempt to enjoy the Bose Soundlink Color. Not only does it live up to it's long battery life (watched 2 season's of Game of Thrones without needing to charge it) but it has great full-room dynamic sound. It charges fast, connects to bluetooth reliably, and although the iPhone app could be improved, it is kind of nice to be able to change the volume from my iPhone.I can also stand it up vertical or horizontal to get different types of sound.I recommend this to anyone looking for full-room sound hands-down over most other options out there. It's a bit pricey for personal sound, but if you're a music aficionado and you like hearing the highs, lows and mids of every song, then it's definitely worth it. It travels great and is smartly designed. You get 360 degree sound, verses most other bluetooth speakers that offer one direction sound.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great Bluetooth speakers With app you can pair 2 speakers ...
body: Great Bluetooth speakersWith app you can pair 2 speakers and have home stereo quality soundBattery life is said to be 18 or 20 hrs,have not tested this but they have never disappointed.

author: JBebe
title: Sweet speaker with great sound
body: I love having such an easy-to-use bluetooth speaker with such AWESOME sound to use with my iPhone. This little speaker has got some GREAT sound. It is so easy to use, just turn on the bluetooth on your device and on the speaker and voila, you're in business. The battery life is  super long. I love that you can place it standing upright or lay it down horizontally; either way the sound is amazing.I love the compact size of this thing - why have a huge old speaker in your home when you can have this small little portable one that works just as well? You can take it anywhere and know that that battery will last a long time. Take it outside for parties, keep it inside, take it camping, whatever. It is small and sleek-looking. Even the charging cord is kind of awesome-looking - lime green, flat design.One thing that is mentioned in the description is that it is "waterproof." However, when you read the instructions it says to keep it away from water and moisture. So, that is something I don't really want to test out, don't want to ruin this awesome speaker!

author: chris

body: The speaker its self is pretty amazing, but only the UE charger works with it. If you have problems the support is terrible. The worst support I have ever dealt with. It took over a month to get my issued resolved. Their support takes 4-5 days to respond, they will ask you to try something else then take a week to respond when you tell them it did not work. Support is TERRIBLE

body: Certainly a great purchase for portable bluetooth speakers out on the market; with 360° sound, 20 hours of battery life (depending on how you use it), being IPX7 waterproof, and the look itself, was a great for the price I payed for them.

author: Christian Silva
