body: All I gotta say is. It was completely worth it. Water proof, can connect to other boom speakers. It is just the best. Also how the features for the app can switch from music to movies

author: Amazon Customer
title: Huge music lover here. At just over 2 years ...
body: Huge music lover here. At just over 2 years, the speaker just blew and battery no longer works. Too expensive for the lifespan.

author: VINCENT CHEN
title: Is the Megaboom a boon to your listening prayers?
body: For its intended purpose a better speaker you will not find. Compared to the best I have heard. Blue tooth or wired powered monitors, this UE Megaboom puts on a good show.Big pluses.Dynamics. It has some guts. If you get 2 of them and run the free app for IOS, and Android.  You get Stereo configuration, Equalization, discrete mono assignment, and much more. 300.00 is allot of money for a portable speaker. My reference speakers in the affordable wired, and Bluetooth speakers are Emotiva Audio's Airmotiv 4s, and Stealth 3B speakers. See www.Emotiva.com for more.The UE boom like I said is dynamic. Will project well. Will keep on going till the onset of amplifier compression. Then it gets congested, and out of sorts. But compared to others, it does pretty well. Tonality is quite good, but a bit woolly in the midrange for its own good. Highs a bit soft too. Usable bass is quite good, well defined, and controlled. Noticeable drop off below 200Hz but even still a good showing.Detail is a bit lacking favoring the big picture more than any close listening may reward. Contrast to the Emotiva Stealth 3B speakers which have better detail, and resolution. Also since they are less than 300.00 a pair, a bargain too. They are a more at your desk kind of speaker solution. The UE Megaboom goes everywhere. It can get wet, and still work. Stains just wipe off too! The hook on the bottom makes hanging it in Your patio easy.  You pick the colors you like. The black strikes me fine.Battery life is quite good. Easily a full day of enjoyment on a full charge via a USB micro connection with the provided wall charger wart. A cheap switcher power supply type.Overall this is a much better speaker than the UE boom in ultimate terms. Richer and fuller flavor. Missed are few like the price. 300 dollars for some is not going to work for a speaker like this. A shame really, because for what you get, it is good value for the on the go listener, maybe a desk type if you get 2 of them for stereo. That is 600 dollars! For that money you could buy powered monitors by Emotiva audio that will sound better, cost less, and will hook up to your phone no problem. Only thing, the UE Megaboom can go places the Emotiva Airmotiv can't. Are the. 300 to 600 dollars extra worth it too you?A personal decision sure, but a much needed asked question as these UE Megaboom times 2 can do the job well for what they are.

author: Amazon Customer
title: No Charge
body: Considering the other reviews Ive read and the fact that the battery cant hold charge right out of the package... 1 star. Will be returning mine.

author: Curtis
title: DO NOT BUY!!!
body: DO. NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT. I purchased this 4 months ago and since then have had to get 5 replacements through the best buy eek squad program. The power turns on for 3 seconds and then turns off and there is no fix for it. ALL FIVE have had this issue

author: Amazon Customer
title: Don't buy, major bug on update and UE won't give you any solution.
body: So I had a great experience with my UE Boom, so I decided to go further and get the UE Megaboom. The thing is that after 15 minutes of use the app asked me to perform the latest update (which I did) and from that moment on my UE Megaboom failed to stay on and it is just rebooting every 2 seconds, leaving no space for me to make a hard reset or connect to any sort of device, such as my computer, wall charger etc.It's a great speaker but UE is failing to respond on this issue, and every day there's more people with the same problem as I have (and I know because I've read every thread on their forum).So, if you're thinking of buying this product take into account that you may be one of us, the ones who are getting no response at all, and that have an useless speaker just filling space on our rooms.

author: Marco Passalacqua
title: Extremely satisfied customer
body: Sounds amazing. Extremely durable, and easy to use. Recommend this to anyone. WORTH EVERY PENNY. DO NOT BUY A BEATS PILL!!!

author: Morgan Coble
title: Already quit
body: Ordered this speaker on July 10, 2017 and it was delivered a week later. Now today, September 27, 2017 it keeps saying critical battery. Placed the speaker on to charge and it will not charge. Now cannot figure how to return it on amazon. Seems like a $200 plus dollar speaker should have a longer life then a little over 2 months.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Software/firmware updates ruin this speaker
body: I really liked my speaker for a few months but made the mistake of downloading the app which tricked me into updating the speaker. It is now a useless piece of junk and ue support is just as useful

author: Andres Duque
title: Five Stars
body: Clear and loud and I love it

author: Daniel O'Connor
title: The Bees Knees⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
body: This is the bees knees, 5/5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ I had a ue boom before the megaboom and the megaboom destroys the ue boom. Especially when it comes to base. Well worth the money👌

author: R. J. Regan III
title: Do Not Buy The MegaBoom, Light $300 on Fire, Poke Yourself in the Eye & Be Less Frustrated with the Outcome
body: We bought the UE MEGABOOM Wireless Bluetooth Speaker, Charcoal Black (984-000436) for our wedding's smaller gatherings. I will give this a single star for the two weeks that it worked ok before the wedding (and because I can't give it zero stars). The sound was fine, deeper and louder than our Booms. We even upgraded the firmware as we were instructed so that we could pair the Megaboom to our Booms, which sounded really great across the house. But, then...... it just stopped charging. We turned it on and announced "critical battery", even though we had barely used it since the last charge.The battery immediately went completely dead and won't charge at all.Logitech won't do anything about it now after several weeks. They want us to update the firmware again, but they are ignoring the important detail that the device has no power and will not take a charge in any circumstance (we have tried everything from original charger to USB-to-computer and more).This is sad because we loved the 4 Booms we have in the family and we were loving our MegaBoom, but instead, we have a $300 brick and Logitech won't get another dime from us again in the future.Just in case you think we got a lemon, read reviews here on Amazon and across the internet and you'll find this is a widespread issue that has no apparent user cause. This product is defective and Logitech will not support it!

author: Austin Eskandari
title: Terrible Product
body: "waterproof" is inaccurate. If you want a waterproof speaker then go with another speaker. If you don’t need the speaker to be waterproof then go with another speaker. My speaker got wet a hand full of times and stopped working after a few. I called Logitech customer support and they sent me a new one. the new one stopped working after the second time it got wet!! Worse than the speaker itself is logitech's customer support! The are incompetent and not friendly at all! It was like pulling teeth dealing with them and I wouldn’t wish my worst enemy to have to deal with them

UE4 Hours is the Max you can play ur music with Bluetooth and 100% of the volumeTheir claim is really misleading

title: Great upgrade from original

author: Customer 123455555
title: Five Stars
body: The best portable speaker! cutting edge technologies. damn good

author: Steven Oritz
title: Get it if you want it!
body: Bought this in best buy two days ago. Sounds amazing. No complaints.Update: Over three weeks of sporadic usage and still have have the need to charge it. Great bluetooth distance. Only negative is that there's only one case  available for sale for this product and not Prime elegible ($12 shipping)

author: S. Templar
title: Freakin' Awesome ! ! !  (with a couple less awesome observations)
body: While I personally do love this speaker, I must address some of the features and issues that I and my family experienced.The Ease of use with iPhones and Windows phones cannot be over stated.  This thing just turns on, the phone sees it and (BAM!) you are connected and jamming to awesome tunes.  However, none of our Android devices could even see this speaker, let alone connect to it.  Direct phono-cable connection took care of that though.The sound quality and presence are truly quite amazing for such a portable system (I can pick out individual back up singers), the sound fills the room.  That is, when you are listening to 60's, 70's, 80's, 90's music.  Instrumental, Jazz, piano and harpsichord music also sound lovely from this speaker.However, as soon as you jump into the 21st century you find that some of the layers are lost when listening to extremely complex music (Evanescence for example), especially complex Techno.  Most people don't have sound systems good enough to know what they are missing, and perhaps it isn't fair to compare this sub-$299 waterproof ultra-portable speaker to our $550 Boston Acoustic home theater / stereo system or my wife's $2,000 Bose sound system (in her Jaguar).  Still, I wan't people to understand what they are getting so they are happy with their purchase.(Update: To address the comment below about compressed audio files I should point out that I tested all mentioned systems using exactly the same mp3 64bit compressed audio sources.  The differences were obvious and not caused by variations of source encoding.)This is, by far, the best sounding and most earth shattering truly portable speaker system that I have ever encountered.  Add to that, it's water proof!  This is an amazing option for those on the go.  That it works as speaker/microphone for your phone is a seriously cool added bonus.  Given how loud I was able to get the caller on the other side of the line to sound in my house (way too loud), I contend that you could use this as a speaker for a presentation in a small auditorium for someone who is not physically able to attend.  Even at that extreme volume the audio was clear and crisp.One complaint that has absolutely nothing to do with this speakers functions or quality is the marketing angle.  The company seems to be attempting to appeal to everyone and in so doing is really losing many.  Fine, let's take it up to 11 (Dang I'm old, I know that reference from when it was in theaters, before there were DVD's and Blu-ray), but given the state of the world today it is simply not acceptable nor reasonable to market in a way that promotes riots and mayhem.  That is just poorly thought out and, in all honesty, probably actionable.Finally, the packaging and presentation:  This is another hit for the MegaBoom.  The packaging is very high end and the presentation says quality all the way.  That one could save and use the quality packaging for transport and travel is an awesome added bonus that I didn't see coming.Another fine bonus is the included instruction for how to be environmentally responsible and dispose of the battery when you are, eventually, done with this product.  That is a nice bonus that most products miss the mark on.Highly Recommended!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not worth $250, that's for sure
body: For $250 ($270 with taxes) for me this is garbage. And I'm being completely honest here. Bought this on Best Buy yesterday (didn't have a chance to test, there was no demo piece available), but I'm going to return it right away today. It has no bass whatsoever, I had the Bose soundlink mini 2, and I think its bass kicked heavier, and it was almost 1/3 of the size, and costs $100 less. The beats pill+ bass also kicks heavier, had it too, and it also costs less. The bass here is extremely shallow and artificial. It's very very stiff, stay encased inside the box, doesn't flow almost at all. It only gets a little, but only a little better if you crank the volume considerably up. But at lower volumes, for $270, this is a piece of crap. Really very disappointed on this, expected more from UE, that's why I bought it blindly. If this cost $90 I would say it could be worth the price, but for almost $300? There's just no way.

author: david l. poremba
title: excellent quality speaker
body: this was incredibly easy to set up and the music sounds too good to be true. I love this speaker, use it in my office connected (wirelessly) to my computer.

author: Adeline	Sandoval
title: Highly recommended!
body: I want t o help other shoppers make their decision.

author: oluv
title: Rugged but lacking in overall sound quality
body: Neither is the Megaboom really loud, nor does it sound really good. The term "mega" is really pushing it a bit far I guess, as the performance of this speaker is below average if just sound quality alone is considered especially looking at the asked price. The sound is extremely colored with lots of honky upper bass, but no depth, and treble is non existent, especially if not one of the both drivers is not facing you directly, this makes the 360° claim a bit absurd, as most of the time you will have to get along with a rather dull sound.But there was always lots of hype around UE products, and the Megaboom seems to continue with this fashion.Where the Megaboom really shines is ruggedness and maybe features, you can pair 2 for wireless stereo, you have can turn it off/on remotely through the app and other nice stuff, but I wouldn't choose it for listening to music.If you want it really loud, check out the Riva Turbo X, which outclasses the Megaboom with a much more serious sound, better bass response and a more Hifi-like tuning while being louder at the same time. If you want a more refined sound at lower levels with much better stereo imaging that you can put inside your pocket, check out the Denon Envaya Mini, which makes the Megaboom sound really funny although it won't play near as loud as the Megaboom, this is rather a speaker to scream out loud without finesse. If you want to go diving with your speaker, or play american football with it, the Megaboom should do the trick, but anyone serious about music and quality of sound will make a big circle around the Megaboom and spend the 300 bucks somewhere else.

author: Julius Caluya
title: Five Stars
body: Excellent Bluetooth speaker

author: Patriot
title: Disappointed!
body: Beautiful product until it goes dead and then it does not accept a charge.  Apparently like so many other "smart" devices it requires an update, whereas you need to download the program to your computer and upload it to the speaker.....however even after doing so, the charging light is not coming on.  For an update.....maybe!  An update just to accept a charge for a $300.00 speaker???

author: joj
title: Loud and Great SOund
body: Love it Love it Love it.  It is one of the best portable speakers i ever had.  It delivers really high quality sound and its loud.

author: Scott Albertine
title: The best speaker on the planet.
body: Oh my.  This thing.  Wow.  I'd do a page-long rant about how this is the greatest speaker ever, but that'd be boring, so I'll trim it down to a list of things the marketing info doesn't already tell you:They are not kidding about the waterproofness.  Take a shower with it, take a 3 hour bike ride through pouring rain, drop it in your bathtub, no problem. THAT SAID, IT IS NOT SALT-WATER PROOF.  Their marketing material literally says "take it to the beach", which I did, but it was a salt-water beach, and after that it stopped working.  This review is for the second one I bought after the first one stopped working, because frankly it's such a good speaker that it's worth it.They are not kidding about the shock-proofing.  This thing has survived 4 foot drops straight onto concrete, not a scratch.They are not kidding about the "Mega" part of the sound.  It's louder than a city bus, with punchy bass and no rattling or distortion, even at max volume.They ARE kidding about the 20 hour battery life.  I get 6 solid hours at max volume, continuous play over bluetooth.  Your mileage may vary but I've found it to be very consistent.They are only half kidding about the "pair it to a second speaker".  It works as advertised, but it drops the range on both speakers to hilariously short, I'd say a maximum of about 15 feet, before the music starts cutting in and out randomly.  That said, the timing is perfect, there's absolutely no lag between the two speakers.The multi-host thing works... decently well.  My macbook hogs it for some reason so that if I turn on the speaker while the laptop is on, it never connects to my phone.  That said, it'll switch off between my phone and my friend's phone no problem, no buttons required, one of us stops playing music and the other starts, within 10 seconds it'll cut over.The D-ring clip is great, but I recommend using blue Loctite on the threads so it won't unscrew itself.

author: BMANKINGS

body: Awesome Speaker, deep bass, loud as fudge! Waterproof! I don’t suggest salt water though cause salt water tends to erode everything! But anyways awesome speaker!

title: Five Stars
body: Just as advertised. Now guests want one!

author: Eagle Vision
title: Powerful speakers with a great battery life in a portable size.
body: What comes in the box?AC AdapterMicro USB cableSpeakerThe packaging is reusable as a carrying or storage box.The UE Megaboom by Logitech is a very powerful speaker system.  I have purchased this speaker based upon reading reviews prior to purchasing.  The battery life is incredible, and it exceeds the battery life of anything in its class.  It is simple to operate and pair with your Bluetooth enabled device.  The large volume buttons are easy to handle and adjust, especially with wet hands.The construction is solid and it is waterproof.  The access ports for the input jack and the Micro USB cable are sealed.  At the bottom, there is a hook that makes for a good way to hang the speakers out of your way.  It is about as tall as my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 is tall.  The size is similar to an Arizona Tea or 40 ounce beer can.  This has some serious girth and weight so it is stable for outdoor use in wind.The sound quality is incredible.  It has a covers bass, midrange and treble equally well.  The bass is more vibrant than average speakers.  I plan to acquire a second speaker  to get more of a stereo effect outdoors.  However, the sound coming from this single speaker is nothing short of immersive in an enclosed room.  Placing it close to a wall, allows the sound to reflect back towards you giving a unique effect, also.There is an app available through the Apple App store but I do not see an advantage unless I have a pair of these speakers.  So I just ordered a second speaker for the purpose of a stereo effect.  Once I get my second speaker, I will update the review.For its size, it is the best in its class for similar sized speakers.  It is very powerful, and there is no distortion even with the maximum volume level for any genre of music.

author: CameronC
title: We love this speaker
body: Where has this been all my life? We love this speaker. It is great out by the pool, for a day on the boat or on the beach. Even better is the massive battery life easily able to run all day or used heavily through a weekend.

author: CM
title: I love this speaker
body: I love this speaker! Beautiful, clear sound. I had one issue initially: The sound was quieter when the speaker paired with my Samsung tablet (in comparison to my iPhone). I was able to fix this by increasing the volume directly on the speaker after pairing it with my tablet. I have not had any issues since. Highly recommend this speaker.

author: Zaynah Williams
title: A must buy
body: I actually purchased the magenta midnight from T-Mobile and I have to say that this is by far the best speaker I've owned. I have the beats pill,  mega pill and a jbl extreme. The megaboom tops all 3. Put it in a corner for an even louder experience

author: Robi
title: Don't forget about Megaboom 2. Who knows...
body: I use this product to hear to music, ok? 😅 Really now, is an awesome speaker from all points of view, until you turn the volume to max, then it's when you lose the bass quality. How? Simply, you will not hear/feel the bass anymore. BUT HEY, I fell in love with this one and I don't care about others.

author: GWP
title: Great quality. Seriously long battery life and great sound
body: Great quality. Seriously long battery life and great sound. Place near a wall to enhance bass sound. Can sync two together.. Free updates .. Just a Great product.
